1500.title: Recapture of Milan
1500.summary: Duke Ludovico Sforza recaptures Milan, but is soon driven out again by the French.

1500.title: Pinzón Reaches Brazil
1500.summary: Spanish navigator Vicente Yáñez Pinzón reaches the northern coast of Brazil.

1500.title: Swiss Mercenary Army Retakes Milan
1500.summary: Ludovico Sforza's Swiss mercenary army retakes the city of Milan from the French during the Second Italian War.

1500.title: Battle of Hemmingstedt
1500.summary: The Danish army fails to conquer the peasants' republic of Dithmarschen.

1500.title: Cabral Departs for New World
1500.summary: Pedro Álvares Cabral departs Portugal on a voyage to the New World with a fleet of 13 ships.

1500.title: Discovery of Brazil
1500.summary: Pedro Álvares Cabral and his crew become the first Europeans to discover Brazil, anchoring at Monte Pascoal and naming the country Vera Cruz.

1500.title: Treaty for Marriage of Arthur and Catherine
1500.summary: Representatives of the English and Spanish royal families sign a treaty for the marriage of Arthur, Prince of Wales, to Princess Catherine of Aragon.

1500.title: Publication of Distillation Guide
1500.summary: The first guide to distilling liquor is published by Hieronymus Brunschwig.

1500.title: Papal Bull for Crusade
1500.summary: Pope Alexander VI issues a papal bull calling on a Roman Catholic crusade against the Ottoman Empire.

1500.title: Siege of Pisa
1500.summary: A combined force of troops from France and the Republic of Florence lay siege to the city of Pisa.

1501.title: Cesar Borgia returns to Rome
1501.summary: Cesar Borgia returns triumphantly to Rome after his campaign in Romagna, marking a significant moment in the politics of Italy.

1501.title: Minkhaung II becomes King of Burma
1501.summary: Minkhaung II becomes the sole King of Burma upon the death of his son Thihathura II, marking an important transition in Burmese royalty.

1501.title: Rebellion in the Alpujarras ends
1501.summary: The Rebellion in the Alpujarras concludes in southern Spain with a treaty that offers Muslim insurgents a choice between expulsion or conversion.

1501.title: First printed collection of polyphonic music
1501.summary: Harmonice Musices Odhecaton, the first printed collection of polyphonic music, is published in Venice, significantly impacting European music.

1501.title: King Federico of Naples surrenders
1501.summary: The Kingdom of Naples, under King Federico I, surrenders to Cesare Borgia's forces, influencing the balance of power in Italy.

1501.title: Battle of the Siritsa River
1501.summary: The Livonian Order defeats an army of Moscow and Pskov in the Battle of the Siritsa River, affecting the conflict dynamics in the region.

1501.title: Maximilian I's firearms safety decree
1501.summary: Maximilian I issues a decree to make firearms safety tests mandatory, reflecting a shift in military regulation in Europe.

1501.title: Treaty of Trente signed
1501.summary: The Treaty of Trente is signed recognizing French conquests in northern Italy, a key moment in Italian-French relations.

1501.title: Amerigo Vespucci discovers Baía de Todos os Santos
1501.summary: Amerigo Vespucci discovers and names Baía de Todos os Santos in Brazil, contributing to the European understanding of the New World.

1501.title: Ismail I is enthroned as Shah of Iran
1501.summary: Ismail I is enthroned as the first Shah of Iran, founding the Safavid dynasty and establishing Shi'ism as the state religion.

1502.title: Portuguese explorers sail into Guanabara Bay
1502.summary: Portuguese explorers, led by Gonçalo Coelho, sail into Guanabara Bay, Brazil, mistaking it for the mouth of a river, which they name Rio de Janeiro.

1502.title: Marriage agreement between Scotland and England
1502.summary: Commissioners from Scotland and England meet at Richmond Palace in London to finalize an agreement on the marriage between Scotland's King James IV to the daughter of England's King Henry VII, the princess Margaret Tudor.

1502.title: Issuing of the edict outlawing Islam
1502.summary: Isabella I issues an edict outlawing Islam in the Crown of Castile, forcing virtually all her Muslim subjects to convert to Christianity.

1502.title: Departure of the new Viceroy of the New World
1502.summary: The new Viceroy of the New World, Nicolás de Ovando, departs Spain with a fleet of 30 ships and orders to replace Viceroy Francisco de Bobadilla at Santo Domingo.

1502.title: Christopher Columbus prepares for fourth voyage
1502.summary: Christopher Columbus begins preparation for his fourth and final voyage, with the goal of finding a westward passage in the New World to link the Atlantic Ocean to the Indian Ocean.

1502.title: Arthur, Prince of Wales dies
1502.summary: Arthur, Prince of Wales, dies of a long illness less than five months after marrying Catherine of Aragon, leading to his brother Henry becoming the new heir to the throne.

1502.title: Formal coronation of Ivan the Great
1502.summary: The formal coronation of Ivan the Great as Grand Prince of Moscow to reflect that he is the nation's sole ruler.

1502.title: Discovery of Saint Helena
1502.summary: Portuguese navigator João da Nova discovers the uninhabited island of Saint Helena.

1502.title: Christopher Columbus's final trip begins
1502.summary: Christopher Columbus leaves Cadiz in Spain for his fourth and final trip to the New World, taking with him 147 men.

1502.title: Ismail I founds the Safavid dynasty
1502.summary: Ismail I founds the Safavid dynasty and proclaims himself the Shah of Iran after defeating tribes of the Aq Qoyunlu confederation.

1503.title: Battle of Cerignola
1503.summary: Spanish forces under Gonzalo Fernández de Córdoba defeat the French under Louis d'Armagnac, Duke of Nemours, who is killed, considered to be the first battle in history won by gunpowder small arms.

1503.title: Discovery of the Cayman Islands
1503.summary: Christopher Columbus discovers the Cayman Islands, which he names Las Tortugas, after the numerous sea turtles there.

1503.title: Battle of Seminara
1503.summary: Spanish forces under Fernando de Andrade de las Mariñas defeat the French under Bernard Stewart, 4th Lord of Aubigny.

1503.title: Capture of Naples
1503.summary: Naples is captured by the Spanish.

1503.title: Coronation of Moctezuma II
1503.summary: The coronation of Moctezuma II as ruler of the Aztec Empire takes place at the Aztec capital of Tenochtitlan, now part of Mexico City.

1503.title: Treaty for Marriage of Henry and Catherine
1503.summary: Representatives of King Henry VII of England and Queen Isabella of Spain sign a treaty for 12-year-old Henry, Prince of Wales to be married to Catherine of Aragon, widow of King Henry's son Arthur.

1503.title: Papal Election of Pope Julius II
1503.summary: Cardinal Giuliano della Rovere is elected the 216th Roman Catholic Pontiff at the end of the year's second papal conclave and takes the papal name Pope Julius II.

1503.title: Death of Pope Pius III
1503.summary: Pope Pius III dies less than four weeks after being elected, prompting the calling of the second papal conclave in as many months.

1503.title: Battle of Garigliano
1503.summary: The Battle of Garigliano takes place near Gaeta in Italy. Spanish forces under Gonzalo Fernández de Córdoba defeat a French-Italian mercenary army under Ludovico II, Marquess of Saluzzo.

1503.title: Publication of The Imitation of Christ
1503.summary: The book The Imitation of Christ by Thomas à Kempis is re-published in an English translation.

1504.title: Michelangelo's David Completed
1504.summary: Michelangelo's famous sculpture of David is completed in Florence, becoming a masterpiece of Renaissance art.

1504.title: French Troops Surrender Gaeta
1504.summary: French troops of King Louis XII surrender the city of Gaeta to the Spanish forces, marking a shift in power in Italy.

1504.title: Elected Regent of Sweden
1504.summary: Svante Nilsson is elected as the new Regent of Sweden following the death of Sten Sture the Elder, influencing Swedish politics.

1504.title: Treaty of Lyon
1504.summary: France cedes Naples to Ferdinand II of Aragon through the Treaty of Lyon, altering the political landscape of Italy.

1504.title: Treaty of Blois
1504.summary: The Treaty of Blois is signed, agreeing on terms between Philip I of Castile, Maximilian I, and Louis XII, shaping alliances in Europe.

1504.title: Battle of Knockdoe
1504.summary: A significant battle is fought in Ireland, where English and Irish forces clash, influencing Irish history.

1504.title: Royal Chapel in Granada
1504.summary: Queen Isabella and King Ferdinand issue a Royal Warrant for the construction of Capilla Real in Granada, influencing cultural heritage.

1504.title: Columbus Returns to Spain
1504.summary: Christopher Columbus returns to Spain from his fourth voyage, having explored the coasts of Central America, impacting European views of the New World.

1504.title: Death of Le Hien Tong
1504.summary: Emperor Le Hien Tong of Vietnam dies, leading to a succession change that affects the dynasty.

1504.title: Papal Reform of Coinage
1504.summary: Pope Julius II issues an order reforming the coinage of the Papal States, enhancing its economic standing.

1505.title: Papal Bull Cum tam divino
1505.summary: Pope Julius II decrees a reform in the Roman Catholic Church to prohibit simony, the buying and selling of church offices.

1505.title: Start of Lunkaran's Reign
1505.summary: Lunkaran begins his reign as the Rao of the Indian kingdom of Bikaner in Rajasthan.

1505.title: Treaty of Tordesillas
1505.summary: Pope Julius II sets the line of demarcation between Spain's and Portugal's territory in the New World.

1505.title: First Recorded Use of Tennis Rackets
1505.summary: Philip the Handsome plays tennis against Thomas Grey at Windsor Castle, marking the first recorded use of tennis rackets.

1505.title: Departure of Dom Francisco de Almeida
1505.summary: Dom Francisco de Almeida departs from Portugal with an armada to serve as Viceroy of Portuguese India.

1505.title: Act of Nihil novi
1505.summary: King Alexander Jagiellon agrees to the Act of Nihil novi, limiting the king's power to issue laws without noble consent.

1505.title: Re-founding of Christ's College, Cambridge
1505.summary: Christ's College is re-founded, receiving its charter from Lady Margaret Beaufort.

1505.title: M8.2 Earthquake in Nepal
1505.summary: A severe earthquake strikes Nepal, causing significant damage in Kathmandu and surrounding areas.

1505.title: Throne of Zhengde Emperor
1505.summary: Zhu Houzhao is enthroned as the Zhengde Emperor of Ming Dynasty China.

1505.title: Mass Execution in Kalmar
1505.summary: The Kalmar Bloodbath occurs, a mass execution of participants in the Swedish Uprising against King Hans of Denmark.

1506.title: Unearthing of Laocoön and His Sons
1506.summary: The classical statue of Laocoön and His Sons is unearthed in Rome. Pope Julius II purchases it and places it on public display in the Vatican.

1506.title: Foundation of St. Peter's Basilica
1506.summary: Pope Julius II lays the foundation stone of the new St. Peter's Basilica in Rome, replacing the Old St. Peter's Basilica.

1506.title: The Lisbon Massacre
1506.summary: The Lisbon Massacre begins in Portugal with three days of violence, in which thousands of Jews are tortured and killed by Catholics.

1506.title: Battle of Cannanore
1506.summary: Portugal's fleet defeats the fleet of the Zamorin of Calicut, with hundreds of vessels involved; 3,000 Muslim troops are killed.

1506.title: Death of Philip the Fair
1506.summary: Philip the Fair, Duke of Burgundy, becomes the ruler of the Spanish Kingdom of Castile but reigns for only two months before dying of typhoid.

1506.title: Surrender of Zozollan
1506.summary: Emperor Moctezuma II of Mexico's Aztec Empire subdues a rebellion in Zozollan, then kills the prisoners as a sacrifice to the gods.

1506.title: Battle of Kletsk
1506.summary: The Grand Duchy of Lithuania defeats the Tatars of the Crimean Khanate.

1506.title: Excommunication of Giovanni II Bentivoglio
1506.summary: Pope Julius II issues a bull excommunicating Giovanni II Bentivoglio from the Roman Catholic Church.

1506.title: Mob Revolt in Córdoba
1506.summary: In Córdoba, members of the nobility and the general public revolt against the Spanish inquisitor, liberating the imprisoned.

1506.title: Reign of Sigismund I the Old
1506.summary: Sigismund I the Old becomes King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania, reigning for more than 40 years.

1507.title: Waldseemüller maps America
1507.summary: Martin Waldseemüller publishes his Cosmographiae Introductio and accompanying wall map, the first to show the Americas as a separate continent, naming them in honour of Amerigo Vespucci.

1507.title: Sigismund I crowned King
1507.summary: Sigismund I the Old is formally crowned King of Poland, at a ceremony in Kraków.

1507.title: First sighting of Réunion
1507.summary: The crew of the Portuguese ship Cirne, commanded by Diogo Fernandes Pereira, become the first Europeans to sight the Indian ocean island of Réunion, and name it Santa Apolonia.

1507.title: Edict for New Christians
1507.summary: King Manuel I of Portugal issues an edict permitting the cristãos-novos ("New Christians", Portuguese Jews who had been forced to convert to Christianity) to freely emigrate from the kingdom.

1507.title: Cesare Borgia's conquest and death
1507.summary: Cesare Borgia completes his conquest of the Spanish city of Viana by driving out the defenders of the castle of the Count of Lerín, but is killed the next day by his captors.

1507.title: War against French invaders
1507.summary: The revolutionary council of the Republic of Genoa declares a war against French invaders.

1507.title: Ordination of Martin Luther
1507.summary: German monk Martin Luther is ordained by the suffragan bishop Johann Bonemilch as a priest of the Catholic Church.

1507.title: First Doge of Genoa in 19 years
1507.summary: Paolo da Novi becomes the first Doge of the Republic of Genoa in almost 19 years after the office had been vacant.

1507.title: Portuguese siege at Fort of Saint Angelo
1507.summary: Troops from the Kingdom of Cannanore begin a four-month siege of the Portuguese garrison at the Fort of Saint Angelo, but the defenders hold out.

1507.title: Patent for the first printing press in Scotland
1507.summary: King James IV grants a patent for the first printing press in Scotland to Walter Chapman and Andrew Myllar.

1508.title: Maximilian proclaims himself Holy Roman Emperor
1508.summary: Maximilian, King of the Romans, proclaims himself Holy Roman Emperor at the Italian city of Trento, after having been blocked by Venice from traveling to Rome to be crowned by Pope Julius II.

1508.title: Battle of Cadore
1508.summary: The Republic of Venice defeats Maximilian I in the Battle of Cadore.

1508.title: La Cassaria premiere
1508.summary: La Cassaria by Ludovico Ariosto, the first Italian language comedy, is premiered at Ferrara.

1508.title: Leonardo da Vinci's scientific discoveries
1508.summary: Leonardo da Vinci begins writing his collection without order of his scientific discoveries from his house in Florence.

1508.title: Michelangelo's contract
1508.summary: Michelangelo signs a contract with the Vatican to paint the Sistine Chapel ceiling, in return for a promised fee of 3,000 gold ducats.

1508.title: Coronation of Prince Lajos
1508.summary: The coronation of Prince Lajos as the designated successor to his father, King Vladislaus II of Hungary, takes place in Székesfehérvár.

1508.title: King Louis XII convenes court
1508.summary: King Louis XII of France convenes court at the Parlement de Normandie building in Rouen.

1508.title: Formation of the League of Cambrai
1508.summary: The League of Cambrai is formed as an alliance against the Republic of Venice, between Pope Julius II, Louis XII of France, Maximilian I, and Ferdinand II of Aragon.

1508.title: Death of Cardinal Galeotto Franciotti della Rovere
1508.summary: England is left without a Roman Catholic Cardinal protector when Cardinal Galeotto Franciotti della Rovere dies suddenly.

1508.title: Battle of Dabul
1508.summary: Portuguese forces, under Francisco de Almeida, attack Khambhat in the Battle of Dabul.

1509.title: Portuguese Arrival at Bombay
1509.summary: The Portuguese first arrive at the Seven Islands of Bombay and land at Mahim after capturing a barge of the Gujarat Sultanate in the Mahim Creek.

1509.title: Battle of Diu
1509.summary: The Portuguese defeat a coalition of Indians, Muslims and Italians.

1509.title: Naming of Margaretha as Land Guardian
1509.summary: Maximilian I, Holy Roman Emperor, names Margaretha land guardians of the Habsburg Netherlands.

1509.title: War Declaration by France
1509.summary: The Kingdom of France declares war on the Republic of Venice.

1509.title: Invasion of Venetian Territory
1509.summary: The French army under the command of Louis XII leaves Milan to invade Venetian territory, part of the War of the League of Cambrai and the Italian Wars.

1509.title: Henry VIII Becomes King of England
1509.summary: Henry VIII becomes King of England on the death of his father, Henry VII.

1509.title: Pope Julius II Places Venice Under Interdict
1509.summary: Pope Julius II places Venice under interdict and excommunication for refusing to cede part of Romagna to papal control.

1509.title: Battle of Agnadello
1509.summary: French forces defeat the Venetians, and the League of Cambrai occupies Venice's mainland territories.

1509.title: Henry VIII's Marriage
1509.summary: Henry VIII of England marries Catherine of Aragon.

1509.title: Luca Pacioli's Publication
1509.summary: Luca Pacioli's De divina proportione, concerning the golden ratio, is published in Venice, with illustrations by Leonardo da Vinci.

1510.title: Introduction of Sunflowers in Europe
1510.summary: Sunflowers are brought to Europe by Spaniards.

1510.title: Birth of Catherine of Aragon's First Child
1510.summary: Catherine of Aragon gives birth to her first child, a stillborn daughter.

1510.title: Henry VIII Jousts at Richmond
1510.summary: An 18-year-old Henry VIII of England jousts anonymously at Richmond, Surrey and draws applause, before revealing his identity.

1510.title: Laying out of the Mary Rose Ship
1510.summary: The Mary Rose ship is laid out, to be launched the next year and completed in 1512.

1510.title: Portuguese Conquest of Goa
1510.summary: Afonso de Albuquerque of Portugal conquers Goa, marking a significant expansion of Portuguese influence in Asia.

1510.title: Battle of Salt River
1510.summary: Indigenous Āuriāekua decisively defeat sailors of the Portuguese Empire in South Africa.

1510.title: Beginning of the Prince of Anhua Rebellion
1510.summary: Rebel leader Zhu Zhifan declares his intent to oust the powerful Ming dynasty eunuch Liu Jin, killing officials at a banquet.

1510.title: End of the Prince of Anhua Rebellion
1510.summary: Rebel leader Zhu Zhifan is defeated and captured by commander Qiu Yue, ending the rebellion against the Ming dynasty.

1510.title: Attack on French-occupied Genoa by the Holy League
1510.summary: The Holy League, formed to defend the Italian States, attacks French-occupied Genoa.

1510.title: Battle of Marv
1510.summary: Shah Ismail I defeats the Uzbek forces of Shaybani Khan, leading to the capture and death of Shaybani Khan.

1511.title: 1511 Idrija earthquake
1511.summary: The 1511 Idrija earthquake occurs, with a maximum Mercalli intensity of X (Extreme). It affects a large territory between Carinthia, Friuli, present-day Slovenia and Croatia.

1511.title: Foundation of St John's College
1511.summary: St John's College, Cambridge, England, founded by Lady Margaret Beaufort, receives its charter.

1511.title: Launch of Mary Rose
1511.summary: Henry VIII of England's flagship, the Mary Rose, is launched at Portsmouth.

1511.title: Capture of Malacca
1511.summary: Afonso de Albuquerque of Portugal conquers Malacca, giving Portugal control over the Strait of Malacca, vital for sea-going trade between China and India.

1511.title: Proclamation of Holy League
1511.summary: Pope Julius II proclaims a Holy League against French dominance in Italy, forming an alliance against France.

1511.title: Launch of Michael
1511.summary: James IV of Scotland's great ship, the Michael, is launched at Newhaven, Edinburgh; she is the largest ship afloat at this date.

1511.title: Treaty of Westminster
1511.summary: The Treaty of Westminster creates an alliance between Henry VIII of England and Ferdinand II of Aragon against France.

1511.title: Sinking of Frol de la Mar
1511.summary: The vessel Frol de la Mar, transporting Afonso de Albuquerque and treasure from the conquest of Malacca, sinks en route to Goa.

1511.title: Conquest of Cuba
1511.summary: Diego Velázquez and Hernán Cortés conquer Cuba; Velázquez is appointed Governor.

1511.title: Publication of The Praise of Folly
1511.summary: Erasmus publishes his most famous work, The Praise of Folly (Laus stultitiae).

1512.title: Regent of Sweden
1512.summary: Following the death of Svante Nilsson, Eric Trolle is elected the new Regent of Sweden, but is ousted after six months in favour of Sten Sture the Younger.

1512.title: Sack of Brescia
1512.summary: During the War of the League of Cambrai, the French carry out the Sack of Brescia.

1512.title: Battle of Ravenna
1512.summary: French forces defeat the Spanish at the Battle of Ravenna, but lose their leader Gaston of Foix in the process.

1512.title: Fifth Council of the Lateran
1512.summary: The Fifth Council of the Lateran begins, addressing important issues in the Catholic Church.

1512.title: Burning of Brest
1512.summary: Thomas Howard leads an English expedition into France, resulting in the burning of the port city of Brest.

1512.title: Selim I becomes Sultan
1512.summary: Selim I succeeds Bayezid II as Sultan of the Ottoman Empire.

1512.title: Battle of Saint-Mathieu
1512.summary: In a significant naval battle, the English navy defeats the French-Breton fleet, employing cannons on their ships.

1512.title: Martin Luther's Achievements
1512.summary: Martin Luther becomes a doctor of theology and joins the theological faculty of the University of Wittenberg.

1512.title: Ceiling of the Sistine Chapel
1512.summary: The ceiling painted by Michelangelo is exhibited to the public for the first time.

1512.title: Laws of Burgos
1512.summary: The Spanish Crown issues the Laws of Burgos, regulating the conduct of settlers towards native Indians in the New World.

1513.title: Pope Leo X succeeds Pope Julius II
1513.summary: Pope Leo X, layman Giovanni di Lorenzo de' Medici, becomes the 217th pope despite strong challenges from Italian cardinal Raffaele Riario and others.

1513.title: Juan Ponce de León sights Florida
1513.summary: Juan Ponce de León becomes the first European definitely known to sight Florida, mistaking it for another island.

1513.title: Juan Ponce de León visits Florida
1513.summary: Juan Ponce de León and his expedition become the first Europeans known to visit Florida, landing on the east coast.

1513.title: Battle of Novara
1513.summary: Swiss mercenaries defeat the French under Louis II de la Trémoille, forcing the French to abandon Milan and Italy during the Italian Wars.

1513.title: Christian II becomes King of Denmark and Norway
1513.summary: Christian II is crowned as the King, marking a significant political event in Scandinavia.

1513.title: Battle of Dubica
1513.summary: Croatian troops under Petar Berislavić defeat an Ottoman army under Sanjak-bey Junuz-aga in the Hundred Years' Croatian–Ottoman War.

1513.title: Battle of Flodden
1513.summary: King James IV of Scotland is defeated and killed by an English army under Thomas Howard, Earl of Surrey, leading to a succession change in Scotland.

1513.title: Vasco Núñez de Balboa sees the Pacific Ocean
1513.summary: Vasco Núñez de Balboa first sees what will become known as the Pacific Ocean from the Isthmus of Darién, marking a significant exploration moment.

1513.title: Battle of La Motta
1513.summary: Spanish troops decisively defeat the Republic of Venice in the War of the League of Cambrai, influencing the balance of power in Italy.

1513.title: Appenzell joins the Swiss Confederacy
1513.summary: Appenzell becomes a member of the Swiss Confederacy, strengthening the alliance of Swiss states.

1514.title: Melencolia I
1514.summary: Albrecht Dürer creates his famous engraving, showcasing the complexities of human thought and melancholy.

1514.title: Great Fire of Venice
1514.summary: A great fire breaks out in the Rialto of Venice, causing significant damage and impacting the local populace.

1514.title: Portuguese Embassy to Rome
1514.summary: A huge exotic embassy sent by King Manuel I of Portugal to Pope Leo X arrives in Rome, featuring an Indian elephant named Hanno.

1514.title: Peace Between France and Maximilian I
1514.summary: Louis XII of France makes peace with Maximilian I, Holy Roman Emperor, stabilizing relations between France and the Holy Roman Empire.

1514.title: Poor Conrad Revolt
1514.summary: The Poor Conrad peasant revolt against Ulrich, Duke of Württemberg begins in Beutelsbach, indicating rising discontent among the peasantry.

1514.title: Launch of Henry Grace à Dieu
1514.summary: Henry Grace à Dieu, the largest warship in the world at the time, is dedicated at the new Woolwich Dockyard, marking a significant advance in naval technology.

1514.title: Battle of Hornshole
1514.summary: In the Scottish Borders, young men from Hawick defeat a raiding party from England in the Battle of Hornshole.

1514.title: King Christian II crowned King of Norway
1514.summary: King Christian II is crowned King of Norway in Oslo, marking a significant moment in Norwegian history.

1514.title: Peace Treaty with France
1514.summary: King Henry VIII of England concludes an independent peace treaty with France in the War of the League of Cambrai, negotiated by Thomas Wolsey.

1514.title: Battle of Orsha
1514.summary: In one of the biggest battles of the century, forces of the Jagiellonian dynasty, including Belarusians and Poles, defeat the army of the Grand Duchy of Moscow in the Battle of Orsha.

1515.title: Death of Louis XII of France
1515.summary: Death of Louis XII of France and ascension of Francis, Dauphin of France.

1515.title: Crowning of Francis I
1515.summary: Francis I of France is crowned King of France in the Cathedral of Reims.

1515.title: Marriage of Mary Tudor and Charles Brandon
1515.summary: Mary Tudor, Queen of France, and Charles Brandon, 1st Duke of Suffolk, are officially married at Greenwich.

1515.title: Battle of Turnadag
1515.summary: Battle of Turnadag: The army of Ottoman sultan Selim I defeats the beylik of Dulkadir under Bozkurt of Dulkadir.

1515.title: Endowment of Manchester Grammar School
1515.summary: Manchester Grammar School is endowed by Hugh Oldham, the first free grammar school in England.

1515.title: Double Wedding at Congress of Vienna
1515.summary: At the First Congress of Vienna, a double wedding takes place to cement agreements.

1515.title: Founding of Havana
1515.summary: Conquistador Diego Velázquez de Cuéllar founds Havana, Cuba.

1515.title: Battle of Marignano
1515.summary: Battle of Marignano: The army of Francis I of France defeats the Swiss mercenaries, thanks to the timely arrival of a Venetian army.

1515.title: Cardinal Wolsey is Invested
1515.summary: Thomas Wolsey is invested as a Cardinal.

1515.title: Wolsey named Lord Chancellor of England
1515.summary: Thomas Wolsey is named Lord Chancellor of England.

1516.title: Discovery of the Río de la Plata
1516.summary: Juan Díaz de Solís is said to have discovered the Río de la Plata, although there were likely earlier expeditions by João de Lisboa and Estevão de Fróis.

1516.title: Charles of Ghent becomes King of Spain
1516.summary: With the death of Ferdinand II of Aragon, his grandson, Charles of Ghent, becomes King of Spain; his mother Queen Joanna of Castile also succeeds as Queen of Aragon but remains confined at Tordesillas.

1516.title: Erasmus publishes New Testament
1516.summary: Desiderius Erasmus publishes a new Greek edition of the New Testament, Novum Instrumentum omne, in Basel.

1516.title: Institution of the Venetian Ghetto
1516.summary: The Venetian Ghetto is instituted in the Republic of Venice, marking a significant historical moment in the treatment of Jews in Europe.

1516.title: Reinheitsgebot instituted
1516.summary: The Reinheitsgebot is instituted in Ingolstadt, Bavaria, regulating the purity of beer in sales, impacting brewing practices in Germany.

1516.title: Selim I declares war on Egypt
1516.summary: Selim I of the Ottoman Empire declares war on the Mamluk Sultanate of Egypt and invades Syria, leading to significant military conflicts in the region.

1516.title: Treaty of Noyon signed
1516.summary: The Treaty of Noyon is signed; Francis I of France recognizes Charles I of Spain's claim to Naples, and vice versa for Milan, shaping European politics.

1516.title: Concordat of Bologna
1516.summary: King Francis I of France and Pope Leo X sign the Concordat of Bologna, agreeing on the relationship between church and state in France, altering the religious landscape.

1516.title: Battle of Marj Dabiq
1516.summary: The Ottoman Sultan Selim I defeats Mamluk forces in the Battle of Marj Dabiq, consolidating Ottoman power in the region.

1516.title: Treaty of Brussels
1516.summary: Peace is declared between the Kingdom of France and the Holy Roman Empire through the Treaty of Brussels, influencing diplomatic relations.

1517.title: Battle of Ridaniya
1517.summary: The Holy Ottoman army of the sultan Selim I defeat the Mamluk army in Egypt, under Tuman bay II.

1517.title: Capture of Cairo
1517.summary: Cairo is captured by the Ottoman Empire after a three day battle, and the Mamluk Sultanate falls.

1517.title: Bernal Díaz del Castillo's expedition
1517.summary: Bernal Díaz del Castillo sets out with the Hernán de Córdoba expedition from Jaruco, documenting the conquest of Mexico.

1517.title: Fifth Council of the Lateran
1517.summary: The Fifth Council of the Lateran ends, marking a significant event in the Catholic Church.

1517.title: Evil May Day
1517.summary: Xenophobic riots break out in London, reflecting social tensions in England.

1517.title: First official diplomatic mission to China
1517.summary: Portuguese merchant Fernão Pires de Andrade meets Ming Dynasty Chinese officials, marking a major diplomatic event.

1517.title: Martin Luther's 95 Theses
1517.summary: Martin Luther publishes his 95 Theses, challenging the Catholic Church and igniting the Reformation.

1517.title: Fall of the Abbasid Caliphate
1517.summary: The Abbasid Caliphate of Cairo falls to the Ottomans, ending a significant historical dynasty.

1517.title: Outbreak of sweating sickness
1517.summary: A third outbreak of the sweating sickness hits Oxford and Cambridge, causing significant mortality among students.

1517.title: Conquest of Ryazan
1517.summary: Grand Prince Vasili III of Muscovy conquers Ryazan, extending Muscovy's influence.

1518.title: Marriage of Sigismund I the Old and Bona Sforza
1518.summary: The widowed Sigismund I the Old, King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania, marries Milanese noblewoman Bona Sforza in Wawel Cathedral and she is crowned as Queen consort of Poland.

1518.title: Transit of Venus
1518.summary: A transit of Venus occurs, an astronomical event of significance.

1518.title: Dancing plague of 1518
1518.summary: A case of dancing mania breaks out in Strasbourg, in which many people die from constant dancing.

1518.title: Completion of the Manchester Grammar School
1518.summary: Construction of the Manchester Grammar School is completed in England, costing a total of £218 13s 5d.

1518.title: Treaty of London
1518.summary: The Treaty of London temporarily ensures peace in Western Europe, marking a significant diplomatic achievement.

1518.title: Independence of Deccan sultanates
1518.summary: The Deccan sultanates in southern India of Ahmadnagar, Berar, Bidar, Bijapur, and Golconda formally declare their independence from the Bahmani Sultanate.

1518.title: Victory of Rajput Mewar Kingdom
1518.summary: The Rajput Mewar Kingdom under Rana Sanga achieves a major victory over Sultan Ibrahim Lodi of Delhi.

1518.title: Publication of Erasmus's Colloquies
1518.summary: Johann Froben publishes Erasmus's work Colloquies, which was unauthorized, and an authorized version would be published in 1519.

1518.title: Henricus Grammateus publishes Ayn neu Kunstlich Buech
1518.summary: Henricus Grammateus publishes Ayn neu Kunstlich Buech in Vienna, containing the earliest printed use of plus and minus signs for arithmetic.

1518.title: Abbasid Caliphate to Ottoman Empire
1518.summary: The remnants of The Abbasid Caliphate hand over the title of caliph to the Ottoman Empire that conquered Constantinople in 1453.

1519.title: Ulrich Zwingli preaches for the first time
1519.summary: Ulrich Zwingli begins his ministry as people's priest of the Great Minister in Zürich.

1519.title: Hernán Cortés lands in Mexico
1519.summary: Hernán Cortés and his conquistadores arrive on Mexican shores, marking the beginning of Spanish colonization.

1519.title: Charles I becomes Charles V
1519.summary: Charles I of Spain is crowned as Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor, uniting vast territories under his rule.

1519.title: The Prince of Ning rebellion
1519.summary: Zhu Chenhao declares the Ming dynasty's Zhengde Emperor a usurper, leading to an uprising in China.

1519.title: Foundation of Panama City
1519.summary: Panama City is founded as a strategic point for Spanish exploration and conquest in the Americas.

1519.title: Defeat of Zhu Chenhao
1519.summary: Wang Yangming, a Chinese philosopher and general, defeats Zhu Chenhao, ending the Prince of Ning rebellion.

1519.title: Ferdinand Magellan departs for Spice Islands
1519.summary: Ferdinand Magellan sets sail from Spain with a fleet to reach the Spice Islands by sailing west.

1519.title: Cortés enters Cholula
1519.summary: Hernán Cortés and his Tlaxcalan allies arrive in Cholula, a significant pre-Columbian city.

1519.title: Cortés enters Tenochtitlan
1519.summary: Hernán Cortés and his men formally enter the Aztec capital of Tenochtitlan, meeting Moctezuma.

1519.title: First civil revolt in Anatolia
1519.summary: An Alevi preacher leads a civil revolt in Anatolia, signaling unrest in the region.

1520.title: Stockholm Bloodbath
1520.summary: 82 noblemen and clergymen, having been sentenced to death for their involvement in the Swedish resistance against the Danish invasion, are executed by beheading.

1520.title: Battle at Lake Åsunden
1520.summary: King Christian II of Denmark and Norway defeats the Swedes, causing the mortal wounding of Swedish regent Sten Sture the Younger.

1520.title: Revolt of the Comuneros
1520.summary: Citizens of Toledo, Castile rise up in opposition to the rule of Charles V when the royal government attempts to unseat radical city councilors.

1520.title: Meeting at the Field of the Cloth of Gold
1520.summary: King Henry VIII of England and King Francis I of France meet at the famous site for negotiations and displays of wealth.
1520.city: Field of the Cloth of Gold

1520.title: Papal Bull Exsurge Domine
1520.summary: Pope Leo X issues a bull threatening Martin Luther with excommunication if he does not recant his position on indulgences and other Catholic doctrines.

1520.title: La Noche Triste
1520.summary: The forces of Cuitlâhuac gain a major victory against Hernán Cortés, resulting in significant casualties for the Spanish forces.

1520.title: Entry of Christian II into Stockholm
1520.summary: Christian II makes his triumphant entry into Stockholm, which had surrendered to him a few days earlier, granting amnesty to the resistance.

1520.title: Suleiman I succeeds Selim I
1520.summary: Suleiman I officially succeeds his father Selim I as Sultan of the Ottoman Empire, marking a significant change in leadership.

1520.title: Death of Cuitlâhuac
1520.summary: Cuitlâhuac, Aztec ruler of Tenochtitlan, dies from smallpox during an epidemic, leading to the ascension of his nephew Cuauhtémoc.

1520.title: Discovery of Saint Pierre and Miquelon
1520.summary: Portuguese explorer João Álvares Fagundes discovers the islands off Newfoundland, naming them in honor of Saint Ursula.

1521.title: Pope Leo X excommunicates Martin Luther
1521.summary: Pope Leo X excommunicates Martin Luther, marking a significant event in the Protestant Reformation.

1521.title: Diet of Worms opens
1521.summary: Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor, opens the Diet of Worms, a pivotal moment in the Reformation.

1521.title: Nydala Abbey Bloodbath
1521.summary: The Nydala Abbey Bloodbath occurs as Danes murder the abbot and many monks at Nydala Abbey.

1521.title: Ferdinand Magellan reaches the Philippines
1521.summary: Ferdinand Magellan makes European contact with Guam and reaches the Philippines, expanding European exploration.

1521.title: Battle of Tunmen
1521.summary: The Ming Dynasty navy defeats the Portuguese navy in a crucial Sino-European battle.

1521.title: Martin Luther refuses to recant
1521.summary: Martin Luther is examined before the Diet of Worms where he refuses to recant his writings.

1521.title: Battle of Mactan
1521.summary: Ferdinand Magellan is killed in the Battle of Mactan, impacting European exploration in the region.

1521.title: Italian War breaks out
1521.summary: The Italian War of 1521–1526 breaks out between Charles V and Francis I of France, affecting European politics.

1521.title: Edict of Worms issued
1521.summary: Charles V issues the Edict of Worms, declaring Martin Luther an outlaw and banning his literature.

1521.title: Fall of Tenochtitlan
1521.summary: Cuauhtémoc surrenders to Cortés, incorporating the Aztec Empire into the Spanish Empire.

1522.title: Papal Conclave Election of Pope Adrian VI
1522.summary: The papal conclave elects Adriaan Florensz Boeyens as Pope Adrian VI, marking the last non-Italian pontiff for 450 years.

1522.title: Spanish Conquistador Gil González Dávila's Expedition
1522.summary: Gil González Dávila sets out to explore the Pacific coast of Central America and names Costa Rica after finding gold.

1522.title: Revolt of the Comuneros in Castile
1522.summary: The Revolt of the Comuneros is reignited by King Carlos V reneging on promised amnesty, leading to intervention by Maria de Mendoza.

1522.title: The Pact of Brussels
1522.summary: The Pact of Brussels is signed, ensuring support for Ferdinand to become King of the Germans, solidifying Habsburg power.

1522.title: Grünwald Conference
1522.summary: The Grünwald Conference sets the stage for the Counter-Reformation by agreeing to reform the Roman Catholic Church within Bavaria.

1522.title: Appointment of Daniil of Volotsk
1522.summary: Daniil of Volotsk is appointed the new Metropolitan of Moscow, leading the Russian Orthodox Church.

1522.title: Affair of the Sausages in Zurich
1522.summary: Pastor Huldrych Zwingli publicly challenges Lent food restrictions, igniting the Reformation in Zurich.

1522.title: Battle of Bicocca
1522.summary: In the Battle of Bicocca, Spanish forces defeat French and Swiss troops trying to retake Milan, shifting power dynamics in Italy.

1522.title: Knights' War in the Holy Roman Empire
1522.summary: Franz von Sickingen leads a revolt against the Prince-Bishop of Trier, initiating the Knights' War within the Holy Roman Empire.

1522.title: Earthquake in Almeria
1522.summary: A catastrophic earthquake in Almeria kills more than 2,500 people, marking one of the most destructive events in Spanish history.

1523.title: Abdication of Christian II
1523.summary: Christian II is forced to abdicate as King of Denmark and Norway after the nobles renounce their allegiance in favor of Frederick, Duke of Holstein.

1523.title: Construction of Fort Kastela
1523.summary: Construction of Fort Kastela by Portuguese invaders on the island of Ternate is completed as Portugal claims the Spice Islands.

1523.title: Battle of al-Shihr
1523.summary: Troops from Portugal fight against the Kathiri Sultanate, sack Al-Shihr, and establish a port on the Indian Ocean.

1523.title: Claims for Nicaragua
1523.summary: Captain Antón Mayor formally claims what is now Nicaragua for Spain, marking the beginning of Spanish involvement in Central America.

1523.title: End of the Brotherhoods Rebellion
1523.summary: A rebellion by the Brotherhoods of Mallorca is suppressed after two years, as they surrender Palma de Mallorca to Spanish and German troops.

1523.title: Assassination of Mirza Shah Hossein
1523.summary: Mirza Shah Hossein, Grand Vizier of Persia, is assassinated in Qazvin by Shia nobles of the Qizilbash sect.

1523.title: Election of Gustav Vasa
1523.summary: Gustav Vasa is elected king of Sweden, establishing the independence of Sweden from Denmark and marking the end of the Kalmar Union.

1523.title: Capturing of Kalmar
1523.summary: The city of Kalmar falls to a Swedish Army force, contributing to the Swedish War of Liberation against Danish occupation.

1523.title: Election of Pope Clement VII
1523.summary: Cardinal Giulio de' Medici is elected as Clement VII following the death of Pope Adrian VI, starting a long line of Italian Popes.

1523.title: Spanish conquest of Guatemala
1523.summary: Pedro de Alvarado begins the Spanish conquest of Guatemala, marking a significant event in the Spanish colonization of Central America.

1524.title: Expedition of Giovanni da Verrazzano
1524.summary: Florentine explorer Giovanni da Verrazzano sets out from Madeira to seek a western sea route to the Pacific Ocean.

1524.title: Death of Tecun Uman
1524.summary: Tecun Uman, the K'iche' Maya ruler, is killed in battle near Quetzaltenango against Spanish conquistadors.

1524.title: Destruction of the K'iche' Kingdom
1524.summary: Spanish conquistador Pedro de Alvarado destroys the K'iche' kingdom of Q'umarkaj, capturing its capital Quichè.

1524.title: Verrazzano's Landfall at Cape Fear
1524.summary: Verrazzano's expedition makes landfall at Cape Fear, later a part of North Carolina.

1524.title: European Entry into New York Bay
1524.summary: Verrazzano's expedition makes the first European entry into New York Bay and sights Manhattan.

1524.title: Battle of the Sesia
1524.summary: Spanish forces under Charles de Lannoy defeat the French army led by François de St. Pol in Italy.

1524.title: Conquest of Atiquipaque
1524.summary: Spanish forces conquer Atiquipaque, greatly reducing the Xinca population.

1524.title: Battle of Acajutla
1524.summary: Pedro de Alvarado defeats a battalion of Pipiles in the Battle of Acajutla.

1524.title: Coronation of Frederick I of Denmark
1524.summary: Frederick I is elected King of Norway just days before his coronation in Denmark.

1524.title: Siege of Marseille
1524.summary: Marseille is besieged by Holy Roman Empire forces commanded by Charles III, Duke of Bourbon.

1525.title: The Birth of the Anabaptist Movement
1525.summary: Conrad Grebel, Felix Manz, and George Blaurock baptize each other in Zurich, marking the beginning of a new religious movement.

1525.title: Battle of Pavia
1525.summary: German and Spanish forces defeat the French army and capture Francis I of France, leading to attempts at forming a Franco-Ottoman alliance.

1525.title: Death of the Last Aztec Emperor
1525.summary: Cuauhtémoc, the last emperor of the Aztec Empire, is killed by Hernán Cortés, marking a significant point in the conquest of Mexico.

1525.title: Publication of The Twelve Articles
1525.summary: The first human rights related document in Europe is published in Memmingen, advocating for the rights of peasants against oppression.

1525.title: Battle of Leipheim in German Peasants' War
1525.summary: Peasant forces suffer defeat and heavy losses at the hands of the nobility during the German Peasants' War.

1525.title: Battle of Frankenhausen
1525.summary: Insurgent peasants led by Thomas Müntzer are defeated and Müntzer is executed, marking a turning point in the German Peasants' War.

1525.title: Martin Luther's Marriage
1525.summary: Martin Luther marries ex-nun Katharina von Bora, a significant personal event for the Reformation leader.

1525.title: Coronation of Sophie of Pomerania
1525.summary: Sophie of Pomerania is crowned as Queen consort of Denmark, enhancing political alliances in Northern Europe.

1525.title: Signing of the Treaty of the More
1525.summary: The French ambassador and King Henry VIII sign a treaty aimed at resolving tensions between England and France.

1525.title: Burning of the Stiftsbibliothek books
1525.summary: Huldrych Zwingli orders the destruction of books in Zurich as part of the Swiss Reformation, impacting cultural and scholarly works.

1526.title: Treaty of Madrid
1526.summary: Peace is declared between Francis I of France and Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor, where Francis agrees to cede Burgundy and abandons all claims to Flanders, Artois, Naples, and Milan.

1526.title: Spanish Edict for Muslims
1526.summary: The deadline for Spanish Muslims to convert to Christianity or leave is reached in the Crown of Aragon and the Principality of Catalonia, as decreed by Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor.

1526.title: Military Alliance with the Ottoman Empire
1526.summary: Suleiman the Magnificent agrees to form a military alliance with France after King François I sends a proposal.

1526.title: Destruction of Iximche
1526.summary: A group of deserters from the Spanish colonial army destroy Iximche, the capital of the indigenous kingdom of the Mayan Kaqchikel people.

1526.title: Battle of Hisar Firoza
1526.summary: The Battle of Hisar Firoza is fought between the Mughal Empire and the Delhi Sultanate, resulting in a Mughal victory led by Prince Humayun.

1526.title: Formation of the League of Torgau
1526.summary: The League of Torgau is formed as an alliance of German princes to oppose the 1521 Edict of Worms.

1526.title: Zurich Law Against Anabaptists
1526.summary: The Canton of Zurich enacts a law directed against the Anabaptist movement, making the crime punishable by drowning.

1526.title: Mughal Execution of Afghan Prisoners
1526.summary: The Mughal Emperor Babur and Crown Prince Humayun arrange the execution of 100 captured Afghan prisoners by blowing from a gun.

1526.title: Marriage of Charles V and Princess Isabella
1526.summary: Charles V marries Princess Isabella of Portugal at the Alcázar of Seville palace.

1526.title: Foundation of the Mughal Empire
1526.summary: Babur becomes Mughal emperor, invades northern India, and captures Delhi, creating the Mughal Empire.

1527.title: Election of Ferdinand I as King of Croatia
1527.summary: Croatian nobles elect Ferdinand I of Austria as King of Croatia in the Parliament on Cetin.

1527.title: Death of Felix Manz
1527.summary: Felix Manz, co-founder of the Swiss Anabaptists, is drowned in the Limmat in Zürich by the Zürich Reformed state church.

1527.title: Regency of Queen Mary of Hungary
1527.summary: Queen consort Mary of Hungary asks permission from the Hungarian Diet to step down as regent but is denied.

1527.title: Mughal–Rajput Wars
1527.summary: The Mughal–Rajput wars begin in India with the victory of the Rajput faction at the Battle of Bayana.

1527.title: Coronation of Ferdinand as King of Bohemia
1527.summary: Ferdinand of the House of Habsburg is formally crowned as King of Bohemia at Pressburg.

1527.title: Battle of Khanwa
1527.summary: In India, the Battle of Khanwa is fought as the Mughal Emperor Babur defeats Rajput ruler Rana Sanga.

1527.title: Sack of Rome
1527.summary: Spanish and German troops led by the Duke of Bourbon sack Rome, forcing Pope Clement VII to make peace.

1527.title: Establishment of the Republic of Florence
1527.summary: In Florence, the Piagnon group drives out the Medici for a second time, re-establishing the Republic of Florence until 1530.

1527.title: Founding of Jakarta
1527.summary: Jakarta, modern-day capital of Indonesia, is founded as Jayakarta.

1527.title: Pope Clement VII released from captivity
1527.summary: Pope Clement VII, held prisoner since the sack of Rome, is released after seven months along with 16 cardinals.

1528.title: Crowning of Gustav I
1528.summary: Gustav I of Sweden is crowned king of Sweden, having already reigned since his election in June 1523.

1528.title: Bern Disputation
1528.summary: The Canton of Bern becomes the second in Switzerland to officially adopt Protestantism after a 21-day debate.

1528.title: Establishment of the Zloty
1528.summary: Poland's King Stanisław II Augustus establishes the zloty as the Kingdom's official currency as part of an extensive monetary reform.

1528.title: Alliance with the Ottoman Empire
1528.summary: John Zápolya joins in an alliance with Sultan Suleiman the Magnificent, receiving protection and autonomy in return for allowing Turkish occupation.

1528.title: Battle of Szina
1528.summary: The Battle of Szina is fought between John Zápolya of Eastern Hungary and Archduke Ferdinand of Austria, resulting in Zápolya's defeat.

1528.title: Siege of Melfi
1528.summary: The French Army begins a siege of Melfi, leading to a massacre of defenders and civilians after capturing the city.

1528.title: Battle of Capo d'Orso
1528.summary: The French fleet, under mercenary captain Filippino Doria, crushes the Spanish squadron trying to run the blockade of Naples.

1528.title: Escape of King James V
1528.summary: King James V of Scotland escapes captivity after more than two years under the guardianship of the Earl of Angus.

1528.title: Conquest of Rimini
1528.summary: The Italian city of Rimini and surrounding area are conquered by troops of the Papal States and subsequently annexed.

1528.title: Recognition of the Capuchin Order
1528.summary: Pope Clement VII issues the bull recognizing the Order of Friars Minor Capuchin as a reformist branch of Roman Catholicism.

1529.title: Basarab VI Installed as Prince of Wallachia
1529.summary: Basarab VI is installed as the new Prince of Wallachia in the capital at Târgoviște, days after the assassination of the Voivode Radu of Afumați by the other boyars.

1529.title: Zhang Qijie Becomes Powerful Figure in Ming Dynasty
1529.summary: Zhang Qijie becomes the most powerful woman in Ming dynasty China as the primary wife of the Jiajing Emperor, shortly after the death of the Empress Xiaojiesu.

1529.title: Mughal Emperor Babur Departs from Agra
1529.summary: In India, the Mughal Emperor Babur departs from the capital at Agra toward Ghazipur to fight the Rajputs and the rebel Afghans who had captured the city.

1529.title: Peter Vannes' Mission to Pope Julius II
1529.summary: Peter Vannes, the Italian-born envoy for England's King Henry VIII, arrives in Rome on a mission to get Pope Julius II to give a dispensation for King Henry to divorce one wife and marry another, with both marriages to be declared valid. The mission fails.

1529.title: Örebro Synod Provides Foundation for Swedish Reformation
1529.summary: The Örebro Synod provides the theological foundation of the Swedish Reformation, following the economic foundation of it, after the Reduction of Gustav I of Sweden.

1529.title: Battle of Shimbra Kure in Ethiopia
1529.summary: The Battle of Shimbra Kure is fought in Ethiopia as the Imam Ahmad ibn Ibrahim al-Ghazi defeats the army of the Emperor Dawit II.

1529.title: Blood Libel Against Jewish Community in Bosen
1529.summary: A blood libel is carried out against the Jewish community of Bosen in Hungary, with three Jews accused and killed before the boy is later discovered alive.

1529.title: Flensburg Disputation Held
1529.summary: The Flensburg Disputation is held, a debate between Lutherans and the more radical Anabaptists that marks the rejection of radical ideas by the Danish Reformation.

1529.title: Diet of Speyer Protests Edict of Worms
1529.summary: At the Diet of Speyer, a group of rulers and independent cities protest the reinstatement of the Edict of Worms, beginning the Protestant movement.

1529.title: Siege of Vienna Abandoned
1529.summary: With the season growing late, Suleiman abandons the Siege of Vienna, a turning point in the Ottoman wars in Europe.

1530.title: Strasbourg joins the Christliches Burgrecht
1530.summary: Strasbourg becomes part of the Protestant alliance of Swiss cities.

1530.title: Hernán Cortés begins conquest of Michoacán
1530.summary: Spanish conquistador Hernán Cortés leads soldiers into Mexico to conquer the Kingdom of Michoacán.

1530.title: Charles V convenes Imperial Diet
1530.summary: Charles V invites members of the Imperial Diet to Augsburg to discuss theological questions.

1530.title: Execution of Tangaxuan II
1530.summary: Tangaxuan II, the last cazonci of the Purépecha Empire, is executed, ending the empire's independence from Spain.

1530.title: Charles V crowned emperor
1530.summary: Charles V is crowned emperor in Bologna by Pope Clement VII.

1530.title: The Tribute of the Maltese Falcon agreement
1530.summary: An agreement is reached allowing the Knights full rulership of Tripoli and Malta in return for an annual tribute.

1530.title: Members of the Imperial Diet prepare Augsburg Confession
1530.summary: The session at Augsburg is opened to prepare rules for Protestantism.

1530.title: Surrender of the Kaqchikel people
1530.summary: Kaqchikel, a Maya tribe, surrenders to Spanish conquistadors.

1530.title: Marriage of King François and Eleanor of Austria
1530.summary: King François of France marries Eleanor of Austria, daughter of King Philip I.

1530.title: The capture of Florence
1530.summary: Florence is captured by Spanish troops under Prince Philibert of Chalon.

1531.title: Lisbon earthquake
1531.summary: More than 30,000 people are killed in Portugal in an earthquake and subsequent tsunami.

1531.title: Formation of the Schmalkaldic League
1531.summary: Lutheran princes in the Holy Roman Empire form an alliance known as the Schmalkaldic League.

1531.title: Fall of Mandu
1531.summary: In India, the fortress of Mandu falls as Malwa's Sultan Mahmúd II and his sons surrender to Bahadur Shah of Gujarat.

1531.title: Assassination of Askiya Musa
1531.summary: The Emperor Askiya Musa is assassinated by his brothers after less than two years on the throne in the Songhai Empire.

1531.title: Founding of Puebla
1531.summary: The city of Puebla, Mexico is founded.

1531.title: Battle of Obertyn
1531.summary: The Moldavians are defeated by Polish forces under Jan Tarnowski, allowing the Poles to recapture Pokucie.

1531.title: Battle of Kappel
1531.summary: The forces of Zürich are defeated by the Catholic cantons, leading to the death of Huldrych Zwingli.

1531.title: Battle of Amba Sel
1531.summary: Imam Ahmad ibn Ibrahim al-Ghazi defeats the army of Dawit II, causing the southern part of Ethiopia to fall under his control.

1531.title: First appearance of the Virgin of Guadalupe
1531.summary: The Virgin of Guadalupe first appears to Juan Diego at Tepeyac, Mexico City.

1531.title: Coronation of General Min Pa
1531.summary: In Burma, the formal coronation of General Min Pa as King Min Bin of Arakan takes place in the Arakan capital, Mrauk U.

1532.title: São Vicente established
1532.summary: São Vicente is established as the first permanent Portuguese settlement in Brazil.

1532.title: The Deceived Ones debuts
1532.summary: The Deceived Ones, a stage comedy written collectively by the Accademia degli Intronati in Siena, makes its debut as part of the festivities of the Italian city's annual carnival.

1532.title: Warham disassociates from Parliament
1532.summary: William Warham, the Archbishop of Canterbury, publicly declares that he is disassociating himself from all acts of the English Parliament that are prejudicial to papal authority.

1532.title: Supplication against the Ordinaries presented
1532.summary: The Supplication against the Ordinaries is presented to Henry VIII by Thomas More. Henry responds by stating that the Commons could hardly expect such consideration after they refused to assent to the government's proposals.

1532.title: Abolishment of Republic of Florence
1532.summary: The democratic government of the Republic of Florence is abolished by order of Pope Clement VII, establishing a hereditary monarchy.

1532.title: Battle of Quipaipan
1532.summary: Atahualpa wins the civil war in the Inca Empire at the Battle of Quipaipan, defeating his brother Huáscar.

1532.title: Pizarro lands in Peru
1532.summary: Francisco Pizarro lands on the northern coast of Peru, marking the beginning of his conquest of the Inca Empire.

1532.title: Suleiman's invasion of Hungary
1532.summary: Suleiman the Magnificent leads another invasion of Hungary, reflecting the ottoman expansion in Europe.

1532.title: Nuremberg Religious Peace granted
1532.summary: The Nuremberg Religious Peace is granted to members of the Schmalkaldic League, granting them religious liberty.

1532.title: Fall of Güns
1532.summary: The siege of Güns fails after heavy rains and the arrival of reinforcements, causing Suleiman to retreat.

1533.title: King Henry VIII marries Anne Boleyn
1533.summary: King Henry VIII of England formally but secretly marries Anne Boleyn, who becomes his second queen consort.

1533.title: Thomas Audley appointed Lord Chancellor
1533.summary: Thomas Audley, 1st Baron Audley of Walden, is appointed Lord Chancellor of England.

1533.title: Reformation Parliament summoned
1533.summary: The Reformation Parliament is summoned into session by King Henry VIII of England, and meets until April 7.

1533.title: King Min Bin receives tributes
1533.summary: King Min Bin of Burma begins receiving tributes from the local lords of Bengal.

1533.title: Münster recognized as Lutheran city
1533.summary: By a treaty, the German city of Münster is recognized as a Lutheran city by the Holy Roman Empire.

1533.title: Thomas Cranmer becomes Archbishop
1533.summary: Thomas Cranmer becomes Archbishop of Canterbury.

1533.title: Statute in Restraint of Appeals
1533.summary: The Statute in Restraint of Appeals is given royal assent, declaring the king to be the supreme sovereign.

1533.title: Marriage annulled
1533.summary: King Henry VIII's marriage with Catherine of Aragon is declared annulled by Archbishop Cranmer.

1533.title: King Frederick I of Denmark dies
1533.summary: King Frederick I of Denmark dies, leading to a dispute over his successor.

1533.title: King Henry VIII is excommunicated
1533.summary: Henry VIII is excommunicated by Pope Clement VII, as is Archbishop Cranmer.

1534.title: Act Respecting the Oath to the Succession
1534.summary: The Parliament of England passes the Act Respecting the Oath to the Succession, recognising the marriage of Henry VIII and Anne Boleyn, and their children as the legitimate heirs to the throne.

1534.title: Siege of Münster
1534.summary: A group of Anabaptists, led by Jan Matthys, seize Münster and declare it The New Jerusalem, begin to exile dissenters, and forcibly baptize all others.

1534.title: Colonial Brazil divided
1534.summary: The Portuguese crown divides Colonial Brazil into fifteen donatory captaincies, hereditary titles similar to duchies.

1534.title: Submission of the Clergy Act
1534.summary: The Submission of the Clergy Act 1533 becomes law in England, requiring submission of the clergy to the king.

1534.title: Jacques Cartier explores Newfoundland
1534.summary: Jacques Cartier explores Newfoundland, while searching for the Northwest Passage.

1534.title: Victory in the Count's War
1534.summary: Copenhagen opens its gates to Count Christopher of Oldenburg, leading to the recognition of Christian III as King of Denmark.

1534.title: Establishment of Cambridge University Press
1534.summary: Cambridge University Press is given a Royal Charter by Henry VIII of England, becoming the first of the privileged presses.

1534.title: Establishment of the Jesuits
1534.summary: Ignatius of Loyola and six others take the vows that lead to the establishment of the Jesuits in Montmartre.

1534.title: Martin Luther's Bible translation
1534.summary: Martin Luther's translation of the complete Christian Bible into German is offered for sale for the first time.

1534.title: Capture of Baghdad
1534.summary: The Ottoman army under Suleiman the Magnificent captures Baghdad from the Safavids, beginning years of Ottoman rule in Iraq.

1535.title: Founding of Lima
1535.summary: Lima, now the capital of Peru, is founded by Francisco Pizarro as Ciudad de los Reyes.

1535.title: Execution of French Protestant Leaders
1535.summary: The French Protestant leaders of the October 1534 Affaire des Placards are burned to death in front of Notre-Dame de Paris.

1535.title: Discovery of Galápagos Islands
1535.summary: Fray Tomás de Berlanga discovers the Galápagos Islands, when blown off course en route to Peru.

1535.title: Storming of Maynooth Castle
1535.summary: English forces storm Maynooth Castle in Ireland, decapitating the surviving defenders after the siege.

1535.title: Installation of Emperor Go-Nara
1535.summary: Go-Nara is formally installed as the 105th Emperor of Japan after ruling since 1526.

1535.title: The Vadersol Phenomenon
1535.summary: An unusual atmospheric phenomenon, the Vadersol, appears in the sky over Stockholm during King Gustav Vasa's absence.

1535.title: Execution of Cardinal John Fisher
1535.summary: Cardinal John Fisher is executed for refusal to swear an oath of loyalty to King Henry VIII.

1535.title: Execution of Sir Thomas More
1535.summary: Sir Thomas More is executed for treason after refusing to recognize King Henry VIII as head of the English Church.

1535.title: Papal Bull Sublimis Deus
1535.summary: Pope Paul III issues a papal bull to initiate a reform of the city of Rome and the Roman Curia.

1535.title: Discovery of Montreal
1535.summary: Jacques Cartier reaches the island in the Saint Lawrence River that eventually becomes Montreal.

1536.title: Establishment of Colegio de Santa Cruz de Tlatelolco
1536.summary: The oldest European school of higher learning in the Americas is established by Franciscans.

1536.title: Execution of John of Leiden
1536.summary: John of Leiden, Bernhard Knipperdolling and Bernhard Krechting are executed for their roles in the Münster Rebellion.

1536.title: Injury of King Henry VIII
1536.summary: King Henry VIII of England is seriously injured in a jousting tournament when his horse falls on him.

1536.title: Founding of Buenos Aires
1536.summary: Spanish conquistador Pedro de Mendoza founds Buenos Aires.

1536.title: Franco-Ottoman Alliance
1536.summary: A Franco-Ottoman alliance exempts French merchants from Ottoman law and regulates trade.

1536.title: Execution of Pargalı Ibrahim Pasha
1536.summary: Grand Vizier of the Ottoman Empire is executed after falling into disfavor with Hürrem Sultan.

1536.title: Publication of Calvin's Institutes
1536.summary: The first edition of John Calvin's seminal work of Protestant systematic theology is published.

1536.title: Dissolution of the Monasteries
1536.summary: The Reformation Parliament in England passes an Act for the Dissolution of the Monasteries under Henry VIII.

1536.title: Arrest of Anne Boleyn
1536.summary: Anne Boleyn, second queen of Henry VIII, is arrested on charges of incest, adultery, and treason.

1536.title: Beheading of Anne Boleyn
1536.summary: Anne Boleyn is executed by beheading after being declared guilty of treason.

1537.title: Marriage of Princess Madeleine of Valois and King James V
1537.summary: Princess Madeleine of Valois marries King James V of Scotland at Notre-Dame de Paris.

1537.title: Assassination of Alessandro de' Medici
1537.summary: Alessandro de' Medici, Duke of Florence, is assassinated by Lorenzino de' Medici.

1537.title: Bigod's Rebellion
1537.summary: An uprising led by Francis Bigod against Henry VIII begins with an attempt to seize Scarborough Castle.

1537.title: Battle of Ollantaytambo
1537.summary: Inca Emperor Manco Inca Yupanqui defeats the Spanish led by Hernando Pizarro.

1537.title: Foundation of Chipatá
1537.summary: Chipatá is founded by Spanish conquistadors as the first settlement in what will become Nueva Granada.

1537.title: Siege of Steinvikholm Castle
1537.summary: The siege ends with the surrender of the Catholic defenders to the Danish commander.

1537.title: Foundation of Recife
1537.summary: Recife is founded by the Portuguese in Brazil.

1537.title: Beginning of the Third Ottoman-Venetian War
1537.summary: The Ottoman Sultan Suleiman begins an invasion of the Republic of Venice.

1537.title: Establishment of the Library Requirement by François I
1537.summary: King François I establishes the first system in Europe for printed work submissions to the government.

1537.title: Proclamation of Pope Paul III
1537.summary: Pope Paul III publishes an encyclical declaring the natives of the New World to possess souls.

1538.title: Truce Negotiation
1538.summary: Leonard Grey, England's Lord Deputy of Ireland, successfully negotiates a truce in County Laois, formerly an Irish Kingdom.

1538.title: Escape of Johann Katzianer
1538.summary: General Johann Katzianer of the Holy Roman Empire escapes trial in Vienna and flees to Kostajnica Fortress in Ottoman-controlled Croatia after desertion allegations during battle.

1538.title: Formation of the Holy League
1538.summary: The Holy League is agreed upon, an alliance of Christian nations directed by Pope Paul III and Venetian Senator Alvise Badoer.

1538.title: Treaty of Nagyvárad
1538.summary: Peace is declared between Ferdinand I and the Ottoman Empire, recognizing John Zápolya as King of Hungary.

1538.title: Appointment of Governor-General of Portuguese India
1538.summary: Garcia de Noronha is appointed as the new Governor-General of Portuguese India by King João III.

1538.title: Founding of the Sur Empire
1538.summary: Sher Shah Suri declares the founding of the Sur Empire and crowns himself as Emperor in Delhi.

1538.title: Battle of Las Salinas
1538.summary: In Peru, Francisco Pizarro defeats Almagro at the Battle of Las Salinas, seizing Cusco.

1538.title: Marriage of Mary of Guise and King James V
1538.summary: The formal wedding of Mary of Guise and King James V of Scotland takes place at St Andrews Cathedral.

1538.title: Truce of Nice
1538.summary: Peace is declared between Emperor Charles V and Francis I of France, marking a significant diplomatic resolution.

1538.title: Founding of Universidad Santo Tomás de Aquino
1538.summary: The first university of the New World, the Universidad Santo Tomás de Aquino, is founded on the island of Hispaniola.

1539.title: Election of Giannandrea Giustiniani Longo
1539.summary: Giannandrea Giustiniani Longo is elected two a two year term as Doge of the Republic of Genoa in Italy, succeeding Giovanni Battista Doria.

1539.title: Treaty of Toledo
1539.summary: Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor and Francis I of France agree to make no further alliances with England after Henry VIII's split with Rome.

1539.title: Battle of Naungyo
1539.summary: The Toungoos decisively defeat the Hanthawaddys in the Toungoo–Hanthawaddy War in Burma.

1539.title: First horse race at Chester Racecourse
1539.summary: The first horse race is held at Chester Racecourse, the oldest in use in England.

1539.title: Henry VIII summons Parliament
1539.summary: King Henry VIII of England summons Parliament to meet, starting a session on April 28.

1539.title: Death of Askia Isma'il
1539.summary: Askia Isma'il, ruler of the Songhai Empire in West Africa, dies after a reign of slightly less than two years.

1539.title: Duke of Saxony election
1539.summary: Heinrich IV becomes the new Duke of Saxony upon the death of his brother, Georg der Bärtige, in Germany.

1539.title: Treaty of Frankfurt
1539.summary: The Treaty of Frankfurt is signed by Charles V and Philip Melanchthon, establishing a truce for 15 months between Catholic and Protestant states.

1539.title: Inaugural declaration of the Protestant Reformation
1539.summary: In Leipzig, Duke Henry IV pledges to adopt Lutheranism as the official religion of Saxony with Martin Luther present.

1539.title: Battle of Chausa
1539.summary: Sher Shah Suri defeats Mughal emperor Humayun, leading to the formation of the Sur Empire in India.

1540.title: Marriage of Henry VIII and Anne of Cleves
1540.summary: King Henry VIII marries Anne of Cleves, his fourth Queen consort; the marriage lasts six months.

1540.title: Charles V Enters Ghent
1540.summary: Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor, enters Ghent without resistance, and executes rebels, ending the Revolt of Ghent.

1540.title: Closure of Waltham Abbey
1540.summary: Waltham Abbey is the last to be closed as part of Henry VIII of England's dissolution of the monasteries.

1540.title: Estêvão da Gama Becomes Governor of Portuguese India
1540.summary: Estêvão da Gama becomes the new Governor of Portuguese India.

1540.title: First Translation of New Testament into Icelandic
1540.summary: Printing of the first translation of the New Testament into the Icelandic language is completed after King Christian III of Denmark finishes having Oddur Gottskálksson's text compared to the original Latin.

1540.title: Battle of Kannauj
1540.summary: Sher Shah Suri defeats and deposes Mughal Emperor Humayan, establishing the Sur Empire.

1540.title: Arrest of Thomas Cromwell
1540.summary: Thomas Cromwell, Chief Minister for King Henry VIII, is arrested at a meeting of the Privy Council of England at Westminster and charged with treason.

1540.title: Execution of Thomas Cromwell
1540.summary: Thomas Cromwell is executed for treason on the orders of king Henry VIII of England.

1540.title: García Manuel de Carbajal Founding of Villa Hermosa de Arequipa
1540.summary: In Peru, Spanish captain García Manuel de Carbajal founds the Villa Hermosa de Arequipa.

1540.title: Approval of the Society of Jesus
1540.summary: The Society of Jesus (Jesuits) is approved by Pope Paul III, in his bull Regimini militantis Ecclesiae.

1541.title: Election of Leonardo Cattaneo della Volta
1541.summary: Leonardo Cattaneo della Volta is elected to a two-year term as the new Doge of the Republic of Genoa, succeeding Giannandrea Giustiniani Longo.

1541.title: Siege of Koriyama
1541.summary: In Japan, the Siege of Koriyama ends with a defeat of the attackers, the Amago clan, who sustain heavy losses including the death of Amago Hisayuki.

1541.title: Foundation of Santiago del Nuevo Extremo
1541.summary: Pedro de Valdivia founds Santiago del Nuevo Extremo, which will become the capital of Chile.

1541.title: Battle of Suakin
1541.summary: At the Battle of Suakin, Portuguese General Estêvão da Gama and his brother lead an attack against the Ottoman ruler and plunder the city.

1541.title: Fall of the Fortress at Agadir
1541.summary: The Portuguese Empire's fortress at Agadir falls to Moroccan general Mohammed al-Shaykh after a siege of 24 days.

1541.title: Estêvão da Gama's Departure
1541.summary: Estêvão da Gama departs Massawa, leaving behind matchlock men under his brother Cristóvão to assist the Emperor of Ethiopia against Ahmad ibn Ibrahim al-Ghazi.

1541.title: Assassination of Francisco Pizarro
1541.summary: In Lima, Francisco Pizarro, the conqueror of the Inca Empire, is assassinated by supporters of Diego de Almagro II in retaliation for a past execution.

1541.title: Return of John Calvin to Geneva
1541.summary: After three years of exile, John Calvin returns to Geneva to reform the church under a new doctrine known as Calvinism.

1541.title: Algiers Expedition
1541.summary: Thousands of Spanish, German and Italian soldiers surround the city of Algiers but are forced to retreat due to heavy storms.

1541.title: Execution of Thomas Culpeper and Francis Dereham
1541.summary: Thomas Culpeper and Francis Dereham are executed for treason, having committed adultery with Queen Catherine, with their severed heads displayed on London Bridge.

1542.title: Foundation of Mérida
1542.summary: In the Yucatan peninsula in Mexico, the Spanish colonists create the new town of Mérida.

1542.title: 8th Parliament of Henry VIII
1542.summary: The 8th Parliament of Henry VIII assembles at Westminster after having been summoned on November 23.

1542.title: First legislature of Transylvania
1542.summary: The first legislature for the Voivode of Transylvania meets at Vásárhely in the Kingdom of Hungary.

1542.title: Catherine Howard executed
1542.summary: Catherine Howard, until recently the Queen consort of England, is executed by beheading after being arrested on accusations of infidelity.

1542.title: Guadalajara founded
1542.summary: Guadalajara, Mexico, is founded by the Spaniards after three previous attempts failed due to local opposition.

1542.title: Franco-Ottoman alliance
1542.summary: Antoine Escalin des Aimars of France completes the negotiation with the Ottoman Sultan Suleiman for the Franco-Ottoman alliance.

1542.title: Battle of Jarte
1542.summary: The Battle of Jarte begins in Ethiopia as the Army of the Portuguese Empire encounters the army of the Ethiopian ruler, achieving a victory on April 16.

1542.title: Crown of Ireland Act
1542.summary: The Parliament of Ireland passes the Crown of Ireland Act, abolishing the title of Lord of Ireland and reestablishing it to the Kingdom of Ireland.

1542.title: Spanish claim to San Diego
1542.summary: Juan Rodríguez Cabrillo lands in what is now San Diego Bay, claiming it for the Spanish Empire which marks the first time a European sees present-day California.

1542.title: Mary, Queen of Scots ascends the throne
1542.summary: Mary, Queen of Scots, aged six days, becomes queen regnant on the death of her father, James V of Scotland.

1543.title: Andrea Centurione Pietrasanta becomes Doge of Genoa
1543.summary: Andrea Centurione Pietrasanta begins a two-year term as the new Doge of the Republic of Genoa, replacing Leonardo Cattaneo della Volta.

1543.title: Burial of King James V of Scotland
1543.summary: The burial of King James V of Scotland is carried out at Holyrood Abbey.

1543.title: Alliance against France
1543.summary: King Henry VIII of England allies with Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor, against France.

1543.title: Battle of Wayna Daga
1543.summary: A joint Ethiopian-Portuguese force of 8,500, under Emperor Gelawdewos of Ethiopia, defeats Imam Ahmad ibn Ibrahim al-Ghazi's army of over 14,000, ending the Ethiopian–Adal war.

1543.title: Installation of Abu Abdallah Muhammad VI
1543.summary: Abu Abdallah Muhammad VI is installed as the new ruler of the Kingdom of Tlemcen in what is now Algeria, succeeding his brother Abu Zayyan III.

1543.title: Massive flooding in North America
1543.summary: Massive flooding of the Mississippi River and the Arkansas River begins in southeastern North America over a 40 day period while Spanish explorer Hernando DeSoto and his team are passing through.

1543.title: Regent for Mary Queen of Scots
1543.summary: James Hamilton, 2nd Earl of Arran, is elected by the Scottish Parliament as the Regent for the infant Mary Queen of Scots.

1543.title: Crushing of Dacke's Rebellion
1543.summary: King Gustav of Sweden leads troops in crushing Dacke's Rebellion, defeating Nils Dacke at the Battle of Hjortensjon.

1543.title: Publication of Copernicus' work
1543.summary: In Nuremberg, De revolutionibus orbium coelestium is printed during the illness of Nicholas Copernicus, offering mathematical arguments for the heliocentric universe.

1543.title: Suleiman's invasion of Hungary
1543.summary: Suleiman the Magnificent, Sultan of the Ottoman Empire, follows up on his 1541 annexation of Hungary by invading a second time to capture areas that had been taken by Archduke Ferdinand.

1544.title: Battle of Sammel
1544.summary: In India, Maldeo Rathore, King of Marwar is tricked into departing from Jodhpur, leading to the battle where Afghan and Mughal armies win.

1544.title: Swearing loyalty to King Gustav Vasa
1544.summary: At Västerås, the estates of Sweden swear loyalty to King Gustav Vasa, ending the traditional electoral monarchy.

1544.title: First recorded use of a camera obscura
1544.summary: During a solar eclipse, Dutch mathematician Gemma Frisius makes the first recorded use of a camera obscura to observe the sun.

1544.title: Execution of Roman Catholic priests
1544.summary: Five Roman Catholic priests are executed at Tyburn, convicted of participating in the Prebendaries' Plot against Thomas Cranmer.

1544.title: Battle of Glasgow
1544.summary: The Battle of Glasgow is fought for control of Scotland between Matthew Stewart and the troops of the Regent, James Hamilton.

1544.title: Battle of Ceresole
1544.summary: French forces under the Comte d'Enghien defeat forces of the Holy Roman Empire near Turin during this battle.

1544.title: Ottoman sacking of Agropoli
1544.summary: The Italian town of Agropoli is sacked by Ottoman raiders, resulting in 100 prisoners taken.

1544.title: Treaty of Speyer
1544.summary: The Treaty of Speyer is signed between the Holy Roman Empire and the Kingdom of Denmark, recognizing Christian III as ruler.

1544.title: Siege of Boulogne
1544.summary: King Henry VIII begins the siege of Boulogne in northern France, which will last almost two months before the city surrenders.

1544.title: Crown Prince Yi Ho becomes King of Korea
1544.summary: Upon the death of his father King Joseon, Crown Prince Yi Ho becomes the new King of Korea.

1545.title: Arrêt de Mérindol
1545.summary: King Francis I of France issues the Arrêt de Mérindol to destroy the Protestant Waldensians of Provence.

1545.title: Battle of Ancrum Moor
1545.summary: The Scots are victorious over numerically superior English forces in the Battle of Ancrum Moor.

1545.title: Foundation of Potosí
1545.summary: Potosí is founded by the Spanish as a mining town after the discovery of huge silver deposits.

1545.title: Siege of Kawagoe Castle
1545.summary: The Siege of Kawagoe Castle begins as part of an unsuccessful attempt by the Uesugi clan to regain Kawagoe Castle from the Late Hōjō clan in Japan.

1545.title: Death of Sher Shah Suri
1545.summary: Sher Shah Suri, King of the Sur Empire in northern India, is fatally injured by an explosion and dies two days later.

1545.title: New Laws repeal
1545.summary: The New Laws of the Indies for the Good Treatment and Preservation of the Indians are repealed less than a year after being issued by King Carlos of Spain.

1545.title: Truce between Holy Roman Empire and Ottoman Empire
1545.summary: A truce is signed between the Holy Roman Empire and the Ottoman Empire following the Siege of Nice, acknowledging Ottoman conquests.

1545.title: Opening of the Council of Trent
1545.summary: The Council of Trent officially opens in northern Italy, lasting until 1563.

1545.title: Parliament of England session
1545.summary: King Henry VIII opens the Parliament of England for the ninth time, in a session that lasts until December 24.

1545.title: Death of Pietro Lando
1545.summary: Pietro Lando, the Doge of the Republic of Venice since 1538, dies and Francesco Donato is elected in his place.

1546.title: Ashikaga Yoshifushi becomes Shōgun
1546.summary: Ashikaga Yoshifushi becomes the 13th Shōgun of the Ashikaga shogunate, marking a significant moment in Japanese history.

1546.title: Death of Jeremias I
1546.summary: Jeremias I, Patriarch of the Eastern Orthodox Church, dies, marking a significant transition in church leadership.

1546.title: Battle of Iñaquito
