1546.summary: Blasco Núñez Vela, the first Spanish Viceroy of Peru, is killed in battle with Gonzalo Pizarro, a pivotal event in Spanish colonial history in South America.

1546.title: Creation of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Mexico
1546.summary: The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Mexico is created, one of the largest in the world, reflecting the expanding influence of the Catholic Church in New Spain.

1546.title: Execution of George Wishart
1546.summary: Scottish Protestant reformer George Wishart is burned at the stake for heresy, highlighting the religious conflicts of the time.

1546.title: Siege of Diu begins
1546.summary: The Gujarat Sultanate attacks the Portuguese fortress at Diu, marking significant colonial military conflicts in India.

1546.title: Creation of the Keeper of the King's Ports and Galleys
1546.summary: King Henry VIII creates the first government body to administer England's Royal Navy, indicating the increasing importance of naval power.

1546.title: The Treaty of Ardres signed
1546.summary: The Treaty of Ardres is signed, resulting in peace between England and France and impacting European political dynamics.

1546.title: Portuguese victory at the Siege of Diu
1546.summary: The European colonists defending Diu defeat the six-month siege by the Gujarat Sultanate, reflecting the military power of Portugal in India.

1546.title: Re-establishment of San Salvador
1546.summary: San Salvador is re-established at the Valle de Las Hamacas, reflecting colonial administration in Central America.

1547.title: Publication of the first Lithuanian-language book
1547.summary: The first Lithuanian-language book, a Catechism, is published in Königsberg by Martynas Mažvydas.

1547.title: Death of King Henry VIII of England
1547.summary: King Henry VIII of England dies in London, and is succeeded by his 9-year-old son Edward VI.

1547.title: Crowning of Edward VI
1547.summary: Edward VI of England is crowned at Westminster Abbey.

1547.title: Death of King Francis I of France
1547.summary: King Francis I of France dies at the Château de Rambouillet and is succeeded by his eldest surviving son Henry II.

1547.title: Battle of Mühlberg
1547.summary: Emperor Charles V defeats the Lutheran forces of the Schmalkaldic League and takes John Frederick I.

1547.title: Victory of the Schmalkaldic League
1547.summary: The Protestant Schmalkaldic League defeats the Catholic Army of the Holy Roman Empire at the Battle of Drakenburg.

1547.title: Catherine Parr's secret marriage
1547.summary: Catherine Parr, widow of King Henry VIII of England, secretly marries Thomas Seymour, 1st Baron Seymour of Sudeley.

1547.title: Coronation of Henri II of France
1547.summary: The coronation of Henri II as King of France at the Reims Cathedral.

1547.title: Battle of Pinkie Cleugh
1547.summary: An English army under the Duke of Somerset defeats a Scottish army and seizes Edinburgh.

1547.title: Battle of Perlis River
1547.summary: The Battle of Perlis River is fought between the Portuguese Navy and the navy of the Aceh Sultanate at the Perlis River in Malaysia.

1548.title: Renewal of Treaty
1548.summary: Abu al-Abbas Ahmad III renews the 1547 treaty of friendship with Spain.

1548.title: Portuguese Navy at Aden
1548.summary: Three ships from the Portuguese Navy arrive at Aden to assist against the Ottoman Navy, but are forced to retreat to Zeila where survivors are captured.

1548.title: Châtillon Agreement
1548.summary: King Henri II of France makes a contract for betrothal between his son and Mary, Queen of Scots.

1548.title: Triumphant Entry into Kasugayama
1548.summary: Nagao Kagetora leads a triumphant entry into Kasugayama Castle, replacing his brother as lead samurai.

1548.title: Battle of Uedahara
1548.summary: At the Battle of Uedahara, firearms are used for the first time on the battlefield in Japan, where Takeda Shingen is defeated.

1548.title: Recapture of Aden
1548.summary: The Ottoman Navy recaptures Aden, led by Admiral Ahmed Muhiddin Piri.

1548.title: Le Trung Tong Becomes Emperor
1548.summary: Le Trung Tong becomes the new Emperor of Dai Viet upon the death of his father.

1548.title: Succession in Poland
1548.summary: Sigismund II Augustus succeeds his father as King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania.

1548.title: Augsburg Interim Approved
1548.summary: The Diet of Augsburg approves a decree directing German Protestants to resume Roman Catholic doctrine.

1548.title: Murder of Yotfa
1548.summary: Yotfa, the ruler of the Ayutthaya Kingdom, is murdered with his mother's consent, leading to a coup.

1549.title: Gaspare Grimaldi Bracelli begins term as Doge
1549.summary: Gaspare Grimaldi Bracelli begins a two-year term as the Doge of the Republic of Genoa in Italy, succeeding Benedetto Gentile Pevere.

1549.title: Uprising of Diaguitas Natives
1549.summary: An uprising of the Diaguitas natives outside of the South American Spanish colonial city of La Serena begins. The village is burned, resulting in nearly every Spanish resident being killed.

1549.title: Maha Chakkraphat crowned King of Siam
1549.summary: Maha Chakkraphat is crowned as the King of Siam after being installed on the throne in 1548 by Maha Thammaracha of Burma.

1549.title: Act of Uniformity 1548 Passed
1549.summary: The Act of Uniformity 1548 is passed by the Parliament of England, establishing the 1549 version of the Book of Common Prayer as the sole legal prayer book in England.

1549.title: Burmese-Siamese War Begins
1549.summary: King Tabinshwehti of Burma begins his invasion of the Ayutthaya Kingdom, which ends in retreat.

1549.title: Thado Dhamma Yaza I slays Sri Suriyothai
1549.summary: In the Burmese-Siamese War, Burmese viceroy Thado Dhamma Yaza I slays Sri Suriyothai when she intervenes in battle to protect her husband.

1549.title: Salvador da Bahia Founded
1549.summary: The city of Salvador da Bahia, Brazil's first capital, is founded by Tome de Sousa.

1549.title: Francis Xavier Departs for Japan
1549.summary: Portuguese Jesuit missionary Francis Xavier departs from Goa on a mission to bring Christian ministry to Japan.

1549.title: Kett's Rebellion Breaks Out
1549.summary: Kett's Rebellion, with 18,000 troops led by Robert Kett, breaks out against land enclosures by wealthy landowners in East Anglia.

1549.title: Pope Paul III Dies
1549.summary: Pope Paul III dies at the age of 81 after a reign of 15 years, leading to a papal conclave to elect a successor.

1550.title: Founding of Valledupar
1550.summary: Spanish Captain Hernando de Santana founds the city of Valledupar, in modern-day Colombia.

1550.title: Election of Pope Julius III
1550.summary: After a 10-week conclave in Rome, Giovanni Maria Ciocchi del Monte is elected Pope Julius III.

1550.title: Attack on the Ōtomo Clan
1550.summary: An attack within the Ōtomo clan in Japan leads to the killing of the clan leader's chosen successor.

1550.title: Battle of Penco
1550.summary: Spanish and indigenous troops defeat the Mapuche forces in the Arauco War.

1550.title: Treaty of Boulogne
1550.summary: England and France sign the Treaty of Boulogne, ending hostilities in Boulogne and Scotland.

1550.title: Opening of the Valladolid Debate
1550.summary: The Valladolid debate on the rights of indigenous peoples opens at the Colegio de San Gregorio.

1550.title: Assassination of King Tabinshwehti
1550.summary: King Tabinshwehti of Burma is assassinated, leading to a civil war.

1550.title: Plunder of Cullera
1550.summary: The Spanish city of Cullera is plundered by the Ottoman Empire, leading to enslavement of its inhabitants.

1550.title: Foundation of Helsinki
1550.summary: Helsinki is founded by King Gustav I of Sweden.

1550.title: Capture of Mahdia
1550.summary: Spanish troops capture the Tunisian fortress of Mahdia from the Ottoman Empire after ongoing conflict.

1551.title: Luca Spinola elected as Doge of Genoa
1551.summary: Luca Spinola is elected to a two-year term as the new Doge of the Republic of Genoa, succeeding Gaspare Grimaldi Bracelli.

1551.title: King Bayinnaung captures Toungoo
1551.summary: King Bayinnaung of Burma is successful in capturing his ancestral city of Toungoo from his rebellious half-brother Minkhaung II, and sets about to make Toungoo the capital for the first time since 1539.

1551.title: Reforming Stoglavy Synod
1551.summary: Macarius, Metropolitan of Moscow, and Tsar Ivan IV of Russia preside over the reforming Stoglavy Synod church council, introducing a calendar of saints and an ecclesiastical law code.

1551.title: Murder of Thomas Arden
1551.summary: Alice Arden and her lover carry out the murder-for-hire of her husband, Thomas Arden of Faversham, with assistance from others, leading to executions of the conspirators.

1551.title: Proposed code of laws presented in Moscow
1551.summary: Tsar Ivan IV and the Metropolitan Macarius present the proposed code of laws, drafted by the Stoglavy Synod, to the clergy, nobility and principal Russian citizens for their approval.

1551.title: Aubin Olivier becomes director of the Royal Mint
1551.summary: French mechanical engineer Aubin Olivier becomes the director of the new Royal Mint, the Moulin des Etuves in Paris after learning to produce uniform milled coinage in Germany.

1551.title: Council of Trent reconvenes
1551.summary: The Council of Trent reconvenes by order of Pope Julius III after having been adjourned in 1549.

1551.title: Foundation of the National University of San Marcos
1551.summary: The National University of San Marcos is founded in Lima, being the first officially established university in the Americas.

1551.title: Italian War of 1551-1559 alliance
1551.summary: A defensive alliance is signed between King Henry II of France and the Duke of Parma, placing Parma under French protection.

1551.title: Siege of Tripoli ends
1551.summary: The Siege of Tripoli ends, with the Knights of Malta surrendering Tripoli to the Ottoman Empire.

1552.title: Completion of Tabulae anatomicae
1552.summary: Bartolomeo Eustachi completes his Tabulae anatomicae, presenting discoveries on the structure of the inner ear and heart.

1552.title: Treaty of Chambord
1552.summary: Henry II of France and Maurice, Elector of Saxony, sign the Treaty of Chambord.

1552.title: Founding of Valdivia
1552.summary: Pedro de Valdivia founds the Chilean city of Valdivia, as Santa María la Blanca de Valdivia.

1552.title: Abolishment of Hanseatic League Privileges
1552.summary: The privileges of the Hanseatic League are abolished in England.

1552.title: Consequence of the Council of Trent
1552.summary: The delegates to the Council of Trent adjourn for two years after learning that the Holy Roman Emperor is fleeing.

1552.title: Capture of Augsburg
1552.summary: Maurice, Elector of Saxony, liberates Augsburg and sets about to capture Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor.

1552.title: Fall of Kazan
1552.summary: The Khanate of Kazan falls to troops of Ivan IV of Russia.

1552.title: Release of Elector of Saxony and Philipp I
1552.summary: John Frederick and Philipp I are released from captivity by Charles V.

1552.title: Establishment of Grammar Schools
1552.summary: King Edward VI of England founds 35 grammar schools by royal charter, including Shrewsbury.

1552.title: Capture of Temesvar
1552.summary: The Ottomans capture the city of Temesvar.

1553.title: Siege of Metz Lifted
1553.summary: The siege of Metz in France, started by Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor during the Italian War of 1551–59, is lifted after 75 days.

1553.title: Timmaraja Wodeyar II becomes Maharaja
1553.summary: In India, Timmaraja Wodeyar II becomes the sixth maharaja of the Kingdom of Mysore after the death of his father, the Maharaja Chamaraja Wodeyar III.

1553.title: Lady Jane Grey's Marriage
1553.summary: Lady Jane Grey, a 16-year-old first cousin of King Edward VI of England, marries Lord Guildford Dudley, son of the Duke of Northumberland.

1553.title: Battle of Kawanakajima Begins
1553.summary: The first of the five Battles of Kawanakajima, the 'Battle of the Fuse', commences in Japan between Takeda Shingen and Uesugi Kenshin.

1553.title: Death of King Edward VI
1553.summary: King Edward VI of England dies at the age of 15 after a reign of only six years.

1553.title: Lady Jane Grey Proclaimed Queen
1553.summary: Lady Jane Grey is proclaimed Queen of England, a position she holds for the next nine days.

1553.title: Mary I Recognized as Queen
1553.summary: The Lord Mayor of London proclaims Mary I the rightful Queen, following a change of allegiance by the Privy Council.

1553.title: Execution of Lady Jane Grey
1553.summary: Lady Jane Grey, who claimed the title of Queen of England for nine days, is convicted of high treason and sentenced to death.

1553.title: Burning of Michael Servetus
1553.summary: Geneva's governing council burns Michael Servetus at the stake as a heretic.

1553.title: Execution of Şehzade Mustafa
1553.summary: Şehzade Mustafa, oldest son of Suleiman the Magnificent, is executed in Konya by order of his father.

1554.title: Great Fire in Eindhoven
1554.summary: A great fire breaks out in Eindhoven, Netherlands.

1554.title: Bayinnaung crowned king
1554.summary: Bayinnaung is crowned king of the Burmese Taungoo Dynasty at Pegu, taking the regnal name of Thiri Thudhamma Yaza.

1554.title: Wyatt's Rebellion begins
1554.summary: Wyatt's rebellion begins in England at Maidstone as Sir Thomas Wyatt shows opposition to Queen Mary's marriage.

1554.title: Thomas Wyatt surrenders
1554.summary: Thomas Wyatt surrenders to government forces in London as the rebellion fails.

1554.title: Lady Jane Grey beheaded
1554.summary: After claiming the throne of England the previous year, Lady Jane Grey is beheaded for treason.

1554.title: Princess Elizabeth imprisoned
1554.summary: Princess Elizabeth is imprisoned in the Tower of London on charges of working with rebels.

1554.title: Mary of Guise becomes Regent
1554.summary: Mary of Guise becomes Regent of Scotland, influencing Scottish politics.

1554.title: Battle of Marciano
1554.summary: Senese-French forces are defeated by the Florentine-Imperial army at the Battle of Marciano.

1554.title: Battle of Pucaría ending rebellion
1554.summary: An 11-month long rebellion by Francisco Hernández Girón ends at the Battle of Pucará with defeat.

1554.title: John Lok's expedition to Guinea
1554.summary: Captain John Lok departs from Dartmouth to voyage to the Guinea Coast in West Africa.

1555.title: Fall of the Kingdom of Ava
1555.summary: The Kingdom of Ava in Upper Burma falls.

1555.title: Diet of Augsburg
1555.summary: The Diet of Augsburg begins, a significant event in the Holy Roman Empire.

1555.title: Execution of John Rogers
1555.summary: John Rogers is burned at the stake in London, a prominent Protestant martyr.

1555.title: Chartering of the Muscovy Company
1555.summary: The Muscovy Company is chartered to trade with Russia, enhancing commerce.

1555.title: Foundation of Valencia
1555.summary: Valencia, Venezuela, is founded by Captain Alonso Díaz Moreno.

1555.title: Creation of Pope Marcellus II
1555.summary: Marcello Cervini is elected as Pope Marcellus II, taking office for a short reign.

1555.title: Surrender of Siena
1555.summary: After a lengthy siege, the Republic of Siena capitulates to the Florentine-Imperial army.

1555.title: Foundation of St John's College
1555.summary: St John's College, Oxford, is established to teach Catholic theology.

1555.title: Peace of Augsburg
1555.summary: The Peace of Augsburg is signed, allowing rulers to choose the religion of their realms.

1555.title: Formation of the first Jewish Ghetto
1555.summary: Pope Paul IV creates the Roman Ghetto, the first Jewish ghetto in Rome.

1556.title: Shaanxi Earthquake
1556.summary: The deadliest earthquake in history occurs with its epicenter in Shaanxi province, China; 830,000 people may have been killed.

1556.title: Charles V Resignation
1556.summary: Charles V resigns the throne of the Spanish Empire in favor of his son, Philip II, and retires to a monastery.

1556.title: Death of Mughal Emperor Humayun
1556.summary: Mughal Emperor Humayun trips and sustains a fatal injury, dying seven days later.

1556.title: Akbar the Great Ascension
1556.summary: Akbar the Great ascends the throne of the Mughal Empire in India at age 13, eventually controlling most of the Indian subcontinent.

1556.title: Battle of Nagara-gawa
1556.summary: The Battle of Nagara-gawa takes place and Saitō Yoshitatsu kills his father to avenge the family honor.

1556.title: Reginald Pole Appointment
1556.summary: Reginald Pole is appointed by Queen Mary as the new Archbishop of Canterbury and head of the Catholic Archdiocese of Canterbury.

1556.title: Second Battle of Panipat
1556.summary: A Mughal army defeats the forces of Hemu and recaptures Delhi, guaranteeing Akbar's rule.

1556.title: The Battle of Delhi
1556.summary: The Battle of Delhi is fought between forces of the Sur Empire and the Mughal Empire, resulting in a Mughal defeat.

1556.title: Stratford Martyrs Execution
1556.summary: Thirteen English Protestants, called the Stratford Martyrs, are burned at the stake after being convicted of heresy.

1556.title: Imperial War Council Founded
1556.summary: The Steter Kriegsrat is founded as a War Council in the Holy Roman Empire with five generals and five civil servants.

1557.title: Pietro Giovanni Chiavica Cibo becomes the new Doge
1557.summary: Pietro Giovanni Chiavica Cibo takes office as the Doge of the Republic of Genoa, following the term of Agostino Pinelli Ardimenti.

1557.title: Gaspard II de Coligny launches attacks on Douai and Lens
1557.summary: Gaspard II de Coligny captures the cities of Douai and Lens in the Spanish Netherlands during the Italian War.

1557.title: Sigismund II Augustus issues an edict against Protestants
1557.summary: King Sigismund II Augustus of Poland issues an edict to suppress Protestantism in Poland.

1557.title: Bayinnaung conquers Shan States
1557.summary: King Bayinnaung of Burma conquers two Shan States, commemorated on the Shwezigon Pagoda Bell.

1557.title: Pope Paul IV creates archdiocese of Portuguese India
1557.summary: Pope Paul IV establishes a new ecclesiastical structure for Portuguese India, independent from Lisbon.

1557.title: Treaty of Novgorod put into effect
1557.summary: The Treaty of Novgorod is enacted, solidifying peace between Sweden and Russia.

1557.title: Battle of Mataquito during the Arauco War
1557.summary: Spanish forces launch a surprise attack against the Mapuche in present-day Chile during the Arauco War.

1557.title: Stationers' Company granted royal charter
1557.summary: The Worshipful Company of Stationers and Newspaper Makers receives a monopoly on the English publishing industry.

1557.title: Scottish rebellion against Queen Mary
1557.summary: Thomas Stafford attempts a rebellion against Queen Mary, capturing Scarborough Castle before being subdued.

1557.title: Publication of the Geneva Bible
1557.summary: The Geneva Bible, an important Protestant translation, is published, contributing to the spread of Reformation ideas.

1558.title: Siege of Calais
1558.summary: French troops, led by Francis, Duke of Guise, take Calais, the last continental possession of the Kingdom of England.

1558.title: Foundation of the University of Jena
1558.summary: The University of Jena is founded in Thuringia, Germany.

1558.title: Takeda Shingen becomes shugo of Shinano Province
1558.summary: Takeda Shingen becomes the shugo (military governor) of Shinano Province after his successful military campaign there.

1558.title: Capture of Caupolicán
1558.summary: Pedro de Avendaño captures Caupolicán, the Mapuche Gran Toqui, leading their first revolt against the Spanish Empire.

1558.title: Foundation of the city of Pori
1558.summary: The city of Pori is founded by Duke John on the shores of the Gulf of Bothnia.

1558.title: Siege of Thionville begins
1558.summary: The siege of Thionville in the Duchy of Luxembourg is started by the French Army led by Francis, Duke of Guise.

1558.title: Marriage of Mary, Queen of Scots and Francis, Dauphin of France
1558.summary: Mary, Queen of Scots, marries Francis, Dauphin of France, at Notre Dame de Paris.

1558.title: Recognition of Ferdinand as Holy Roman Emperor
1558.summary: The Imperial Diet gives recognition to Ferdinand as Holy Roman Emperor, following his proclamation as the successor to his brother Charles V.

1558.title: Ottoman attack on Naples
1558.summary: An armada of ships from the Ottoman Empire attacks the city of Sorrento in Italy.

1559.title: Crowning of Elizabeth I
1559.summary: Elizabeth I of England is crowned, in Westminster Abbey.

1559.title: Establishment of the Church of England
1559.summary: Queen Elizabeth I of England establishes the Church of England, with the Act of Uniformity 1558 and the Act of Supremacy 1558.

1559.title: Death of Emperor Gelawdewos
1559.summary: Emperor Gelawdewos of Ethiopia, defending his lands against the invasion of Nur ibn Mujahid, is killed in battle.

1559.title: Peace of Cateau Cambrésis
1559.summary: France makes peace with England and Spain, ending the Italian War of 1551-1559.

1559.title: Return of John Knox
1559.summary: John Knox returns from exile to Scotland, becoming the leader of the beginning Scottish Reformation.

1559.title: Sacking of St Andrews Cathedral
1559.summary: A Protestant mob incited by John Knox sacks St Andrews Cathedral.

1559.title: Death of King Henry II of France
1559.summary: King Henry of France participates in a jousting tournament and is fatally injured.

1559.title: Crowning of Francis II
1559.summary: Francis II of France is crowned at Reims after the death of his father, Henry II.

1559.title: Foundation of the University of Douai
1559.summary: Pope Paul IV authorizes the creation of the University of Douai.

1559.title: Election of Pope Pius IV
1559.summary: Giovanni Angelo Medici is elected as the 224th pope, taking the name Pope Pius IV.

1560.title: Battle of Djerba
1560.summary: In the Battle of Djerba, the Ottoman fleet, commanded by Piali Pasha, overwhelms a large joint European (mainly Spanish) fleet, sinking about half its ships.

1560.title: Treaty of Edinburgh
1560.summary: The Treaty of Edinburgh is signed between England, France and Scotland, ending the Siege of Leith and largely ending the Auld Alliance between the two countries.

1560.title: Scottish Reformation
1560.summary: The Scottish Reformation Parliament adopts a Protestant confession of faith and rejects papal authority, beginning the Scottish Reformation and disestablishing Roman Catholicism in Scotland.

1560.title: Eclipse of the Sun
1560.summary: A total eclipse of the sun is observable in Europe, which inspires Tycho Brahe's interest in astronomy.

1560.title: Queen Elizabeth's Currency Reform
1560.summary: Queen Elizabeth of England notifies the official treasurers that existing coins will be replaced and devalued, to be marked with a special indication of lesser worth.

1560.title: Minting of Machine Produced Coins
1560.summary: Queen Elizabeth directs the minting of the first machine produced coins in the Kingdom to replace hammered coinage, produced manually.

1560.title: Production of New English Coinage
1560.summary: Eloy Mestrelle is given authority to commence the production of the new English coinage on machines he has brought from France for mass production.

1560.title: Charles IX Becomes King of France
1560.summary: Charles IX succeeds his brother Francis as King of France after Francis dies at the age of 16, and Catherine de' Medici becomes regent.

1560.title: Foundation of the Academia Secretorum Naturae
1560.summary: The first scientific society, the Academia Secretorum Naturae, is founded in Naples by Giambattista della Porta.

1560.title: Start of the Great Age of Piracy
1560.summary: The great age of piracy in the Caribbean starts around this time, marking significant maritime history.

1561.title: Election of Paolo Battista Giudice Calvi
1561.summary: Paolo Battista Giudice Calvi is elected as the new Doge of the Republic of Genoa, but serves for only eight months before dying in September.

1561.title: Suspension of Huguenot Persecution
1561.summary: The Ordinance of Orléans suspends the persecution of the Protestant Huguenots in Kingdom of France.

1561.title: Assassination of Bairam Khan
1561.summary: Mughal Empire General Bairam Khan is assassinated by an Afghan warrior, Mubarak Khan Lohani, while traveling through Gujarat in India.

1561.title: Queen Elizabeth's Audience with Spanish Ambassador
1561.summary: Queen Elizabeth of England summons the Ambassador from Spain, Álvaro de la Quadra, for a private audience regarding a possible marriage.

1561.title: Lope de Aguirre's Rebellion
1561.summary: Lope de Aguirre begins a rebellion against the Spanish Crown in an attempt to take over most of Spanish South America.

1561.title: Battle of Sarangpur
1561.summary: The Mughal Empire Army, led by General Adham Khan defeats the Sultanate of Malwa in a battle at Sarangpur, forcing the Sultan Baz Bahadur to flee.

1561.title: Ángel de Villafañe Governor of Spanish Florida
1561.summary: Ángel de Villafañe becomes the new Governor of Spanish Florida, assuming authority over the provinces of La Florida and Punta de Santa Elena.

1561.title: Madrid Declared Capital of Spain
1561.summary: Madrid is declared the capital of Spain, by Philip II.

1561.title: Fire at Old St Paul's Cathedral
1561.summary: The spire of Old St Paul's Cathedral in the City of London catches fire and crashes through the nave roof, probably as a result of a lightning strike.

1561.title: Crowning of Erik XIV of Sweden
1561.summary: Erik XIV is crowned King of Sweden.

1562.title: Recognition of Shane O'Neill
1562.summary: Shane O'Neill of Tír Eoghain pleads his cause at the Palace of Whitehall in London, before Queen Elizabeth I of England, who recognizes his status.

1562.title: Edict of Saint-Germain
1562.summary: Huguenots are recognized under the Edict of Saint-Germain.

1562.title: Re-assembly of the Council of Trent
1562.summary: The Council of Trent reconvenes, after a gap of 10 years.

1562.title: First performance of Gorboduc
1562.summary: Thomas Norton and Thomas Sackville's play Gorboduc is performed for the first time, before Queen Elizabeth I of England. It is the first known English tragedy.

1562.title: Marriage of Akbar and Mariam-uz-Zamani
1562.summary: In the Mughal Empire in India, the Emperor Akbar marries Mariam-uz-Zamani, daughter of Raja Bharmal.

1562.title: Siege of Mazagan begins
1562.summary: The siege of the Portuguese fort of Mazagan begins in Morocco as the Sultanate tries to take back control of the area from the Portuguese occupiers.

1562.title: Massacre of Huguenots in Wassy
1562.summary: Over 80 Huguenots are massacred by the ultra-Catholic Francis, Duke of Guise in Wassy-sur-Blaise, triggering the First War of Religion in France.

1562.title: Civil War in France
1562.summary: Civil war breaks out in the Kingdom of France as Louis I, Prince of Condé, leader of the Protestant Huguenots, declares war against the French Catholic rulers in retaliation for the March 1 massacre.

1562.title: Jean Ribault lands in Florida
1562.summary: Jean Ribault, French navigator, lands in Florida, and later establishes a Huguenot colony at Charlesfort on Parris Island, South Carolina.

1562.title: La Herradura naval disaster
1562.summary: Twenty-five ships sink in a storm off of the coast of Spain in the bay of La Herradura, with at least 3,000 people killed.

1563.title: Convocation of Bishops and Clerics
1563.summary: The convocation of bishops and clerics of the Church of England is opened at St Paul's Cathedral in London by the Dean of the Arches, Robert Weston to agree upon the wording of what will become the Thirty-nine Articles.

1563.title: Founding of Instituto Bancario San Paolo di Torino
1563.summary: Instituto Bancario San Paolo di Torino, a constituent of the major financial group Sanpaolo IMI, is founded in Italy.

1563.title: Sarsa Dengel becomes Emperor of Ethiopia
1563.summary: Sarsa Dengel succeeds his father Menas as Emperor of Ethiopia at age 14.

1563.title: Assassination of Francis, Duke of Guise
1563.summary: Francis, Duke of Guise, is assassinated while besieging Orléans by Jean de Poltrot.

1563.title: Signing of the Edict of Amboise
1563.summary: The Edict of Amboise is signed, according some toleration to the Huguenots and officially ending the first phase of the French Wars of Religion.

1563.title: Sinking of HMS Grehound
1563.summary: The English galleon ship HMS Grehound strikes a sandbar off of the coast of Rye, East Sussex and sinks with all hands.

1563.title: Royal Assent of Multiple Laws
1563.summary: Royal assent is given by Queen Elizabeth of England to parliamentary approval of multiple laws including the Poor Act 1562 and the Witchcraft Act 1562.

1563.title: Laying of the cornerstone for El Escorial
1563.summary: The cornerstone is laid for the construction of El Escorial, the royal palace for the monarch of Spain.

1563.title: Battle of Yudokoru
1563.summary: The Battle of Yudokoru takes place in Japan as Takanobu Takeda defeats the shogun Toyokazu Yamana.

1563.title: Danish Defeat in Bornholm
1563.summary: At Bornholm, the Danish fleet fires on the Swedish navy, leading to a Danish defeat and precipitating the Northern Seven Years' War.

1564.title: Battle of Ula
1564.summary: A Lithuanian surprise attack results in a decisive defeat of the numerically superior Russian forces.

1564.title: Burma captures Ayutthava
1564.summary: Invaders from Burma overcome the seaside defenses of the Siamese capital at Ayutthava, capturing the batteries of cannons.

1564.title: Fall of Ayutthaya
1564.summary: The Burmese–Siamese War ends with the surrender of King Maha Chakkraphat of Ayutthaya to King Bayinnaung of Burma.

1564.title: Assassination of Diego López de Zúñiga
1564.summary: A group of four men assassinate the Spanish Viceroy of Peru, Diego López de Zúñiga.

1564.title: Battle of Angol
1564.summary: Spanish Conquistador Lorenzo Bernal del Mercado defeats and kills the toqui Illangulién.

1564.title: Mars sinks
1564.summary: The Swedish warship Mars, flagship of the Swedish Navy, catches fire and sinks along with its crew.

1564.title: Establishment of Fort Caroline
1564.summary: French settlers abandon Charlesfort and establish Fort Caroline in Florida.

1564.title: Maximilian II becomes Holy Roman Emperor
1564.summary: Maximilian II becomes the new Holy Roman Emperor upon the death of his father, Ferdinand I.

1564.title: Akbar's victory over Malwa
1564.summary: Akbar, ruler of the Mughal Empire, defeats the rebellious governor of Malwa, Abdullah Khan Uzbeg.

1564.title: King Bayinnaung's invasion
1564.summary: King Bayinnaung of Burma leads a massive invasion of the Lan Na kingdom.

1565.title: Oprichnina Originated
1565.summary: In the Tsardom of Russia, Ivan the Terrible originates the oprichnina, a policy of repression against the boyars.

1565.title: Battle of Talikota
1565.summary: The Vijayanagara Empire, the last Hindu kingdom in South India, is greatly weakened by the Deccan sultanates.

1565.title: Legazpi Lands in Cebu
1565.summary: Spanish Conquistador Miguel López de Legazpi lands with his troops on the shores of Cebu Island in the Philippines.

1565.title: Founding of Rio de Janeiro
1565.summary: The city of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, is founded as São Sebastião do Rio de Janeiro by Estácio de Sá.

1565.title: Blood Compact in Bohol
1565.summary: Spanish Conquistador López de Legazpi makes a blood compact with Datu Sikatuna in the island of Bohol, Philippines.

1565.title: Establishment of Cebu City
1565.summary: Cebu City is established as San Miguel by López de Legazpi, becoming the first Spanish settlement in the Philippines.

1565.title: Beginning of the Great Siege of Malta
1565.summary: Ottoman troops land on the island of Malta, beginning the Great Siege of Malta.

1565.title: Marriage of Mary, Queen of Scots
1565.summary: The widowed Mary, Queen of Scots, marries her half-cousin Henry Stuart, Lord Darnley, at Holyrood Palace in Edinburgh.

1565.title: Chaseabout Raid Begins
1565.summary: The Chaseabout Raid begins in Scotland as a rebellion against Mary, Queen of Scots by her half-brother, James Stewart, 1st Earl of Moray.

1565.title: Establishment of St. Augustine
1565.summary: St. Augustine, Florida, is established by Pedro Menéndez de Avilés, becoming the oldest surviving European settlement in the modern-day United States.

1566.title: Selim II becomes Sultan of the Ottoman Empire
1566.summary: Selim II succeeds Suleiman the Magnificent as Sultan following his death, marking a transition in the Ottoman Empire.

1566.title: Cardinal Michele Ghislieri elected Pope Pius V
1566.summary: Michele Ghislieri is elected as the new Pope, marking a significant event in the Catholic Church's leadership.

1566.title: Mimura Iechika assassinated
1566.summary: Mimura Iechika, a daimyō in Japan, is assassinated, marking one of the first gun assassinations in Japanese history.

1566.title: Foundation of Valletta
1566.summary: The foundation stone for Valletta, the future capital of Malta, is laid, significant for the Maltese history.

1566.title: Compromise of Nobles presented
1566.summary: The Compromise of Nobles is presented in an attempt to delay the Eighty Years' War in the Netherlands.

1566.title: Death of Suleiman the Magnificent
1566.summary: Suleiman the Magnificent dies, marking the end of a significant era in the Ottoman Empire.

1566.title: The Augsburg Imperial Coin Edict
1566.summary: The Holy Roman Empire issues a new coin, the thaler, establishing standards that influence currency systems.

1566.title: Pope Pius V's edict against prostitution
1566.summary: Pope Pius V issues an edict to expel most prostitutes from the Papal States, later reversed due to revenue loss.

1566.title: The Beeldenstorm begins
1566.summary: The Beeldenstorm or Iconoclastic Fury initiates widespread destruction of religious art in the Netherlands.

1566.title: Siege of Szigetvár ends
1566.summary: The siege concludes with a fierce battle, illustrating the military conflicts of the time and the efforts of General Zrinski.

1567.title: Battle of Rio de Janeiro
1567.summary: Portuguese forces under the command of Estácio de Sá definitively drive the French out of Rio de Janeiro.

1567.title: Death of Jiajing Emperor
1567.summary: After 45 years' reign, the Jiajing Emperor, Zhu Houcong, dies in the Forbidden City of China.

1567.title: Establishment of Fort San Juan
1567.summary: A Spanish force under the command of Captain Juan Pardo establishes Fort San Juan, the first European settlement in present-day North Carolina.

1567.title: Ascension of Longqing Emperor
1567.summary: Prince Zhu Zaiji, son of the Jiajing Emperor, ascends the throne of Ming Dynasty China as the Longqing Emperor.

1567.title: Murder of Lord Darnley
1567.summary: Henry Stuart, Lord Darnley, husband of Mary, Queen of Scots, is murdered at the Provost's House in Kirk o' Field, Edinburgh.

1567.title: Battle of Oosterweel
1567.summary: A Spanish mercenary army surprises and kills a band of rebels near Antwerp, beginning the Eighty Years' War.

1567.title: Battle of Thanesar
1567.summary: In India, the Battle of Thanesar is fought; the Mughal Emperor Akbar wins a victory over Sanyasi Hindu warriors.

1567.title: Marriage of Mary, Queen of Scots and Bothwell
1567.summary: Mary, Queen of Scots, marries the Earl of Bothwell under duress.

1567.title: Abdication of Mary, Queen of Scots
1567.summary: Mary, Queen of Scots, is forced to abdicate in favor of her one-year-old son James VI.

1567.title: Bible Translations into Welsh
1567.summary: The New Testament is first published in Welsh, in William Salesbury's translation from the Greek.

1568.title: Edict of Torda
1568.summary: Europe's first declaration of religious freedom is adopted by the Kingdom of Hungary.

1568.title: Discovery of the Solomon Islands
1568.summary: Members of a Spanish expedition become the first Europeans to see the Solomon Islands, landing at Santa Isabel Island.

1568.title: Peace of Longjumeau
1568.summary: The Peace of Longjumeau ends the Second War of Religion in France, with substantial concessions to the Huguenots.

1568.title: Mary, Queen of Scots, escapes Lochleven Castle
1568.summary: The deposed Mary, Queen of Scots, escapes from Lochleven Castle.

1568.title: Battle of Langside
1568.summary: Mary, Queen of Scots, is defeated by a confederacy of Scottish Protestants.

1568.title: Battle of Heiligerlee
1568.summary: Troops under Louis of Nassau defeat a smaller loyalist force, effectively beginning the Eighty Years' War.

1568.title: Mass execution at Sablon
1568.summary: A mass execution is carried out in the Spanish Netherlands as 18 persons are beheaded.

1568.title: Installation of Ashikaga Yoshiaki as Shōgun
1568.summary: Ashikaga Yoshiaki is installed as Shōgun, beginning the Azuchi–Momoyama period in Japan.

1568.title: Treaty of Roskilde
1568.summary: The second treaty of Roskilde is signed to end the Northern Seven Years' War, with Sweden ceding Estonia to Denmark.

1568.title: The Morisco Revolt begins
1568.summary: The Morisco Revolt against King Philip II of Spain begins as Aben Humeya is proclaimed as King of the Granadan rebels.

1569.title: First recorded lottery in England
1569.summary: The first recorded lottery in England begins and continues, nonstop, at the west door of St Paul's Cathedral for almost five months. Each share costs ten shillings, and proceeds are used to repair harbours, and for other public works.

1569.title: Papal bull expelling Jews
1569.summary: Pope Pius V issues a papal bull expelling all Jews from Italian and French territories.

1569.title: Battle of Jarnac
1569.summary: Royalist troops under Marshal Gaspard de Tavannes surprise and defeat the Huguenots under the Prince of Condé, who is captured and murdered. A substantial proportion of the Huguenot army manages to escape, under Gaspard de Coligny.

1569.title: Burmese–Siamese War
1569.summary: In what is now Thailand, Mahinthrathirat reclaims the throne of the Ayutthaya Kingdom upon the death of King Maha Chakkraphat.

1569.title: Union of Lublin
1569.summary: The Union of Lublin unites the Kingdom of Poland and the Grand Duchy of Lithuania into a single state, the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth.

1569.title: Siege of Poitiers
1569.summary: Huguenot forces under Gaspard II de Coligny and 15-year-old Prince Henry of Navarre begin the siege of Poitiers, a Roman Catholic stronghold. The siege fails and the Huguenots depart on September 7.

1569.title: Battle of Orthez
1569.summary: Huguenot forces under Gabriel, comte de Montgomery defeat Royalist forces under General Terride, in French Navarre. Catholics surrender under the condition that their lives will be spared. Huguenots agree, but then massacre the Catholics anyway.

1569.title: First complete printed Bible in Spanish
1569.summary: The first complete printed Bible in a Spanish translation, made by Casiodoro de Reina, is published in Basel.

1569.title: Battle of Moncontour
1569.summary: The Royalist forces of Gaspard de Saulx Tavannes and the Duc d'Anjou defeat Gaspard II de Coligny's Huguenots, killing 8,000 and taking 3,000 prisoner.

1569.title: Rising of the North
1569.summary: The Rising of the North begins in England as the Earl of Westmorland and the Earl of Northumberland, both Catholic nobles, set off from Brancepeth Castle in County Durham with 700 men, in hopes of overthrowing Queen Elizabeth I of England.

1570.title: Massacre of Novgorod
1570.summary: Ivan the Terrible begins the Massacre of Novgorod, marking a significant act of brutality and consolidation of power.

1570.title: Assassination of James Stewart
1570.summary: The assassination of Scottish regent James Stewart, 1st Earl of Moray, by James Hamilton escalates civil unrest in Scotland.

1570.title: Chilean Earthquake
1570.summary: An estimated 8.3 magnitude earthquake occurs in Concepción, Chile, causing major destruction.

1570.title: Pope Pius V Excommunicates Elizabeth I
1570.summary: Pope Pius V excommunicates Queen Elizabeth I of England, intensifying conflicts between Catholicism and Protestantism.

1570.title: Publication of Theatrum Orbis Terrarum
1570.summary: Abraham Ortelius publishes the first modern atlas, which greatly impacts cartography and exploration.

1570.title: Battle of Manila
1570.summary: The Spanish forces defeat Raja Sulayman's troops in the Battle of Manila, asserting colonial power in the region.

1570.title: Ottoman Conquest of Cyprus
1570.summary: The Ottoman conquest of Cyprus begins with a large deployment of troops, marking escalation in the Ottoman Empire's territorial expansion.

1570.title: Peace of Saint-Germain
1570.summary: The Peace of Saint-Germain ends the Third War of Religion in France, providing Huguenots with promised freedoms.

1570.title: Fall of Nicosia
1570.summary: The fall of Nicosia to the Turks is marked by a massacre of Venetian defenders, resulting in significant loss of life and control.

1570.title: Earthquake in Ferrara
1570.summary: A major earthquake strikes the Italian city of Ferrara, causing widespread destruction and loss of life.

1571.title: Freedom of Religion Granted to Austrian Nobility
1571.summary: The Austrian nobility are granted freedom of religion.

1571.title: Royal Exchange Opens
1571.summary: The Royal Exchange opens in London, England.

1571.title: Massacre of Jesuit Missionaries
1571.summary: The Spanish Jesuit missionaries of the Ajacán Mission are massacred by local Native Americans.

1571.title: Knights of Saint John Transfer Capital
1571.summary: The Order of the Knights of Saint John transfers the capital of Malta from Birgu to Valletta.

1571.title: 3rd Parliament of Elizabeth I Assembles
1571.summary: The 3rd Parliament of Elizabeth I assembles in England at Westminster after being summoned.

1571.title: Ridolfi Plot Foiled
1571.summary: The Ridolfi plot to assassinate Queen Elizabeth I of England is foiled by the capture of Ridolfi's messenger.

1571.title: General Altan Khan Granted Authority
1571.summary: General Altan Khan is granted authority to rule the western provinces by the Ming dynasty Emperor Longqing.

1571.title: Emancipation of Serfs
1571.summary: In the German Duchy of Palatinate-Zweibrücken, the serfs are emancipated by John, Count of Palatine.

1571.title: Establishment of the Holy League
1571.summary: The Holy League is established as an alliance for mutual defense against attacks by the Ottoman Empire on ships in the Mediterranean Sea.

1571.title: Conquest of the Kingdom of Maynila Complete
1571.summary: Following the Battle of Bangkusay Channel, Spanish Conquistador Miguel López de Legazpi makes Manila the capital of the Philippines.

1572.title: Thomas Howard's Treason Trial
1572.summary: Thomas Howard, 4th Duke of Norfolk, is tried for treason due to his involvement in the Ridolfi plot and is executed later.

1572.title: Proclamation by Elizabeth I
1572.summary: Elizabeth I issues a proclamation revoking all commissions due to frauds they had fostered.

1572.title: Foundation of Harrow School
1572.summary: Harrow School is founded with a royal charter from Queen Elizabeth I of England.

1572.title: Crowning of Maharana Pratap
1572.summary: Maharana Pratap is crowned as the new Rana of Mewar at Udaipur after his father's death.

1572.title: Death of Mem de Sá
1572.summary: Mem de Sá, the Portuguese Governor-General of Brazil, dies after 14 years in office.

1572.title: Papal Bull by Pope Pius V
1572.summary: Pope Pius V issues a papal bull granting an indulgence reducing punishment for Roman Catholics.

1572.title: Capture of Brielle
1572.summary: The Sea Beggars capture the port city of Brielle, inciting uprisings in Holland and Zeeland.

1572.title: Battle of Kizaki
1572.summary: At the Battle of Kizaki, Shimazu Yoshihiro leads a small army to defeat the Ito clan.

1572.title: Sea Beggars Hang Priests
1572.summary: The Sea Beggars hang 19 Roman Catholic priests at Brielle, marking a grim episode of resistance.

1572.title: St. Bartholomew's Day Massacre
1572.summary: Thousands of Protestants are murdered in Paris at the order of King Charles IX, leading to the Fourth War of Religion.

1573.title: Battle of Mikatagahara
1573.summary: At the Battle of Mikatagahara in Japan, Takeda Shingen defeats Tokugawa Ieyasu.

1573.title: Warsaw Confederation
1573.summary: Articles of the Warsaw Confederation are signed, sanctioning religious freedom in Poland.

1573.title: Croatian–Slovene Peasant Revolt
1573.summary: The Croatian–Slovene Peasant Revolt, started by Matija Gubec, breaks out against the Croatian nobility, but is suppressed after 18 days.

1573.title: Wanli Era Begins
1573.summary: The Wanli Era begins in Ming dynasty China on the first New Year after 9-year-old Zhu Yijun ascends the throne.

1573.title: Siege of Sommières
1573.summary: France's Marshal Henri de Montmorency begins the Siege of Sommières in southern France, with Huguenots holding out against Catholic troops.

1573.title: First Desmond Rebellion
1573.summary: The first Desmond Rebellion in Ireland, led by James FitzMaurice FitzGerald, ends at Kilmallock with FitzGerald's surrender.

1573.title: Ottoman–Venetian War Ended
1573.summary: The Ottoman–Venetian War (1570–1573) is ended by a peace treaty, transferring control of Cyprus from Venice to the Ottoman Empire.

1573.title: Spanish Abandon Siege of Alkmaar
1573.summary: The Spanish abandon the siege of the city of Alkmaar and concede the city to the Geuzen, the Dutch Calvinist rebels.

1573.title: Foundation of Santa Fe
1573.summary: Santa Fe, Argentina, is founded by Juan de Garay.

1573.title: King Henry of Poland Elected
1573.summary: Henry, Duke of Anjou, is elected to the throne of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth by the Polish nobility.

1574.title: Murad III becomes Ottoman Emperor
1574.summary: Murad III is formally enthroned as the Ottoman Sultan after eliminating his brothers as rival claimants to the throne.

1574.title: Abu Abdallah Mohammed II becomes Sultan of Morocco
1574.summary: Following the death of his father, Abdallah al-Ghalib, Abu Abdallah Mohammed II ascends to the throne as the new Sultan of Morocco.

1574.title: Battle of the Scheldt
1574.summary: A significant naval conflict occurs off the coast of the Netherlands between the Spanish Fleet and a combined Dutch and English fleet, resulting in a Spanish defeat.

1574.title: The fifth War of Religion against the Huguenots begins
1574.summary: In France, tensions escalate as the fifth War of Religion against the Huguenots is initiated.

1574.title: Swedish troops attack Wesenberg Castle
1574.summary: Swedish forces attempt to capture Wesenberg Castle in Estonia but suffer significant losses against the Russian Army.

1574.title: Battle of Mookerheyde
1574.summary: In a decisive battle, Spanish forces defeat the rebels led by Louis of Nassau, who is killed during the conflict.

1574.title: King Henry III of France's accession
1574.summary: After the death of King Charles IX, his brother Henry of Poland takes the throne as King Henry III of France, with his mother acting as Regent until his arrival.

1574.title: Selim II attempts to reclaim Tunis
1574.summary: Sultan Selim II launches a military campaign to seize Tunis back from the Holy Roman Empire, mobilizing a large fleet and army.

1574.title: Construction of The White Tower
1574.summary: The construction of The White Tower begins in the Czech Republic, marking a notable architectural advancement.

1574.title: Discovery of the Juan Fernández Islands
1574.summary: Spanish sailor Juan Fernández discovers the Juan Fernández Islands in the South Pacific Ocean, adding to geographical knowledge.

1575.title: Queen Elizabeth I grants music monopoly
1575.summary: Queen Elizabeth I of England grants a monopoly on producing printed sheet music, to Thomas Tallis and William Byrd.

1575.title: Founding of Leiden University
1575.summary: William I of Orange founds Leiden University.

1575.title: Portuguese exploration of Angola
1575.summary: Portuguese explorer Paulo Dias de Novais arrives in southeastern Africa to colonize what is now Angola.

1575.title: Coronation of Henry III of France
1575.summary: The formal coronation of Henry III as King of France takes place at the Reims Cathedral.

1575.title: Battle of Tukaroi
1575.summary: Battle of Tukaroi: The Mughal Empire decisively defeats the Karrani dynasty of Bengal.

1575.title: Raid of the Redeswire
1575.summary: Sir John Carmichael defeats Sir John Forster, in the last battle between England and Scotland.

1575.title: Promotion of Lutheran missions in Constantinople
1575.summary: Lutheran missionaries meet with Jeremias II Tranos, presenting a Greek translation of the Augsburg Confession.

1575.title: First modern battle in Japan
1575.summary: Battle of Nagashino: Oda Nobunaga defeats Takeda Katsuyori in Japan's first modern battle.

1575.title: Cervantes captured by pirates
1575.summary: Miguel de Cervantes is taken hostage by Ottoman pirates after an attack on the Spanish galley.

1575.title: Maximilian II declared King
1575.summary: The Primate of Poland declares Maximilian II new King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania under pressure.

1576.title: Founding of León
1576.summary: Martín Enriquez de Almanza, Viceroy of New Spain, founds the settlement of León in what is now Guanajuato, Mexico.

1576.title: Founding of Luanda
1576.summary: Portuguese explorer Paulo Dias de Novais founds the settlement of São Paulo da Assumpção de Loanda, now Luanda, Angola.

1576.title: Escape of King Henry of Navarre
1576.summary: King Henry of Navarre escapes to Tours and formally reverts to the Protestant faith after being captive in France since 1572.

1576.title: Arrest of Peter Wentworth
1576.summary: Peter Wentworth, a Puritan M.P., is arrested while criticizing the suppression of freedom of speech and taken to the Tower of London.

1576.title: Capture of Fez
1576.summary: Ottoman forces led by Abd al-Malik capture the city of Fez in Morocco in an attempt to overthrow the Sultan.

1576.title: Battle of Ishiyama
1576.summary: The Third Battle of Ishiyama begins as Oda Nobunaga sends 10,000 soldiers against the Ashikaga shogunate.

1576.title: Crowning of Stephen Báthory
1576.summary: Stephen Báthory is crowned king of Poland, becoming an integral figure of Polish history.

1576.title: Edict of Beaulieu
1576.summary: The Edict of Beaulieu ends the Fifth War of Religion in France, granting freedom of worship to the Protestant Huguenots.

1576.title: Death of Tahmasp I
1576.summary: Tahmasp I, the Shah of Safavid Iran, dies after being accidentally poisoned, leading to a struggle for control in Iran.

1576.title: Sack of Antwerp
1576.summary: Mutinous Spanish soldiers sack Antwerp in the Low Countries, nearly destroying the city after three days.

1577.title: Formation of the second Union of Brussels
1577.summary: The second Union of Brussels is formed, first without the Protestant counties of Holland and Zeeland, later with the Protestants, indicating open rebellion of the whole of the Netherlands.

1577.title: Signing of the Perpetual Edict
1577.summary: The Perpetual Edict providing for the removal of Spanish troops from what is now the Netherlands is signed by Don Juan de Austria and representatives of the Dutch rebellion.

1577.title: Execution of advisers in Iran
1577.summary: The new Shah of Iran, Ismail II, has most of the advisers of his late father executed, including Prince Ibrahim Mirza.

1577.title: Formation of the Cathay Company
1577.summary: The Cathay Company is formed, to send Martin Frobisher back to the New World for more gold.

1577.title: Battle of Lubieszów
1577.summary: General Jan Zborowski leads the army of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth in a catastrophic defeat of rebels, ending the Danzig Rebellion.

1577.title: Martin Frobisher's expedition departure
1577.summary: English explorer Martin Frobisher departs from Blackwall in his flagship, HMS Ayde, for the English expedition to North America.

1577.title: Publication of the Bergen Book
1577.summary: The Bergen Book, the Solid Declaration of the Formula of Concord, one of the Lutheran confessional writings, is published.

1577.title: Massacre in Issoire
1577.summary: The French city of Issoire surrenders and 3,000 of its Protestant Huguenots are massacred by royal troops on orders of King Henry III of France.

1577.title: Inuit captives brought to England
1577.summary: The first Inuit people to see Europe are brought as captives of Martin Frobisher when HMS Gabriel arrived in England at Bristol.

1577.title: Election of Giovanni Battista Gentile Pignolo
1577.summary: Giovanni Battista Gentile Pignolo is elected as the new Doge of the Republic of Genoa for a two-year term, replacing Prospero Centurione Fattinanti.

1578.title: Siege of Gvozdansko
1578.summary: The Siege of Gvozdansko ends in the Kingdom of Croatia as Ottoman Empire troops led by Ferhad Pasha Sokolović capture the fortress at Gvozdansko.

1578.title: Battle of Gembloux
1578.summary: Spanish forces under Don John of Austria and Alexander Farnese defeat the Dutch; Farnese begins to recover control of the French-speaking Southern Netherlands.

1578.title: Creation of the Diocese of Manila
1578.summary: Pope Gregory XIII issues the papal bull Illius fulti praesidio and creates the Diocese of Manila, the first Roman Catholic diocese in the Philippines.

1578.title: Treaty ratification in Amsterdam
1578.summary: The city council of Amsterdam in the Netherlands ratifies a treaty placing the city under the authority of Willem, Prince of Orange, and joining the States of Holland.

1578.title: Shah of Persia
1578.summary: Mohammad Khodabanda begins his reign as the new Shah of Persia after entering the Persian capital at Qazvin.

1578.title: Capture of Leuven
1578.summary: Spanish troops capture the city of Leuven, forcing Willem, Prince of Orange, to flee Brussels and relocate to Antwerp.

1578.title: Election of Doge of Venice
1578.summary: Nicolò da Ponte is elected as the new Doge of the Republic of Venice after 44 ballots.

1578.title: Resignation of Earl of Morton
1578.summary: James Douglas, 4th Earl of Morton, resigns after having served as regent since November 24, 1572.

1578.title: Siege of Otate begins
1578.summary: The Siege of Otate begins in Japan after the death of Uesugi Kenshin, the warlord of the Echigo Province.

1578.title: Duel of the Mignons
1578.summary: The Duel of the Mignons claims the lives of two favorites of Henry III of France, and two favourites of Henry I, Duke of Guise.

1579.title: Union of Arras
1579.summary: The Union of Arras unites the southern Netherlands under the Duke of Parma, governor in the name of king Philip II of Spain.

1579.title: Union of Utrecht
1579.summary: The Union of Utrecht unites the northern Netherlands in a confederation called the United Provinces. William I of Orange becomes Stadtholder.

1579.title: Battle of Borgerhout
1579.summary: The Battle of Borgerhout takes place in Flanders as Spanish troops under the command of the Duke of Parma overwhelm rebels fighting for the Union of Utrecht.

1579.title: Siege of Maastricht
1579.summary: The Siege of Maastricht, a center of Dutch resistance to Spanish rule, is started by Spanish troops under the command of Alexander Farnese, Duke of Parma.

1579.title: Treaty of Arras
1579.summary: The Treaty of Arras is concluded between Spain and members of the Union of Arras, maintaining resistance against Spain while agreeing to a separate peace.

1579.title: Drake's Claim in California
1579.summary: Francis Drake lands in modern-day California and claims it for Queen Elizabeth I, laying the groundwork for English colonial charters.

1579.title: Maastricht Surrenders
1579.summary: Maastricht surrenders to Spanish troops after a surprise attack by the Duke of Parma, ending a three-month siege.

1579.title: Start of Second Desmond Rebellion
1579.summary: James FitzMaurice FitzGerald lands in Ireland, commencing the Second Desmond Rebellion against English rule.

1579.title: Assassination of Sokollu Mehmed Pasha
1579.summary: Sokollu Mehmed Pasha, Grand Vizier of the Ottoman Empire, is assassinated in Constantinople after over 14 years in office.

1579.title: Michael Maestlin's Pleiades Cataloging
1579.summary: German astronomer Michael Maestlin makes the first cataloging of the Pleiades cluster, recording 11 separate stars visible to the naked eye.

1580.title: The Book of Concord is published
1580.summary: A collection of Lutheran confessional documents, marking a significant moment in Protestant Reformation history.

1580.title: Portuguese succession crisis of 1580
1580.summary: The death of Henry, King of Portugal, without direct heirs, leads to a conflict over succession, notably involving King Philip II of Spain.

1580.title: Massacre at Mardi Gras festivities
1580.summary: A tragic event where 20 artists were killed during the Carnaval de Romans in France, impacting the cultural scene.

1580.title: Arrival of Jesuit priests in India
1580.summary: Three Jesuit priests arrive in Agra, India, as guests of Mughal Emperor Akbar the Great, fostering the spread of Christianity.

1580.title: Publication of Montaigne's Essays
1580.summary: Michel de Montaigne signs the preface to his significant work, later published, contributing to the literary landscape of the Renaissance.

1580.title: Dover Straits earthquake
1580.summary: A natural disaster that shook the region, affecting infrastructure and communities.

1580.title: Battle of Alcântara
1580.summary: Spanish armies defeat Portuguese claimant António, Prior of Crato, solidifying Philip II's claim to the Portuguese throne.

1580.title: Drake's return from circumnavigation
1580.summary: Francis Drake returns to Plymouth after completing a significant voyage, marking an important achievement in maritime exploration.

1580.title: Siege of Smerwick
1580.summary: The siege ends with the surrender of Irish rebels, marking a brutal episode in the Second Desmond Rebellion.

1580.title: The start of the influenza pandemic
1580.summary: A pandemic originating in Asia spreads globally, leading to significant mortality and societal impact.

1581.title: Act of Abjuration
1581.summary: The Act of Abjuration is signed at The Hague by representatives of eight Dutch provinces as a declaration of independence from Spanish rule and a secession from the Union of Utrecht.

1581.title: Treaty of Drohiczyn
1581.summary: The Treaty of Drohiczyn is concluded, ending the Livonian War and adding the conquered city of Riga to the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth.

1581.title: Treaty of Plessis-les-Tours
1581.summary: The Treaty of Plessis-les-Tours between the Duchy of Anjou and most of the states of the Dutch Republic is ratified, granting François, Duke of Anjou executive authority over the Republic.

1581.title: Crowning of Philip I of Portugal
1581.summary: Philip II of Spain is crowned Philip I of Portugal following the Iberian Union.

1581.title: Death of King Bayinnaung
1581.summary: King Bayinnaung of Burma, who created the largest empire in mainland southeast Asia, dies at age 65.

1581.title: Beheading of James Douglas
1581.summary: James Douglas, 4th Earl of Morton, is beheaded at Edinburgh after being convicted of conspiracy in the murder of Henry Stuart.

1581.title: Knighthood of Francis Drake
1581.summary: Following his circumnavigation of the world, Francis Drake is knighted by Elizabeth I of England.

1581.title: Execution of Edmund Campion
1581.summary: Jesuit priest Edmund Campion is executed for treason in England.

1581.title: Ballet Comique de la Reine
1581.summary: Ballet Comique de la Reine, the first narrative ballet, opens at the court of Catherine de' Medici in Paris.

1581.title: Spanish siege of Steenwijk
1581.summary: The Spanish Army is forced to abandon the siege of Steenwijk in the Netherlands after more than four months.

1582.title: Russia cedes Livonia
1582.summary: Russia cedes its conquered areas in Livonia (Northern Latvia and Southern Estonia), to the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth.

1582.title: Pope Gregory XIII proclaims the Gregorian Calendar
1582.summary: Pope Gregory XIII proclaims the Gregorian Calendar, to come into effect in October, advancing the Julian calendar by 10 days to synchronize with equinoxes and solstices.

1582.title: Scryer Edward Kelley at John Dee's house
1582.summary: Scryer Edward Kelley arrives at John Dee's house in London, where they practice angelic magic and Dee develops the Enochian language.

1582.title: The New Testament of the Douai Bible published
1582.summary: The New Testament of the Douai Bible, translated into English by Father Gregory Martin, is published for use in the Roman Catholic Church.

1582.title: Ancuancu earthquake
1582.summary: Ancuancu earthquake strikes Ancuancu (in modern-day La Paz Department, Bolivia), reportedly burying all inhabitants except for one chief.

1582.title: Creation of Tounis College
1582.summary: King James VI of Scotland signs a charter creating the Tounis College, which becomes the University of Edinburgh.

1582.title: Siege of Takamatsu begins
1582.summary: The Siege of Takamatsu begins as Toyotomi Hideyoshi attacks the forces of Shimizu Muneharu with a plan to flood the castle.

1582.title: Assassination of Oda Nobunaga
1582.summary: The Honnō-ji Incident occurs as Japanese warlord Oda Nobunaga is assassinated following a betrayal by Akechi Mitsuhide.

1582.title: William Shakespeare marries Anne Hathaway
1582.summary: William Shakespeare, at 18, marries 26-year-old Anne Hathaway in England, ten years before beginning to write his known plays.

1583.title: Claiming of Newfoundland
1583.summary: On August 5, Humphrey Gilbert claims the island of Newfoundland on behalf of England, marking the beginning of the British Empire.

1583.title: Adoption of the Gregorian Calendar
1583.summary: The Duchy of Savoy adopts the Gregorian Calendar, replacing the Julian Calendar.

1583.title: Siege of Eindhoven
1583.summary: The Siege of Eindhoven by the Spanish Army begins, leading to the city's fall in April.

1583.title: Foundation of Queen Elizabeth's Men
1583.summary: The Queen Elizabeth's Men troupe of actors is founded in England by order of Queen Elizabeth.

1583.title: Diplomatic Relations with Ottoman Empire
1583.summary: The Kingdom of England establishes its first diplomatic relations with the Ottoman Empire.

1583.title: Battle of Shizugatake
1583.summary: In Japan, Toyotomi Hideyoshi defeats Shibata Katsuie at the Battle of Shizugatake, leading to the construction of Osaka Castle.

1583.title: Publication of the Slovene Bible
1583.summary: The first installment of the translation by Jurij Dalmatin of the Bible into the Slovene language is published in Wittenberg.

1583.title: Battle of Steenbergen
1583.summary: Spanish troops overwhelm a combined army of Dutch, French and English soldiers at the Battle of Steenbergen.

1583.title: First Life Insurance Policy
1583.summary: In England, the first known life insurance policy is issued by the Royal Exchange of London.

1583.title: Foundation of Allahabad
1583.summary: In India, the city of Allahabad is founded as a strategic fortress by Akbar, Emperor of the Mughal Empire.

1584.title: Feodor I becomes Tsar of Russia
1584.summary: Feodor I takes over the leadership of Russia as the new Tsar, succeeding his father Ivan the Terrible.

1584.title: Roanoke Island discovered
1584.summary: English settlers discover Roanoke Island, marking a significant moment in the exploration of North America.

1584.title: Execution of George Haydock
1584.summary: Roman Catholic priest George Haydock is executed for treason after claiming Queen Elizabeth is a heretic.

1584.title: Beginning of Burmese-Siamese War
1584.summary: Prince Naresuan begins a rebellion against Burma after learning of an assassination plot against him.

1584.title: Deposition of Jeremias II Tranos
1584.summary: The leader of the Eastern Orthodox Church is deposed and exiled by his fellow bishops.

1584.title: City status granted to Karlstad
1584.summary: Karlstad gains city status in Sweden, an important milestone in its development.

1584.title: Battle of Komaki begins
1584.summary: The Battle of Komaki marks the beginning of a significant conflict between Toyotomi Hideyoshi and Tokugawa Ieyasu.

1584.title: Assassination of Willem van Oranje
1584.summary: Willem van Oranje, a key leader of the Dutch Republic, is assassinated in Delft.

1584.title: Conquest of Siberia
1584.summary: General Yermak is killed, marking a setback in the Russian conquest of Siberia.

1584.title: Tenshō embassy arrives in Portugal
1584.summary: Japan’s first diplomatic mission to Europe arrives, conveying cultural exchange during the period.

1585.title: Banished Priests
1585.summary: Robert Nutter, Thomas Worthington, and 18 other Roman Catholic priests are perpetually banished from England by order of Queen Elizabeth and transported to France.

1585.title: Deposition of Pachomius II
1585.summary: Pachomius II is deposed by fellow bishops from his position as Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople and replaced by Theoleptus II.

1585.title: Marriage of King Johan III
1585.summary: King Johan III of Sweden marries Gunilla Bielke in a ceremony that is not attended by his siblings.

1585.title: Siege of Brussels
1585.summary: The Spanish Army obtains the surrender of Brussels after a long siege, led by Alexander Farnese, Duke of Parma.

1585.title: Death of Pope Gregory XIII
1585.summary: Pope Gregory XIII, known for promulgating the Gregorian calendar, dies after a long reign, leading to a papal conclave for a successor.

1585.title: Election of Pope Sixtus V
1585.summary: Cardinal Felice Piergentile is elected as the 227th Pope, taking the name Pope Sixtus V after a conclave at the Vatican.

1585.title: Anglo-Spanish War Begins
1585.summary: Spain's seizure of English ships leads to the beginning of the Anglo-Spanish War.

1585.title: Aleutian Islands Earthquake
1585.summary: A 9.2 magnitude earthquake in the Aleutian Islands triggers a tsunami affecting Hawaii and Japan.

1585.title: Capture of Antwerp
1585.summary: Spanish forces capture Antwerp, forcing Protestant inhabitants to flee and ending its role as a major trade city.

1585.title: Treaty of Nonsuch Signed
1585.summary: The Treaty of Nonsuch is signed, committing England to support the Dutch Revolt in the Eighty Years' War.

1587.title: Establishment of the Roanoke Colony
1587.summary: Sir Walter Raleigh appoints John White to be the Governor of the Roanoke Colony, to be established later in the year by English colonists on Roanoke Island off the coast of what is now the U.S. state of North Carolina. White and 121 other colonists depart from Portsmouth on three ships on May 8 and arrive at Croatoan Island on July 22.

1587.title: End of Portuguese Control in Nagasaki
1587.summary: In Japan, Chancellor of the Realm Toyotomi Hideyoshi ends Portugal's control of the port of Nagasaki after six years, impacting trade and local governance.

1587.title: Beheading of Mary, Queen of Scots
1587.summary: Mary, Queen of Scots, is beheaded in front of 300 witnesses at Fotheringhay Castle, seven days after the signing of a death warrant by her cousin, Queen Elizabeth of England, marking a significant political event.

1587.title: Severe Cold in Western Europe
1587.summary: A period of exceptionally severe cold begins in western Europe and lasts until February 24, affecting agriculture and livelihoods.

1587.title: Imprisonment of Sir Anthony Cope
1587.summary: Sir Anthony Cope, a member of the English Parliament, is imprisoned in the Tower of London after presenting a Puritan revision of the Anglican Book of Common Prayer.

1587.title: New Ruler of the Kingdom of Kongo
1587.summary: Álvaro II Nimi a Nkanga becomes the new ruler of the Kingdom of Kongo, claiming the throne upon the death of his father, Álvaro I, marking a significant dynastic change.

1587.title: Failed Siege of Ayutthaya
1587.summary: Burma's siege of Ayutthaya fails after six months as King Nanda Bayin begins withdrawal, impacting the regional power dynamics in Southeast Asia.

1587.title: Singeing the King of Spain's Beard
1587.summary: English privateer Sir Francis Drake leads a raid in the Bay of Cádiz, sinking at least 23 ships of the Spanish fleet, escalating the conflict between England and Spain.

1587.title: Coronation of Sigismund III Vasa in Poland
1587.summary: Polish and Lithuanian nobles elect Sigismund III Vasa as the ruler following the death of the previous King of Poland, leading to significant political changes.

1587.title: Crowning of Sigismund III Vasa
1587.summary: Sigismund III Vasa is formally crowned as King Zygmunt Waza of Poland and Duke of Lithuania in a coronation ceremony at Kraków.

1588.title: Papal Bull Immensa aeterni Dei
1588.summary: Pope Sixtus V issues a major reorganization of the Roman Curia, creating 15 congregations of cardinals including the Congregation of the Inquisition.

1588.title: Battle of Pitschen
1588.summary: In the War of the Polish Succession, Polish and Lithuanian troops, commanded by Jan Zamoyski, defeat an invading Austrian force led by Archduke Maximilian III, who is taken prisoner.

1588.title: Death of Álvaro de Bazán
1588.summary: The sudden death of Álvaro de Bazán forces King Philip II of Spain to re-allocate the command of the fleet for the Spanish Armada preparations.

1588.title: Siege of Colombo Ends
1588.summary: King Rajasinha I of Sitawaka flees after the siege of Colombo ends when Portuguese Admiral Pedro Teixeira arrives with a fleet.

1588.title: Ascension of Shah Abbas I
1588.summary: Shah Abbas I's ascension as Emperor of the Safavid Empire is made official, marking a significant political shift in Iran.

1588.title: English Recruitment for Invasion
1588.summary: The English Army begins recruitment of volunteers in anticipation of an expected Spanish invasion, leading to military pension reforms.

1588.title: Day of the Barricades
1588.summary: Henry I, Duke of Guise, seizes Paris, forcing King Henry III to flee, marking a significant moment in the French Wars of Religion.

1588.title: Spanish Armada Sets Sail
1588.summary: The Spanish Armada, under the command of the Duke of Medina Sidonia, begins to set sail from the Tagus estuary towards the English Channel.

1588.title: Battle of Gravelines
1588.summary: The Spanish Armada is decisively defeated by the English naval force off the coast of Gravelines, marking a turning point in naval warfare.

1588.title: Cavendish Completes World Voyage
1588.summary: Thomas Cavendish and his fleet complete a record-setting voyage around the world, returning to Plymouth.

1589.title: Battle of Arques
1589.summary: King Henry IV of France's forces defeat those of the Catholic League, under Charles of Lorraine, Duke of Mayenne.

1589.title: Assassination of King Henry III of France
1589.summary: King Henry III of France is assassinated by a fanatical Dominican friar Jacques Clément, who approaches the King on the pretext of delivering a secret message.

1589.title: Succession of King Henry IV of France
1589.summary: Following the death of Henry III of France, Henry of Navarre succeeds to the throne as King Henry IV of France but is not recognized by the Catholic League.

1589.title: Marriage of King James VI of Scotland and Anne of Denmark
1589.summary: King James VI of Scotland contracts a proxy marriage with the 14-year-old Anne of Denmark at Kronborg.

1589.title: Battle of Suriagehara
1589.summary: The Battle of Suriagehara takes place in Japan between the Date and Katakura clans and the Ashina, Satake and Nikaido clans.

1589.title: Capture of Sukagawa Castle
1589.summary: Japanese warlord Date Masamune and his forces capture the Sukagawa Castle, defended by his aunt Onamihime Nikaido, after her assistant betrays her.

1589.title: Election of the Patriarch of Constantinople
1589.summary: Jeremias II Tranos is appointed as the Patriarch of Constantinople, leader of the Eastern Orthodox Church, by Ottoman Sultan Murad III.

1589.title: Job of Moscow elected Patriarch
1589.summary: Job of Moscow is elected as the first Patriarch of Moscow and All Russia.

1589.title: Performance of The Pilgrim Woman
1589.summary: Girolamo Bargagli's play The Pilgrim Woman is given its first performance, premiering in Florence, three years after Bargagli's death.

1589.title: Foundation of Valkendorfs Kollegium
1589.summary: Valkendorfs Kollegium is founded in Copenhagen, Denmark.

1590.title: Crowning of Anne of Denmark
1590.summary: Anne of Denmark is crowned queen consort of England.

1590.title: García Hurtado de Mendoza becomes Viceroy of Peru
1590.summary: García Hurtado de Mendoza becomes the new Viceroy of Peru, serving until 1596.

1590.title: Construction of Fortezza Nuova begins
1590.summary: Construction of the Fortezza Nuova around the city of Livorno begins on the orders of Ferdinando I de' Medici.

1590.title: Luis de Velasco y Castilla becomes Viceroy of New Spain
1590.summary: Luis de Velasco y Castilla becomes the new Viceroy of New Spain, governing until 1595.

1590.title: Capture of Rheinberg
1590.summary: Peter Ernst I von Mansfeld-Vorderort captures the German fortress of Rheinberg during the Eighty Years' War.

1590.title: Maurice of Nassau takes Breda
1590.summary: Maurice of Nassau takes Breda by concealing 68 of his best men in a peat-boat.

1590.title: Battle of Ivry
1590.summary: Henry IV of France defeats the Catholic League forces at the Battle of Ivry.

1590.title: Treaty of Constantinople signed
1590.summary: The Treaty of Constantinople is signed, ending a 12-year war between the Ottoman Empire and Safavid Empire.

1590.title: Siege of Odawara ends
1590.summary: The siege of Odawara ends with the surrender of Odawara, part of Toyotomi Hideyoshi's campaign.

1590.title: Pope Sixtus V dies
1590.summary: Pope Sixtus V dies after five years, leading to a new papal conclave.

1591.title: Execution of John Fian
1591.summary: Scottish schoolmaster John Fian becomes the first person to be executed after the North Berwick witch trials, following his conviction for witchcraft.

1591.title: Papal Commission for Bible Revision
1591.summary: Pope Gregory XIV appoints a commission to revise the Sixtine Vulgate Latin translation of the Bible, leading to the Sixto-Clementine Vulgate.

1591.title: Pension Granted to Edmund Spenser
1591.summary: Poet Edmund Spenser is granted an annual pension by Queen Elizabeth I in recognition of his publication of The Faerie Queen.

1591.title: Excommunication of King Henry IV
1591.summary: Pope Gregory XIV excommunicates King Henry IV of France, ordering clergy and nobles to renounce him.

1591.title: Battle of Tondibi
1591.summary: In Mali, forces sent by the Saadi dynasty ruler of Morocco defeat the Songhai Empire in a decisive battle despite being outnumbered.

1591.title: Emancipation of Filipino Slaves
1591.summary: Pope Gregory XIV orders the emancipation of Filipino slaves along with reparations to former slaves in the Spanish Philippines.

1591.title: Death of Tsarevich Dimitri
1591.summary: Tsarevich Dimitri, son of Ivan the Terrible, is found dead under mysterious circumstances at the palace in Uglich.

1591.title: Siege of Guingamp
1591.summary: Sir John Norreys takes the town of Guingamp in Brittany after a brief siege, on behalf of Henry of Navarre.

1591.title: Capture of Timbuktu
1591.summary: Timbuktu is captured by an expedition of Arma people sent by the Saadi ruler of Morocco.

1591.title: The Battle of the Berlengas
1591.summary: The Battle of the Berlengas takes place off the coast of Portugal between English privateers and Spanish galleys.

1592.title: Pope Clement VIII elected
1592.summary: Cardinal Ippolito Aldobrandini is elected as the new Pontiff of the Roman Catholic Church after 19 rounds of voting by the 54 cardinals present.

1592.title: Murder of James Stewart
1592.summary: George Gordon, 1st Marquess of Huntly, sets fire to Donibristle Castle in Scotland and murders James Stewart, 2nd Earl of Moray.

1592.title: Trinity College Dublin founded
1592.summary: Trinity College Dublin, Ireland's oldest university, is founded.

1592.title: Henry IV's declaration
1592.summary: The future Henry IV of France announces his intention to convert to the Catholic religion.

1592.title: Siege of Busanjin begins
1592.summary: The Japanese invasions of Korea begin with the Siege of Busanjin.

1592.title: Battle of Sangju
1592.summary: The Japanese are victorious over the Koreans fighting for the Kingdom of Joseon.

1592.title: Start of Malta plague epidemic
1592.summary: The Malta plague epidemic begins when galleys from Tuscany arrive on the island with prisoners of war.

1592.title: Battle of Flores
1592.summary: A series of naval engagements in the Azores where the English are victorious against the Spanish.

1592.title: Battle of Sacheon
1592.summary: Korean admiral Yi Sun-sin destroys all 13 Japanese ships using his improved turtle ship.

1592.title: First Bill of Mortality published
1592.summary: London begins publishing the Bill of Mortality, the first regular data of deaths from an epidemic.

1593.title: King Naresuan kills Burmese Crown Prince
1593.summary: Siamese King Naresuan, in combat on elephant back, kills Burmese Crown Prince Mingyi Swa during a significant engagement.

1593.title: Opening of the trial of Giordano Bruno
1593.summary: The Roman Inquisition opens the seven-year trial of scholar Giordano Bruno, marking a notable event in the realm of intellectual freedom.

1593.title: Battle of Piątek
1593.summary: Polish forces led by Janusz Ostrogski achieve victory against their adversaries, highlighting a moment of Polish strength.

1593.title: Siege of Pyongyang
1593.summary: A Japanese invasion is defeated by a combined force of Korean and Ming troops in Pyongyang, impacting regional power dynamics.

1593.title: Battle of Haengju
1593.summary: Korea defeats Japan in a decisive battle, showcasing the military prowess of the Korean forces against an invading power.

1593.title: Uppsala Synod ends
1593.summary: The Uppsala Synod discontinues, marking the end of the Liturgical Struggle between the Swedish Reformation and Counter-Reformation in Sweden.

1593.title: Adriaan van Roomen's calculation of pi
1593.summary: Flemish mathematician Adriaan van Roomen publishes his treatise on the most accurate calculation of pi, making significant advancements in mathematics.

1593.title: First military disability pension law enacted
1593.summary: The English Parliament enacts a law for the first military disability pension in British history, establishing a precedent for veterans' welfare.

1593.title: Battle of Salbertrand
1593.summary: François de Bonne, Duke of Lesdiguières achieves victory over Spanish troops, a significant event in the context of the ongoing conflicts in Italy.

1593.title: Christopher Marlowe's assassination
1593.summary: Christopher Marlowe, a notable English dramatist, is stabbed to death in a dispute, creating waves in the literary community.

1594.title: Conquest of Longvek
1594.summary: The capital of the Kingdom of Cambodia is conquered by the army of the Ayutthaya Kingdom after more than two years of war.

1594.title: Completion of Junagarh Fort
1594.summary: The construction of the Junagarh Fort in the Mughal Empire's principality of Bikaner is completed after almost five years.

1594.title: First Performance of Titus Andronicus
