1923.title: Klaipėda Revolt
1923.summary: Lithuania begins the Klaipėda Revolt to annex the Klaipėda Region.

1923.title: Occupation of the Ruhr
1923.summary: Troops from France and Belgium occupy the Ruhr area, to force Germany to make reparation payments.

1923.title: First Rotorcraft Flight
1923.summary: First flight of the first rotorcraft, Juan de la Cierva's Cierva C.4 autogyro, in Spain.

1923.title: World Record in Cricket
1923.summary: Australian cricketer Bill Ponsford makes 429 runs to break the world record for the highest first-class cricket score.

1923.title: Founding of Eskom
1923.summary: Eskom, the largest electricity producer in Africa, is established in South Africa.

1923.title: Foundation of the Egyptian Feminist Union
1923.summary: The Egyptian Feminist Union, the first nationwide feminist movement in Egypt, is founded.

1923.title: Vladimir Lenin's Stroke
1923.summary: Vladimir Lenin suffers his third stroke, rendering him bedridden and unable to speak; he retires from his position.

1923.title: Inauguration of Wembley Stadium
1923.summary: The original Wembley Stadium in London opens its doors to the public for the first time, staging an FA Cup Final.

1923.title: Great Kantō Earthquake
1923.summary: The Great Kantō earthquake devastates Tokyo and Yokohama, killing more than 100,000 people.

1923.title: Turkey becomes a Republic
1923.summary: Turkey becomes a republic, following the dissolution of the Ottoman Empire; Kemal Atatürk is elected as first president.

1924.title: 1924 Winter Olympics
1924.summary: The first Winter Olympics open in Chamonix, in the French Alps.

1924.title: Gopinath Saha Shoots Ernest Day
1924.summary: Gopinath Saha shoots Ernest Day, whom he has mistaken for Sir Charles Tegart, the police commissioner of Calcutta, and is arrested soon after.

1924.title: Petrograd Renamed Leningrad
1924.summary: Petrograd (Saint Petersburg) is renamed Leningrad; it will revert to Saint Petersburg in 1991.

1924.title: Ramsay MacDonald Becomes Prime Minister
1924.summary: Ramsay MacDonald becomes the first Labour Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

1924.title: Calvin Coolidge Delivers Radio Broadcast
1924.summary: Calvin Coolidge becomes the first President of the United States to deliver a radio broadcast from the White House.

1924.title: Abolition of the Islamic Caliphate
1924.summary: The 407-year-old Islamic caliphate is abolished when Caliph Abdülmecid II of the Ottoman Caliphate is deposed.

1924.title: First Aerial Circumnavigation
1924.summary: U.S. Army pilots John Harding and Erik Nelson complete the first aerial circumnavigation of the globe.

1924.title: Adolf Hitler Sentenced to Prison
1924.summary: Adolf Hitler is sentenced to 5 years in Landsberg Prison in Germany for his participation in the 1923 Beer Hall Putsch.

1924.title: Indian Citizenship Act Signed
1924.summary: U.S. President Calvin Coolidge signs the Indian Citizenship Act into law, granting citizenship to all Native Americans born within the territorial limits of the United States.

1924.title: Hubble Announces Andromeda as Galaxy
1924.summary: American astronomer Edwin Hubble announces that Andromeda is actually another galaxy, and that the Milky Way is only one of many such galaxies.

1925.title: Dissolution of Syrian Federation
1925.summary: The Syrian Federation is officially dissolved, replaced by the State of Syria.

1925.title: Mussolini's Speech
1925.summary: Benito Mussolini makes a pivotal speech in the Italian Chamber of Deputies, regarded as the beginning of his dictatorship.

1925.title: First Female Governor in the U.S.
1925.summary: Nellie Tayloe Ross becomes the first female governor of Wyoming in the United States.

1925.title: The 1925 Serum Run to Nome
1925.summary: The Great Race of Mercy relays diphtheria antitoxin by dog sled across Alaska to combat an epidemic.

1925.title: The Tri-State Tornado
1925.summary: The deadliest tornado in U.S. history rampages through Missouri, Illinois and Indiana, killing 695 people.

1925.title: The Great Gatsby Published
1925.summary: F. Scott Fitzgerald publishes his novel The Great Gatsby in New York.

1925.title: Foundation of Chrysler Corporation
1925.summary: The Chrysler Corporation is founded as an automobile manufacturer by Walter Percy Chrysler.

1925.title: Scopes Trial Begins
1925.summary: John T. Scopes is accused of violating Tennessee state law regarding the teaching of evolution in a staged test case.

1925.title: Foundation of American Samoa Field Work
1925.summary: Anthropologist Margaret Mead lands in American Samoa for field work.

1925.title: First Broadcasting of Grand Ole Opry
1925.summary: The first broadcast of the country music-variety radio program Grand Ole Opry takes place in Nashville, Tennessee.

1926.title: Theodoros Pangalos declares himself dictator in Greece
1926.summary: Theodoros Pangalos declares himself dictator, marking a significant moment in Greek political history.

1926.title: Ibn Saud crowned ruler of the Kingdom of Hejaz
1926.summary: Ibn Saud is crowned as ruler, establishing his influence in the Arabian peninsula.

1926.title: John Logie Baird demonstrates mechanical television
1926.summary: Scottish inventor John Logie Baird showcases a mechanical television system, a major advancement in broadcasting technology.

1926.title: First commercial air route from UK to South Africa established
1926.summary: Alan Cobham establishes the first commercial air route to South Africa, enhancing international travel.

1926.title: Robert H. Goddard launches the first liquid-fuel rocket
1926.summary: Goddard's launch marks a milestone in rocketry and space exploration.

1926.title: Treaty of Berlin
1926.summary: Germany and the Soviet Union pledge neutrality, a key diplomatic agreement during this period.

1926.title: UK General Strike begins
1926.summary: The general strike in the UK begins, significantly impacting the labor movement and economy.

1926.title: Leon Trotsky removed from Politburo
1926.summary: Trotsky's removal from the Soviet Politburo signals significant power shifts within the Communist Party.

1926.title: Agatha Christie disappears
1926.summary: The famous author's mysterious disappearance attracts widespread media attention.

1926.title: The 1926 coup d'état in Portugal
1926.summary: Manuel Gomes da Costa leads a coup that establishes a new authoritarian regime, altering Portugal's political landscape.

1927.title: British Broadcasting Corporation Established
1927.summary: The British Broadcasting Company becomes the British Broadcasting Corporation, marking a crucial development in broadcasting history.

1927.title: First Transatlantic Telephone Call
1927.summary: The first transatlantic telephone call is made via radio from New York City to London, improving global communications.

1927.title: Laurier Palace Theatre Fire
1927.summary: The Laurier Palace Theatre fire in Montreal kills 78 children, a tragic event in Canadian history.

1927.title: Release of Metropolis
1927.summary: Fritz Lang's futuristic film Metropolis is released in Germany, influencing the science fiction film genre.

1927.title: U.S. Marines Invade Nicaragua
1927.summary: U.S. Marines invade Nicaragua to intervene in the Nicaraguan Civil War, affecting U.S.-Latin American relations.

1927.title: Great Mississippi Flood
1927.summary: The Great Mississippi Flood displaces 700,000 people, a significant natural disaster in U.S. history.

1927.title: Charles Lindbergh's Transatlantic Flight
1927.summary: Charles Lindbergh makes the first solo nonstop transatlantic flight from New York City to Paris, a pivotal moment in aviation.

1927.title: Jazz Singer Premiere
1927.summary: The Jazz Singer, the first box-office hit sound film, premieres in New York City, revolutionizing the film industry.

1927.title: Discovery of S-4 Submarine
1927.summary: The U.S. Navy submarine S-4 is sunk by the Coast Guard, resulting in a significant naval tragedy.

1927.title: Iraq Gains Independence
1927.summary: Iraq gains independence from the United Kingdom, a significant political development in the Middle East.

1928.title: Griffith's Experiment
1928.summary: British bacteriologist Frederick Griffith reports the results of Griffith's experiment, indirectly demonstrating that DNA is the genetic material.

1928.title: Defection of Boris Bazhanov
1928.summary: Boris Bazhanov, Joseph Stalin's personal secretary, crosses the border to Iran to defect from the Soviet Union.

1928.title: Trotsky Arrested
1928.summary: The OGPU arrests Leon Trotsky in Moscow; he assumes a status of passive resistance and is exiled with his family.

1928.title: Anak Krakatau Appears
1928.summary: The volcanic island Anak Krakatau appears.

1928.title: Completion of Ford River Rouge Complex
1928.summary: The Ford River Rouge Complex at Dearborn, Michigan, an automobile plant begun in 1917, is completed as the world's largest integrated factory.

1928.title: Broadcasting Television Signal
1928.summary: Scottish-born inventor John Logie Baird broadcasts a transatlantic television signal from London to Hartsdale, New York.

1928.title: 1928 Winter Olympics
1928.summary: The 1928 Winter Olympics are held in St. Moritz, Switzerland, the first as a separate event, with Sonja Henie winning her first gold medal in women's figure skating.

1928.title: Japanese General Election
1928.summary: The Japanese general election produces a hung parliament.

1928.title: Medal of Honor for Charles Lindbergh
1928.summary: Charles Lindbergh is presented with the Medal of Honor for his first transatlantic flight.

1928.title: Foundation of the Muslim Brotherhood
1928.summary: The Muslim Brotherhood is founded in Egypt by Islamic scholar and schoolteacher Hassan al-Banna.

1929.title: Suspension of the Constitution in Yugoslavia
1929.summary: King Alexander of the Serbs, Croats, and Slovenes suspends his country's constitution.

1929.title: Mother Teresa Arrives in India
1929.summary: Albanian missionary sister Agnes Gonxha Bojaxhiu, later known as Mother Teresa, arrives in Calcutta from Ireland to begin her work in India.

1929.title: First Appearance of Tintin
1929.summary: The first appearance of Hergé's Belgian comic book hero Tintin, begins serialization in Le Petit Vingtième.

1929.title: First Appearance of Popeye
1929.summary: The comic strip hero Popeye first appears in Thimble Theatre.

1929.title: Kabul Falls to Saqqawist Forces
1929.summary: Kabul falls to Habibullah Kalakani's forces, beginning a 9-month period of Saqqawist rule in Afghanistan.

1929.title: Publication of All Quiet on the Western Front
1929.summary: All Quiet on the Western Front by Erich Maria Remarque is published in book form.

1929.title: Litvinov's Pact Signed
1929.summary: "Litvinov's Pact" is signed in Moscow by the Soviet Union and several other countries, agreeing not to settle disputes by force.

1929.title: Lateran Treaty Signed
1929.summary: The Kingdom of Italy and the Holy See sign the Lateran Treaty, establishing Vatican City as an independent state.

1929.title: Saint Valentine's Day Massacre
1929.summary: Gangsters are shot dead in Chicago in a notorious incident known as the Saint Valentine's Day Massacre.

1929.title: Wall Street Crash of 1929
1929.summary: The Wall Street Crash of 1929 marks the beginning of the Great Depression, causing significant financial turmoil globally.

1930.title: The Moon moves into perigee
1930.summary: The Moon reaches its closest point to Earth at 356,397 km during its fullest phase of the Lunar Cycle.

1930.title: Indian National Congress declares Independence Day
1930.summary: The Indian National Congress marks this date as Purna Swaraj, advocating for complete independence.

1930.title: First patent for a field-effect transistor
1930.summary: Julius Edgar Lilienfeld is granted the first patent for a field-effect transistor in the United States.

1930.title: Yên Bái mutiny
1930.summary: The Việtnam Quốc Dân Đảng launches the Yên Bái mutiny against French colonial rule in Vietnam.

1930.title: Mahatma Gandhi's civil disobedience announcement
1930.summary: Mahatma Gandhi informs of the upcoming civil disobedience campaign against British rule in India.

1930.title: First frozen foods go on sale
1930.summary: Clarence Birdseye's frozen food products are made available for purchase in Springfield, Massachusetts.

1930.title: Salt March
1930.summary: Mahatma Gandhi leads a 200-mile march to protest the British salt monopoly, starting a significant movement.

1930.title: London Naval Treaty
1930.summary: The United Kingdom, Japan, and the United States sign a treaty to regulate submarine warfare and limit naval shipbuilding.

1930.title: First Women to fly solo from England to Australia
1930.summary: Amy Johnson achieves a historic flight, becoming the first woman to fly solo from England to Australia.

1930.title: Haile Selassie crowned emperor of Ethiopia
1930.summary: Haile Selassie is crowned as emperor, marking a significant event in Ethiopian history.

1931.title: Invention of the Cyclotron
1931.summary: South Dakota native Ernest Lawrence invents the cyclotron, used to accelerate particles to study nuclear physics.

1931.title: City Lights Premiere
1931.summary: Charlie Chaplin comedy drama film City Lights receives its public premiere at the Los Angeles Theater with Albert Einstein as guest of honor.

1931.title: Gandhi-Irwin Pact
1931.summary: The British viceroy of India and Mohandas Gandhi sign the Gandhi–Irwin Pact.

1931.title: Spanish Republic Proclaimed
1931.summary: The Second Spanish Republic is proclaimed in Madrid, marking a significant political change in Spain.

1931.title: Empire State Building Completed
1931.summary: Construction of the Empire State Building is completed in New York City.

1931.title: Hindu-Muslim Communal Riots
1931.summary: Anti-Chinese rioting occurs in Pyongyang, resulting in significant casualties and property damage.

1931.title: Saint-Philibert Disaster
1931.summary: The overloaded pleasure craft Saint-Philibert sinks at the mouth of the River Loire in France; over 450 drown.

1931.title: Hoover Moratorium
1931.summary: U.S. President Herbert Hoover issues the Hoover Moratorium in an attempt to stop the banking crisis.

1931.title: First Round-the-World Flight
1931.summary: Wiley Post and Harold Gatty accomplish the first round-the-world flight in a single-engine plane.

1931.title: Discovery of Heavy Hydrogen
1931.summary: Heavy hydrogen, later named deuterium, is discovered by American chemist Harold Urey, advancing scientific research.

1932.title: Arrest of Gandhi and Patel
1932.summary: The British authorities in India arrest and intern Mahatma Gandhi and Vallabhbhai Patel.

1932.title: Sakuradamon Incident
1932.summary: Korean nationalist Lee Bong-chang fails in his effort to assassinate Emperor Hirohito of Japan, leading to an attack on Shanghai by the Japanese.

1932.title: Salvadoran Peasant Uprising
1932.summary: The 1932 Salvadoran peasant uprising begins, suppressed by the government of Maximiliano Hernández Martínez.

1932.title: End of Libyan Resistance
1932.summary: Marshal Pietro Badoglio declares the end of Libyan resistance against Italian forces.

1932.title: HMS M2 Sinks
1932.summary: The British submarine HMS M2 sinks with all 60 hands aboard.

1932.title: January 28 Incident
1932.summary: Conflict between Japan and China occurs in Shanghai, escalating tensions in the region.

1932.title: World Disarmament Conference
1932.summary: A general World Disarmament Conference begins in Geneva, focusing on Germany's demands for equality.

1932.title: Winter Olympics
1932.summary: The 1932 Winter Olympics open in Lake Placid, New York, showcasing winter sports on a global stage.

1932.title: Lindbergh Kidnapping
1932.summary: Charles Lindbergh Jr., the infant son of famous aviator Charles Lindbergh, is kidnapped from the family home.

1932.title: Paul Doumer Assassination
1932.summary: Paul Gorguloff shoots French president Paul Doumer in Paris, resulting in Doumer's death the next day.

1933.title: Construction of the Golden Gate Bridge begins
1933.summary: The iconic construction project in San Francisco, known for its stunning Art Deco style and engineering marvel.

1933.title: Sir Charles Kingsford Smith makes the first commercial flight between Australia and New Zealand
1933.summary: This milestone flight connected the two nations, enhancing aviation travel in the region.

1933.title: Choudhry Rahmat Ali publishes Pakistan Declaration
1933.summary: A significant pamphlet that advocated for a Muslim state in northwest India, influencing the Pakistan Movement.

1933.title: Adolf Hitler is appointed Chancellor of Germany
1933.summary: A pivotal event that marked the rise of Nazi power and the beginning of totalitarian rule in Germany.

1933.title: The Reichstag fire
1933.summary: Germany's parliament building is set ablaze, leading to broader suppression of civil liberties by the Nazi regime.

1933.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt is sworn in as president
1933.summary: He begins his first term, initiating significant changes during the Great Depression with new policies.

1933.title: King Kong premieres in New York City
1933.summary: The original film introduced revolutionary stop-motion animation and became an iconic piece of cinema history.

1933.title: The Great Depression Bank Holiday
1933.summary: Roosevelt’s proclamation led to the temporary closure of all U.S. banks to stabilize the economy.

1933.title: Dachau concentration camp opens
1933.summary: The first Nazi concentration camp opens, marking a dark chapter in history regarding human rights abuses.

1933.title: The Civil Works Administration is unveiled
1933.summary: A key component of Roosevelt’s New Deal to provide jobs during the unemployed crisis, impacting millions.

1934.title: International Telecommunication Union established
1934.summary: A specialist agency of the League of Nations is established.

1934.title: Nepal–Bihar earthquake
1934.summary: The 8.0 Mw Nepal–Bihar earthquake strikes Nepal and Bihar, killing an estimated 6,000–10,700 people.

1934.title: German–Polish declaration of non-aggression
1934.summary: A 10-year declaration of non-aggression is signed by Nazi Germany and the Second Polish Republic.

1934.title: Gold Reserve Act signed
1934.summary: President Franklin D. Roosevelt signs the Gold Reserve Act, raising the statutory gold price.

1934.title: Fatherland Front gains power
1934.summary: The Fatherland Front consolidates its power in Austria after a series of clashes.

1934.title: League of Nations membership
1934.summary: The Soviet Union joins the League of Nations.

1934.title: Nuremberg Rally held
1934.summary: The 6th Nuremberg Rally is staged by the German Nazi Party.

1934.title: Loch Ness Monster photograph published
1934.summary: The 'surgeon's photograph' of the Loch Ness Monster is published in the Daily Mail.

1934.title: Abyssinia Crisis begins
1934.summary: Ethiopian and Italian troops exchange gunfire, marking the start of the Abyssinia Crisis.

1934.title: Lieutenant Kijé premiered
1934.summary: The orchestral suite Lieutenant Kijé by Sergei Prokofiev is premiered.

1935.title: Birth of Elvis Presley
1935.summary: Famous American rock and roll artist Elvis Presley is born in Tupelo, Mississippi.

1935.title: Amelia Earhart's solo flight
1935.summary: Amelia Earhart becomes the first person to successfully complete a solo flight from Hawaii to California, a distance of 2,408 miles.

1935.title: Saar Basin plebiscite
1935.summary: A plebiscite in the Territory of the Saar Basin shows that 90.3% of those voting wish to join Germany.

1935.title: First canned beer sold
1935.summary: The first canned beer is sold in Richmond, Virginia, United States, by Gottfried Krueger Brewing Company.

1935.title: Parker Brothers sells Monopoly
1935.summary: Parker Brothers begins selling the board game Monopoly in the United States.

1935.title: Discovery of Prontosil
1935.summary: The discovery and clinical development of Prontosil, the first broadly effective antibiotic, is published in Germany's pre-eminent medical journal.

1935.title: Hitler reinstates Luftwaffe
1935.summary: In Nazi Germany, Adolf Hitler orders reinstatement of the air force, the Luftwaffe, in violation of the 1919 Treaty of Versailles.

1935.title: World's first regular television program
1935.summary: The world's first regular television program is transmitted from the Funkturm in Berlin, Germany.

1935.title: Dust Bowl - Black Sunday
1935.summary: Dust Bowl: 'Black Sunday', the great dust storm in the United States hits eastern New Mexico and Colorado, and western Oklahoma the hardest.

1935.title: Birth of Alcoholics Anonymous
1935.summary: Alcoholics Anonymous is founded in Akron, Ohio, United States, by William G. Wilson and Dr. Robert Smith.

1936.title: Death of George V
1936.summary: King George V of the United Kingdom dies at Sandringham Estate, leading to the succession of his son Edward VIII.

1936.title: State funeral of George V
1936.summary: The state funeral of George V takes place, with a procession through London to Windsor Castle.

1936.title: Synthetic Radium E
1936.summary: Radium E (bismuth-210) becomes the first radioactive element made synthetically.

1936.title: IV Olympic Winter Games
1936.summary: The IV Olympic Winter Games open in Garmisch-Partenkirchen, Germany, showcasing winter sports.

1936.title: Battle of Amba Aradam
1936.summary: Italian forces achieve a decisive tactical victory in the Second Italo-Ethiopian War, neutralizing Ethiopian resistance.

1936.title: Spanish General Election
1936.summary: The left-wing Popular Front coalition wins a majority in the 1936 Spanish general election.

1936.title: Reoccupation of Rhineland
1936.summary: Nazi Germany violates the Treaty of Versailles and Locarno Treaties by reoccupying the Rhineland.

1936.title: Completion of Hoover Dam
1936.summary: The construction of Hoover Dam is completed, marking a major engineering achievement in the United States.

1936.title: Spanish Civil War begins
1936.summary: The Spanish Army of Africa launches a coup against the Republican Second Spanish Republic, starting the Spanish Civil War.

1936.title: First regular television service
1936.summary: The BBC launches the world's first regular television service in high-definition.

1937.title: Ohio River Flood
1937.summary: Water levels begin to rise in the Ohio River, leading to the Ohio River flood of 1937, which leaves 1 million people homeless and results in 385 deaths.

1937.title: Spanish Civil War: The Second Battle of the Corunna Road
1937.summary: The Second Battle of the Corunna Road ends inconclusively during the Spanish Civil War.

1937.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt's Second Inauguration
1937.summary: Franklin D. Roosevelt is sworn in for a second term as President of the United States, marking the first inauguration on January 20 due to the Twentieth Amendment.

1937.title: The Moscow Trials
1937.summary: Seventeen leading Communists go on trial in the Soviet Union for alleged involvement in a plot to overthrow Joseph Stalin.

1937.title: Patenting of Nylon
1937.summary: Wallace H. Carothers receives a patent for nylon in the United States, a significant material for future developments in textiles.

1937.title: New London School Explosion
1937.summary: In a catastrophic explosion at the New London School in Texas, in excess of 295 students and teachers are killed, marking the worst school disaster in American history.

1937.title: Hindenburg Disaster
1937.summary: The German airship Hindenburg bursts into flames while mooring in Lakehurst, New Jersey, resulting in 36 fatalities.

1937.title: Guernica Bombing
1937.summary: The Bombing of Guernica is carried out by the Nazi German Luftwaffe during the Spanish Civil War, leading to widespread destruction and hundreds of casualties.

1937.title: Opening of the Golden Gate Bridge
1937.summary: The Golden Gate Bridge opens in San Francisco, a significant engineering achievement of the time.

1937.title: Release of Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
1937.summary: Walt Disney's Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs premieres as the world's first full-length animated feature film, marking a milestone in animation.

1938.title: King Farouk marries Queen Farida
1938.summary: On January 20, King Farouk of Egypt marries Safinaz Zulficar, who becomes Queen Farida, in Cairo.

1938.title: Collapse of Honeymoon Bridge
1938.summary: On January 27, the Honeymoon Bridge at Niagara Falls collapses due to an ice jam, resulting in significant destruction.

1938.title: Abolishment of War Ministry
1938.summary: On February 4, Adolf Hitler abolishes the War Ministry, establishing the Oberkommando der Wehrmacht, thus gaining direct control over the German military.

1938.title: Release of Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
1938.summary: Walt Disney's Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, the first cel-animated feature movie, is released in the United States.

1938.title: Battle of Teruel ends
1938.summary: On February 22, the Battle of Teruel concludes with a Nationalist victory, marking a significant turning point in the Spanish Civil War.

1938.title: Anschluss
1938.summary: On March 12, German troops occupy Austria, officially annexing the country on March 13.

1938.title: First appearance of Superman
1938.summary: Superman first appears in Action Comics #1 on April 18, marking a significant moment in comic book history.

1938.title: 1938 Yellow River flood
1938.summary: On June 5 & 7, the Nationalist government in China creates the Yellow River flood to hinder Japanese advances, resulting in at least 400,000 deaths.

1938.title: Joe Louis beats Max Schmeling
1938.summary: On June 22, heavyweight boxing champion Joe Louis knocks out Max Schmeling in the first round of their rematch, showcasing American sports.

1938.title: Night of Broken Glass (Kristallnacht)
1938.summary: On November 9, Kristallnacht occurs, a widespread attack on Jewish people and properties in Germany, resulting in significant violence and destruction.

1939.title: German invasion of Poland
1939.summary: Beginning of WWII with the opening shots at 4:45 Central European Time. The German battleship Schleswig-Holstein begins firing on a Polish military installation, marking the start of the Battle of Westerplatte.

1939.title: Fall Weiß
1939.summary: Adolf Hitler orders the German military to start planning for the invasion of Poland, increasing tensions across Europe.

1939.title: Foundation of Hewlett-Packard
1939.summary: The Hewlett-Packard technology and scientific instruments manufacturing company is founded by Bill Hewlett and David Packard, marking a significant advance in technology.

1939.title: Molotov-Ribbentrop Pact
1939.summary: Germany and the Soviet Union sign a neutrality treaty that also agrees to the division of Eastern Europe, escalating geopolitical tensions.

1939.title: Declaration of War on Germany
1939.summary: The United Kingdom and France declare war on Nazi Germany, bringing multiple countries into the conflict and altering the course of history.

1939.title: Spanish Civil War End
1939.summary: The Spanish Civil War comes to an end when the last Republican forces surrender, reshaping Spain's political landscape.

1939.title: New York World's Fair
1939.summary: The 1939 New York World's Fair opens, showcasing technological innovations and cultural advancements to the public.

1939.title: Amelia Earhart declared dead
1939.summary: U.S. aviator Amelia Earhart is officially declared dead after her disappearance, marking a significant event in aviation history.

1939.title: Royal Navy's First Major Casualty
1939.summary: The ocean liner SS Athenia becomes the first British civilian casualty of the war when it is torpedoed by a German submarine.

1939.title: Women's Rights Performance
1939.summary: Marian Anderson performs before 75,000 people at the Lincoln Memorial after being denied access to Constitution Hall, highlighting civil rights issues in America.

1940.title: Luftwaffe Chief Hermann Göring Assumes Control
1940.summary: Hermann Göring assumes control of most war industries in Germany amidst World War II.

1940.title: Battle of Raate Road
1940.summary: Outnumbered Finnish troops decisively defeat Soviet forces at the Battle of Raate Road during the Winter War.

1940.title: Battle of Suomussalmi
1940.summary: Finnish forces destroy the Soviet 44th Rifle Division in a decisive clash during the Winter War.

1940.title: Mechelen Incident
1940.summary: A German plane with secret invasion plans forced to land in Belgium, sparking mobilization in the Low Countries.

1940.title: Peace Resolution in South Africa
1940.summary: A peace resolution in the Parliament of South Africa is defeated amid World War II tensions.

1940.title: Dunkirk Evacuation Ends
1940.summary: The evacuation of 300,000 Allied troops from Dunkirk concludes, marking a significant WWII moment.

1940.title: Adolf Hitler's Speech
1940.summary: Adolf Hitler delivers a speech to Berlin, threatening retaliatory air raids on British cities.

1940.title: Operation Wesley
1940.summary: Germany invades Norway and Denmark, marking the beginning of the Norwegian Campaign.

1940.title: The Great Dictator Premiere
1940.summary: Charlie Chaplin's acclaimed film, a satirical critique of fascism, premieres in New York City.

1940.title: Battle of Britain Begins
1940.summary: The Battle of Britain commences as German forces target British air defenses.

1941.title: Start of the Thai Solar Calendar
1941.summary: Thailand's Prime Minister decrees January 1 as the official start of the Thai solar calendar new year.

1941.title: USS Missouri Keel Laid
1941.summary: The keel of battleship USS Missouri is laid at the New York Navy Yard in Brooklyn.

1941.title: Lend-Lease Act Introduced
1941.summary: The Lend-Lease Act is introduced into the United States Congress, aimed at providing military support to allies.

1941.title: Elmer's Pet Rabbit Released
1941.summary: The short subject Elmer's Pet Rabbit is released, marking the second appearance of Bugs Bunny.

1941.title: Discovery of Penicillin
1941.summary: Reserve Constable Albert Alexander becomes the first person treated with penicillin intravenously, by Howard Florey's team.

1941.title: First Use of Penicillin
1941.summary: A patient reacts positively to being treated with penicillin, marking a significant medical advance.

1941.title: Formation of the USO
1941.summary: The United Service Organization is created to entertain American troops during World War II.

1941.title: Battle of Tobruk
1941.summary: Australian and British forces capture Tobruk from the Italians in Libya during World War II.

1941.title: First Jet Aircraft Flown
1941.summary: The first British jet aircraft, the Gloster E.28/39, is flown, marking a significant advancement in aviation.

1941.title: Pearl Harbor Attack
1941.summary: Japanese forces launch a surprise attack on the United States fleet at Pearl Harbor, drawing the US into World War II.

1942.title: Declaration by United Nations
1942.summary: The Declaration by United Nations is signed by China, the United Kingdom, the United States, the Soviet Union, and 22 other nations, agreeing not to make any separate peace with the Axis powers.

1942.title: Battle of Slim River
1942.summary: Japanese forces of the 5th Division sweep through British defenses, shattering the exhausted Indian Division and inflicting some 3,000 casualties.

1942.title: Holocaust Wannsee Conference
1942.summary: Nazis convene to decide on the Final Solution to the Jewish problem, which is deportations to extermination camps.

1942.title: Fall of Singapore
1942.summary: Commonwealth forces surrender to the Japanese, leading to about 80,000 British, Indian, and Australian troops becoming prisoners of war.

1942.title: Doolittle Raid
1942.summary: Lieutenant Colonel James Doolittle leads a bombing mission against Japan, marking the first time American bombers attack the Japanese mainland.

1942.title: Battle of Midway
1942.summary: An American naval victory halts the Japanese advance in the Pacific, marking a significant turning point in World War II.

1942.title: Operation Torch
1942.summary: Elements of the Allied expeditionary force land simultaneously in Morocco and Algeria, marking a significant move against Axis forces in North Africa.

1942.title: Guadalcanal Campaign
1942.summary: The U.S. Navy and Marine Corps start the first American offensive of the war with an amphibious landing on Guadalcanal.

1942.title: Anne Frank Goes into Hiding
1942.summary: Anne Frank and her family go into hiding to escape Nazi persecution in Amsterdam.

1942.title: Leningrad Premiere of Shostakovich's Symphony No. 7
1942.summary: Shostakovich's Symphony No. 7 is premiered in Leningrad, providing morale during the Siege of Leningrad.

1943.title: Surrender of the German 6th Army
1943.summary: The Battle of Stalingrad comes to an end with the surrender of the German 6th Army, marking a significant turning point in World War II.

1943.title: Casablanca Conference
1943.summary: Franklin D. Roosevelt and Winston Churchill meet with Generals de Gaulle and Giraud to strategize the next phase of the European war effort at a secret meeting in Morocco.

1943.title: Guadalcanal Campaign Ends
1943.summary: United States forces secure control of Guadalcanal following the evacuation of Japanese forces, ending a crucial campaign in the Solomon Islands.

1943.title: Holocaust: Warsaw Ghetto Uprising
1943.summary: The uprising begins when Nazi troops enter the Warsaw Ghetto to round up remaining Jews, marking a pivotal moment in Jewish resistance during the Holocaust.

1943.title: The Dambusters Raid
1943.summary: Operation Chastise uses bouncing bombs to breach German dams in the Ruhr Valley, emphasizing technological innovation in warfare.

1943.title: Battle of Kursk
1943.summary: The largest tank battle in history occurs, marking a significant defeat for German forces during World War II.

1943.title: Tehran Conference
1943.summary: FDR, Churchill, and Stalin meet to discuss war strategies against Axis powers and agree on the planned invasion of Europe.

1943.title: Publication of The Little Prince
1943.summary: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry's self-illustrated novella, a major literary work, is published in New York City.

1943.title: Establishment of ENIAC
1943.summary: The U.S. Army commissions the development of ENIAC, the first electronic general-purpose computer, marking a significant advancement in technology.

1943.title: Massacre of Kalavryta
1943.summary: Nazi forces execute all adult males in the Greek town of Kalavryta as a reprisal for resistance actions, illustrating the atrocities of the Holocaust.

1944.title: Free French General Jean de Lattre de Tassigny appointed to command French Army B
1944.summary: On January 2, 1944, Free French General Jean de Lattre de Tassigny is appointed to command French Army B, part of the Sixth United States Army Group in North Africa.

1944.title: San Juan earthquake
1944.summary: On January 1944, an earthquake hits San Juan, Argentina, killing an estimated 10,000 people, in the worst natural disaster in Argentina's history.

1944.title: The Battle of Monte Cassino begins
1944.summary: On January 17, 1944, the Battle of Monte Cassino begins in Italy, where Allied forces engage in a significant military operation against a well-defended German position.

1944.title: Operation Shingle
1944.summary: On January 22, 1944, the Allies begin the assault on Anzio, Italy, marking a critical point in the Italian Campaign during World War II.

1944.title: The Siege of Leningrad is lifted
1944.summary: On January 27, 1944, the two-year Siege of Leningrad is lifted, marking a turning point in the Eastern Front of World War II.

1944.title: Battle of Cisterna
1944.summary: On January 30, 1944, the Battle of Cisterna opens as United States Army Rangers attempt to break out of the Anzio beachhead, leading to intense fighting.

1944.title: Battle of Monte Cassino begins
1944.summary: On March 15, 1944, Allied aircraft bomb the monastery at Monte Cassino, marking an important offensive during the Italian Campaign of WWII.

1944.title: The Political Committee of National Liberation created in Greece
1944.summary: On March 12, 1944, the Political Committee of National Liberation is created in Greece, symbolizing the formation of a resistance government against Axis occupation.

1944.title: The last eruption of Mount Vesuvius
1944.summary: On March 18, 1944, the last eruption of Mount Vesuvius occurs, killing 26 and causing thousands to flee their homes during WWII.

1944.title: D-Day: Allied landings on Normandy
1944.summary: On June 6, 1944, D-Day marks the largest amphibious military operation in history as 155,000 Allied troops land on the beaches of Normandy, beginning the liberation of Western Europe.

1945.title: Soviet Red Army liberates Auschwitz
1945.summary: The Nazi concentration and extermination camp Auschwitz is liberated by the Soviet Red Army.

1945.title: Operation Bodenplatte
1945.summary: Germany begins Operation Bodenplatte, an attempt by the Luftwaffe to cripple Allied air forces in the Low Countries.

1945.title: American and Australian troops land at Lingayen Gulf
1945.summary: American and Australian troops land at Lingayen Gulf on Luzon, occupied by Japan since 1942.

1945.title: Vistula–Oder Offensive
1945.summary: The Soviet Union begins the Vistula–Oder Offensive in Eastern Europe against the German Army.

1945.title: Adolf Hitler takes residence in the Führerbunker
1945.summary: Adolf Hitler takes residence in the Führerbunker in Berlin.

1945.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt is sworn in for a fourth term
1945.summary: Franklin D. Roosevelt becomes the only President to exceed two terms.

1945.title: Yalta Conference
1945.summary: The Big Three leaders meet at the Yalta Conference to discuss post-war reorganization.

1945.title: Atomic bombing of Hiroshima
1945.summary: The United States drops an atomic bomb on Hiroshima, resulting in massive casualties.

1945.title: Atomic bombing of Nagasaki
1945.summary: The United States drops an atomic bomb on Nagasaki, resulting in significant destruction and loss of life.

1945.title: Victory over Japan Day (V-J Day)
1945.summary: Emperor Hirohito announces Japan's unconditional surrender, marking the end of WWII in Asia.

1946.title: First meeting of the UN
1946.summary: The first meeting of the United Nations is held, at Methodist Central Hall Westminster in London.

1946.title: Project Diana
1946.summary: Project Diana bounces radar waves off the Moon, measuring the exact distance between the Earth and the Moon, and proves that communication is possible between Earth and outer space, effectively opening the Space Age.

1946.title: Establishment of People's Republic of Albania
1946.summary: Enver Hoxha declares the People's Republic of Albania, with himself as prime minister.

1946.title: Nuclear Testing Operation Crossroads
1946.summary: Operation Crossroads, a series of nuclear weapon tests conducted by the United States at Bikini Atoll in Micronesia, is initiated.

1946.title: Inaugural session of the International Court of Justice
1946.summary: The inaugural session of the International Court of Justice (ICJ) takes place at The Hague.

1946.title: King David Hotel bombing
1946.summary: The Irgun bombs the King David Hotel in Jerusalem, killing 90.

1946.title: UNESCO is established
1946.summary: UNESCO (the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization) is established as a specialized agency of the United Nations.

1946.title: The Winecoff Hotel fire
1946.summary: The Winecoff Hotel fire in Atlanta, United States, kills 119.

1946.title: Foundation of the International Organization for Standardization
1946.summary: The International Organization for Standardization (ISO) is founded.

1946.title: First artificial nuclear chain reaction in Europe
1946.summary: The first artificial, self-sustaining nuclear chain reaction in Europe is initiated, within the Soviet nuclear reactor F-1.

1947.title: Nigeria gains autonomy
1947.summary: Nigeria achieves a significant milestone by gaining autonomy on January 1.

1947.title: Der Spiegel published
1947.summary: The first issue of the weekly magazine Der Spiegel is published in Hanover, Germany, edited by Rudolf Augstein on January 4.

1947.title: Vincent Auriol inaugurated
1947.summary: Vincent Auriol is inaugurated as the president of France on January 16, marking a new political era.

1947.title: Sinking of the SS Heimara
1947.summary: The ferry SS Heimara sinks in the South Euboean Gulf of Greece, resulting in the death of 392 people on January 19.

1947.title: KLM Douglas DC-3 crash
1947.summary: A KLM Douglas DC-3 aircraft crashes shortly after takeoff from Kastrup Airport in Copenhagen, killing all 22 onboard, including Prince Gustaf Adolf and opera singer Grace Moore on January 26.

1947.title: Formation of the South Pacific Commission
1947.summary: The South Pacific Commission (SPC) is founded on February 7 to promote economic and social development in the Pacific islands.

1947.title: Cold War: Voice of America broadcasts
1947.summary: The Voice of America begins to transmit broadcasts into Eastern Europe and the Soviet Union as tensions rise during the Cold War on February 17.

1947.title: The first instant camera demonstrated
1947.summary: Edwin Land demonstrates the first instant camera, the Polaroid Land Camera, at a meeting in New York on February 21.

1947.title: Jackie Robinson signs with Brooklyn Dodgers
1947.summary: Jackie Robinson makes history by signing a contract with the Brooklyn Dodgers, becoming the first African American in Major League Baseball on April 15.

1947.title: Independence of Pakistan and India
1947.summary: The regions of the British Empire gain independence as Pakistan on August 14 and India on August 15, marking a new chapter in South Asian history.

1948.title: GATT Inauguration
1948.summary: The General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT) is inaugurated, aiming to promote international trade by reducing tariffs and other trade barriers.

1948.title: Burma Independence
1948.summary: Burma gains its independence from the United Kingdom, becoming the 'Union of Burma', with Sao Shwe Thaik as its first President and U Nu its first Prime Minister.

1948.title: Mahatma Gandhi Assassination
1948.summary: Indian pacifist and leader Mahatma Gandhi is shot by Nathuram Godse in New Delhi, leading to widespread mourning and political upheaval in India.

1948.title: Establishment of the World Health Organization
1948.summary: The World Health Organization is established by the United Nations to coordinate and direct global health efforts.

1948.title: The Israeli Declaration of Independence
1948.summary: The Israeli Declaration of Independence is made, David Ben-Gurion becomes the first prime minister, and the British Mandate of Palestine is officially terminated.

1948.title: Berlin Blockade Begins
1948.summary: The Berlin Blockade begins, marking a significant event during the early Cold War, as the Soviet Union blocks Western Allies from accessing West Berlin.

1948.title: Introduction of Long-Playing Records
1948.summary: Columbia Records introduces its 33+1/3 rpm long playing phonograph format, revolutionizing the music industry by allowing longer recordings.

1948.title: Foundation of the National Health Service
1948.summary: The National Health Service in the United Kingdom begins functioning, offering universal healthcare free at the point of use.

1948.title: First Soviet Launch into Space
1948.summary: The R-1 missile on test becomes the first Soviet launch to enter space, marking a milestone in the early Space Race.

1948.title: Establishment of the RAND Corporation
1948.summary: The RAND Corporation is established as an independent nonprofit policy research and analysis institution, influencing policy decision-making.

1949.title: End of the Indo-Pakistani War of 1947
1949.summary: A United Nations-sponsored ceasefire brings an end to the Indo-Pakistani War of 1947, resulting in a stalemate and the division of Kashmir, which still continues as of 2024.

1949.title: First Networked Television Broadcasts
1949.summary: The first networked television broadcasts take place as KDKA-TV in Pittsburgh goes on the air, connecting east coast and mid-west programming in the United States.

1949.title: Formation of the 18th Turkish Government
1949.summary: Şemsettin Günaltay forms the new government of Turkey, marking the last single party government of the Republican People's Party.

1949.title: VW Type 1 Arrives in the U.S.
1949.summary: The first VW Type 1 arrives in the United States, brought by Dutch businessman Ben Pon, but initially struggles to gain interest among dealers.

1949.title: Establishment of COMECON
1949.summary: The Council for Mutual Economic Assistance (CMEA or COMECON) is established by the Soviet Union and other communist nations to facilitate economic cooperation.

1949.title: Establishment of NATO
1949.summary: The North Atlantic Treaty is signed in Washington, D.C., creating the NATO defense alliance during the height of post-World War II tensions.

1949.title: Launch of South Pacific on Broadway
1949.summary: Rodgers and Hammerstein's South Pacific opens on Broadway, becoming one of their longest-running musicals and an instant classic.

1949.title: NATO Established
1949.summary: The North Atlantic Treaty Organization is formally established, signifying a major military alliance in response to Soviet expansion.

1949.title: KDKA-TV Broadcasts
1949.summary: KDKA-TV in Pittsburgh broadcasts the first networked television transmissions, revolutionizing the way media is consumed in America.

1949.title: Establishment of the People's Republic of China
1949.summary: The People's Republic of China is officially proclaimed, marking a significant shift in global geopolitics and international relations.

1950.title: Formation of the International Police Association
1950.summary: The largest police organization in the world is formed.

1950.title: Sverdlovsk plane crash
1950.summary: Aeroflot Lisunov Li-2 crashes in a snowstorm, killing all 19 aboard, including the national ice hockey team of the Soviet Air Force.

1950.title: UK recognizes People's Republic of China
1950.summary: The United Kingdom recognizes the People's Republic of China, leading to severed diplomatic relations with the Republic of China.

1950.title: HMS Truculent submarine collision
1950.summary: Submarine HMS Truculent collides with oil tanker Divina in the Thames Estuary and sinks; 64 die.

1950.title: India promulgates its constitution
1950.summary: India forms a republic and Rajendra Prasad is sworn in as its first president.

1950.title: Klaus Fuchs confesses Soviet spying
1950.summary: Klaus Fuchs confesses to boiling British and U.S. nuclear secrets for the Soviet Union, prompting international security concerns.

1950.title: The start of the Korean War
1950.summary: North Korean forces invade South Korea, marking the beginning of the Korean War.

1950.title: First television broadcast network in South America
1950.summary: Rede Tupi is founded in Brazil, marking a significant advancement in television broadcasting in South America.

1950.title: First race of the FIA Formula One World Championship
1950.summary: The inaugural race of the first Formula One World Championship is held at Silverstone, England.

1950.title: Eruption of Mount Lamington
1950.summary: Mount Lamington erupts in New Guinea, leading to significant geological and social impact.

1951.title: Eruption of Mount Lamington
1951.summary: Mount Lamington in Papua New Guinea erupts catastrophically, killing nearly 3,000 people and causing great devastation in Oro Province.

1951.title: Korean War: Third Battle of Seoul
1951.summary: Chinese and North Korean forces capture Seoul for the second time (having lost the Second Battle of Seoul in September 1950).

1951.title: Abandonment of the Tanganyika groundnut scheme
1951.summary: The Government of the United Kingdom announces abandonment of the Tanganyika groundnut scheme for the cultivation of peanuts in the Tanganyika Territory.

1951.title: Winter of Terror: Avalanches in the Alps
1951.summary: Avalanches in the Alps kill 240 and bury 45,000 temporarily, in Switzerland, Austria and Italy.

1951.title: Woodbridge train wreck
1951.summary: A Pennsylvania Railroad passenger train derails near Woodbridge Township, New Jersey, killing 85 people and injuring over 500.

1951.title: Operation Greenhouse: First thermonuclear weapon test
1951.summary: The first thermonuclear weapon is tested in the 'George' test on Enewetok Atoll in the Marshall Islands by the United States.

1951.title: First Pan American Games
1951.summary: The first Pan American Games open in Buenos Aires, marking a significant multi-sport event in the Americas.

1951.title: Treaty of San Francisco
1951.summary: In San Francisco, representatives sign a peace treaty with Japan, formally ending the Pacific War.

1951.title: The formation of the Organization of Central American States
1951.summary: The Organization of Central American States is formed to promote regional cooperation and integration.

1951.title: Gian Carlo Menotti's opera premieres
1951.summary: Gian Carlo Menotti's 45-minute opera, Amahl and the Night Visitors, premieres live on NBC in the United States, becoming the first opera written especially for television.

1952.title: Black Saturday in Egypt
1952.summary: Rioters burn Cairo's central business district, targeting British and upper-class Egyptian businesses.

1952.title: Queen Elizabeth II becomes monarch
1952.summary: Princess Elizabeth, Duchess of Edinburgh, becomes monarch of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland after the death of her father, King George VI.

1952.title: First mechanical heart used
1952.summary: In the United States, a mechanical heart is used for the first time in a human patient.

1952.title: Winter Olympics in Oslo
1952.summary: The Winter Olympics are held in Oslo, Norway.

1952.title: State Funeral of King George VI
1952.summary: The State Funeral of King George VI takes place, with his coffin brought in procession through London to Windsor.

1952.title: Greece and Turkey join NATO
1952.summary: Greece and Turkey officially join the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

1952.title: Police open fire in Dhaka
1952.summary: Police open fire on a student procession in Dhaka, killing 4 people, igniting nationwide protests.

1952.title: Paricutin volcano ceases eruption
1952.summary: The Paricutin volcano in Michoacán ceases its discontinuous eruption after spewing forth a gigaton of lava.

1952.title: Battle of Nanri Island
1952.summary: The Republic of China seizes Nanri Island from the People's Republic of China.

1952.title: U.S. Supreme Court limits presidential power
1952.summary: The U.S. Supreme Court limits the power of the President during the steel strike by ruling against nationalization of the steel mills.

1953.title: The North Sea flood of 1953
1953.summary: The North Sea flood kills 1,836 people in the southwestern Netherlands, 307 in the United Kingdom, and several hundred at sea, marking one of the deadliest natural disasters in Europe.

1953.title: Eisenhower inaugurated as President
1953.summary: Dwight D. Eisenhower is sworn in as the 34th President of the United States.

1953.title: Joan Watson and Francis Crick discover DNA structure
1953.summary: James Watson and Francis Crick announce their discovery of the structure of the DNA molecule, a major advancement in genetics and biology.

1953.title: Joseph Stalin suffers a stroke
1953.summary: Joseph Stalin suffers a stroke, leading to his incapacitation until his death on March 5, 1953, dramatically impacting Soviet leadership.

1953.title: Mau Mau Uprising
1953.summary: Rebels in Kenya kill the Ruck family during the Mau Mau Uprising, which has significant implications for British colonial rule in Kenya.

1953.title: The first ascent of Mount Everest
1953.summary: Sir Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay become the first climbers to reach the summit of Mount Everest, marking a landmark achievement in mountaineering.

1953.title: Eisenhower's Chance for Peace speech
1953.summary: President Eisenhower delivers his "Chance for Peace" speech to the National Association of Newspaper Editors, advocating for peace in the context of the Cold War.

1953.title: DNA double helix described
1953.summary: Francis Crick and James Watson publish their paper describing the double helix structure of DNA, revolutionizing genetics and molecular biology.

1953.title: The 1953 Ionian earthquake
1953.summary: The Ionian earthquake of magnitude 7.2 devastates Cephalonia and other Ionian Islands, causing extensive damage in Greece.

1953.title: Elizabeth II crowned Queen
1953.summary: Elizabeth II is crowned as the Queen of the United Kingdom and the Commonwealth realms at Westminster Abbey, a significant event in British history.

1954.title: Soviet Union ceases demand for war reparations
1954.summary: The Soviet Union ceases to demand war reparations from West Germany.

1954.title: First public demonstration of machine translation
1954.summary: The first public demonstration of a machine translation system is held in New York, at IBM's head office.

1954.title: Disaster of BOAC Flight 781
1954.summary: BOAC Flight 781, a de Havilland Comet jet plane, disintegrates in mid-air and crashes in the Mediterranean; all on board are killed.

1954.title: Avalanches in Austria
1954.summary: Avalanches in Austria kill more than 200.

1954.title: Establishment of the National Negro Network
1954.summary: The US-based National Negro Network is established, with 46 member radio stations, amplifying African American voices.

1954.title: Launch of USS Nautilus
1954.summary: The first nuclear-powered submarine, the USS Nautilus, is launched in Groton, Connecticut, by First Lady Mamie Eisenhower.

1954.title: Mass vaccination against polio
1954.summary: The first mass vaccination of children against polio begins in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, marking a significant health milestone.

1954.title: The Battle of Dien Bien Phu begins
1954.summary: Viet Minh forces begin a massive artillery bombardment on the French military, starting the climactic Battle of Dien Bien Phu.

1954.title: Establishment of UEFA
1954.summary: The UEFA (Union of European Football Associations) is formed in Basel, Switzerland, influencing football in Europe significantly.

1954.title: First Godzilla film premieres
1954.summary: The first Godzilla film premieres in Tokyo, launching a globally popular franchise and genre in cinema.

1955.title: USS Nautilus puts to sea
1955.summary: The first nuclear-powered submarine, USS Nautilus, puts to sea for the first time, from Groton, Connecticut.

1955.title: End of WWII between USSR and Germany
1955.summary: The Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the Soviet Union announces the end of the war between the USSR and Germany, which began in 1941 during World War II.

1955.title: Establishment of SEATO
1955.summary: The Southeast Asia Treaty Organization (SEATO) is established in Bangkok to counter communist influence in Southeast Asia.

1955.title: Salk polio vaccine approval
1955.summary: The Salk polio vaccine, having passed large-scale trials earlier, receives full approval by the Food and Drug Administration.

1955.title: First franchised McDonald's opens
1955.summary: The first franchised McDonald's restaurant is opened by Ray Kroc in Des Plaines, Illinois, marking a significant milestone in fast food.

1955.title: Le Mans disaster
1955.summary: Eighty-three people are killed and at least 100 are injured after two race cars collide in the 1955 24 Hours of Le Mans.

1955.title: Rosa Parks and the bus boycott
1955.summary: Rosa Parks refuses to give up her bus seat in Montgomery, Alabama, leading to her arrest and initiating the Montgomery bus boycott.

1955.title: Creation of the Warsaw Pact
1955.summary: Eight Communist Bloc countries, including the Soviet Union, sign a mutual defence treaty in Warsaw, Poland, called the Warsaw Pact.

1955.title: Emergence of the Vietnam War
1955.summary: The Vietnam War officially begins with conflict between the Democratic Republic of Vietnam and the Republic of Vietnam.

1955.title: Little Richard records Tutti Frutti
1955.summary: Little Richard records his hit song "Tutti Frutti" in New Orleans, which will become a famous rock and roll track.

1956.title: Anglo-Egyptian Condominium ends
1956.summary: The Anglo-Egyptian Condominium ends in Sudan after 57 years.

1956.title: Operation Auca
1956.summary: Five U.S. evangelical Christian missionaries are killed for trespassing by the Waorani people of Ecuador, shortly after making contact with them.

1956.title: Suez Crisis
1956.summary: Egyptian president Gamal Abdel Nasser nationalizes the Suez Canal, sparking international condemnation.

1956.title: Elvis Presley enters music charts
1956.summary: Elvis Presley enters the United States music charts for the first time, with Heartbreak Hotel.

1956.title: First episodes of As the World Turns
1956.summary: The first episodes of As the World Turns and The Edge of Night are broadcast on the CBS Television Network in the United States.

1956.title: Montgomery bus boycott
1956.summary: The related civil suit is heard in federal district court; the U.S. Supreme Court will uphold the ruling in November.

1956.title: The first Eurovision Song Contest
1956.summary: The first Eurovision Song Contest is broadcast from Lugano, Switzerland, with the host country winning.

1956.title: Suez Crisis International Response
1956.summary: The United Nations General Assembly adopts a resolution calling for the withdrawal of UK, France, and Israel from Arab lands immediately.

1956.title: First mass protests in Poznań
1956.summary: Labour riots in Poznań, Poland, are crushed with heavy loss of life, as Soviet troops fire at a crowd protesting high prices, killing 53 people.

1956.title: Formation of Pakistan as an Islamic republic
1956.summary: Pakistan becomes the first Islamic republic, and a national holiday is observed in the country, including the state of East Pakistan.

1957.title: The Saarland joins West Germany
1957.summary: The Saarland officially becomes a part of West Germany, marking a significant political change in post-war Europe.

1957.title: Hamilton Watch Company introduces the first electric watch
1957.summary: A major advancement in watch technology, the introduction of the first electric watch revolutionizes timekeeping.

1957.title: British Prime Minister Anthony Eden resigns
1957.summary: Anthony Eden resigns amid political tensions and criticisms regarding the Suez Crisis, paving the way for Harold Macmillan.

1957.title: Harold Macmillan becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
1957.summary: Harold Macmillan takes office as the new Prime Minister, leading the UK in a crucial period of post-war recovery.

1957.title: The African Convention is founded in Dakar
1957.summary: An important political milestone, the African Convention is established to enhance solidarity among African nations.

1957.title: The film Throne of Blood is released in Japan
1957.summary: Akira Kurosawa's adaptation of Macbeth, this film becomes a significant cultural contribution to cinema.

1957.title: The Ibirapuera Planetarium is inaugurated
1957.summary: Located in São Paulo, this is the first planetarium in the Southern Hemisphere, promoting education in astronomy.

1957.title: USS Nautilus logs its 60,000th nautical mile
1957.summary: The first nuclear-powered submarine achieves a historic milestone, showcasing advancements in naval technology.

1957.title: Net als toen wins the Eurovision Song Contest
1957.summary: A significant event in European music history, 'Net als toen' wins the popular contest, enhancing the song's fame.

1957.title: The Treaty of Rome establishes the EEC
1957.summary: A landmark agreement that lays the groundwork for the European Economic Community, paving the way for European integration.

1958.title: Formation of the European Economic Community
1958.summary: The European Economic Community (EEC) comes into being.

1958.title: West Indies Federation is formed
1958.summary: The West Indies Federation is formed.

1958.title: Edmund Hillary's South Pole Expedition
1958.summary: Edmund Hillary's Commonwealth Trans-Antarctic Expedition completes the third overland journey to the South Pole, the first to use powered vehicles.

1958.title: Munich Air Disaster
1958.summary: Seven Manchester United footballers are among the 21 people killed in the Munich air disaster in West Germany.

1958.title: Cuban Rebels Kidnap Fangio
1958.summary: Cuban rebels kidnap five-time world driving champion Juan Manuel Fangio, releasing him 28 hours later.

1958.title: Van Cliburn Wins Tchaikovsky Competition
1958.summary: Van Cliburn wins the International Tchaikovsky Competition for pianists in Moscow, breaking Cold War tensions.

1958.title: Expo 58 Opening
1958.summary: King Baudouin of Belgium officially opens the world's fair in Brussels, also known as Expo 58.

1958.title: Launch of Sputnik 3
1958.summary: The Soviet Union launches Sputnik 3 into space.

1958.title: Explorer 4 Launched
1958.summary: Explorer program: Explorer 4 is launched in the United States.

1958.title: First Integrated Circuit Invented
1958.summary: Jack Kilby invents the first integrated circuit, while working at Texas Instruments.

1959.title: Cuban Revolution
1959.summary: Fulgencio Batista flees Havana when the forces of Fidel Castro advance.

1959.title: Luna 1
1959.summary: Soviet lunar probe Luna 1 is the first human-made object to attain escape velocity from Earth.

1959.title: Alaska Statehood
1959.summary: Alaska is admitted as the 49th U.S. state.

1959.title: Léopoldville Riots
1959.summary: At least 49 people are killed during clashes in Léopoldville in the Belgian Congo.

1959.title: Charles de Gaulle Inauguration
1959.summary: Charles de Gaulle is inaugurated as the first president of the French Fifth Republic.

1959.title: Vega de Tera Disaster
1959.summary: The Vega de Tera disaster in Spain nearly destroys Ribadelago and kills 144 residents.

1959.title: Day the Music Died
1959.summary: A chartered plane transporting musicians Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens, and The Big Bopper crashes.

1959.title: First Weather Satellite
1959.summary: Vanguard 2, the first weather satellite, is launched to measure cloud cover.

1959.title: Tibetan Uprising
1959.summary: The Tibetan uprising erupts in Lhasa when Chinese officials attempt to arrest the Dalai Lama.

1959.title: Antarctic Treaty
1959.summary: Twelve countries sign a landmark treaty that sets aside Antarctica as a scientific preserve.

1960.title: Construction of Aswan Dam
1960.summary: Aswan Dam construction begins in Egypt.

1960.title: Wind of Change Speech
1960.summary: British Prime Minister Harold Macmillan makes the Wind of Change speech for the first time, to little publicity.

1960.title: U.S.-Japan Security Treaty
1960.summary: A revised version of the U.S.-Japan Security Treaty is signed, allowing U.S. troops to be based on Japanese soil, opposed by Anpo protests in Japan.

1960.title: Coalbrook Mining Disaster
1960.summary: A coal mine collapses in South Africa, killing 435 miners.

1960.title: Avianca Flight 671 Crash
1960.summary: Avianca Flight 671 crashes in Montego Bay, Jamaica, killing 37, marking the worst air disaster in Jamaica's history.

1960.title: Insurrection in Algiers
1960.summary: A major insurrection occurs in Algiers against French colonial policy.

1960.title: CERN Particle Accelerator
1960.summary: The first CERN particle accelerator becomes operational in Geneva, Switzerland.

1960.title: Atomic Bomb Test
1960.summary: France tests its first atomic bomb, Gerboise Bleue, in the Sahara Desert of Algeria.

1960.title: Sharpeville Massacre
1960.summary: The Sharpeville massacre in South Africa results in more than 69 black protesters shot dead by police, 300 injured.

1961.title: United States severs diplomatic relations with Cuba
1961.summary: United States President Dwight D. Eisenhower announces that the United States has severed diplomatic and consular relations with Cuba.

1961.title: Koivulahti air disaster
1961.summary: Douglas DC-3C OH-LCC of Finnish airline Aero crashes near Kvevlax, Finland, killing all 25 on board due to pilot error.

1961.title: Formation of new Turkish government
1961.summary: General Cemal Gürsel forms the new government of Turkey after the 1960 military coup.

1961.title: NATO-type African organization formed
1961.summary: Five African chiefs of state announce plans for a NATO-type African organization to ensure common defense following a conference in Casablanca.

1961.title: Referendum supports de Gaulle's policies
1961.summary: In France, a referendum supports Charles de Gaulle's policies on independence for Algeria.

1961.title: Eisenhower's final State of the Union
1961.summary: President Dwight Eisenhower gives his final State of the Union Address to Congress and warns of the increasing power of a military–industrial complex.

1961.title: John F. Kennedy inaugurated
1961.summary: John F. Kennedy is sworn in as the 35th President of the United States.

1961.title: B-52 crash in North Carolina
1961.summary: A B-52 Stratofortress, with two nuclear bombs, crashes near Goldsboro, North Carolina.

1961.title: The Beatles perform at The Cavern Club
1961.summary: The Beatles perform at The Cavern Club for the first time following their return to Liverpool from Hamburg.

1961.title: Yuri Gagarin's space flight
1961.summary: Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin becomes the first human to fly in outer space, orbiting the Earth once before parachuting to the ground.

1962.title: Western Samoa independence
1962.summary: Western Samoa becomes independent from New Zealand.

1962.title: Harmelen train disaster
1962.summary: 93 die in the worst Dutch rail disaster.

1962.title: U.S. embargo against Cuba
1962.summary: The United States embargo against Cuba is announced.

1962.title: John Glenn orbits Earth
1962.summary: John Glenn becomes the first American to orbit the Earth, three times in 4 hours, 55 minutes while aboard Friendship 7.

1962.title: First James Bond film premiere
1962.summary: Dr. No, the first James Bond film, premieres in London, featuring Sean Connery as the hero.

1962.title: Cuban Missile Crisis
1962.summary: U.S. President John F. Kennedy announces the presence of Soviet missiles in Cuba.

1962.title: Algeria independent referendum
1962.summary: Supporters of Algerian independence win a 99% majority in a referendum.

1962.title: First live trans-Atlantic TV signal
1962.summary: Telstar relays the first live trans-Atlantic television signal.

1962.title: The Beatles' first single release
1962.summary: The Beatles' first single 'Love Me Do' is released in the U.K.

1962.title: Spider-Man introduction
1962.summary: Spider-Man is introduced by Marvel Comics with the publication of Amazing Fantasy #15.

1963.title: Bogle–Chandler case
1963.summary: Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation scientist Dr. Gilbert Bogle and Mrs. Margaret Chandler are found dead near the Lane Cove River, Sydney, Australia.

1963.title: Battle of Ap Bac
1963.summary: The Viet Cong win their first major victory in the Vietnam War.

1963.title: 1963 Togolese coup d'état
1963.summary: A military coup in Togo results in the installation of coup leader Emmanuel Bodjollé as president.

1963.title: Élysée Treaty
1963.summary: France and West Germany sign the Élysée Treaty, strengthening their bilateral relations.

1963.title: 1963 South Vietnamese coup
1963.summary: Arrest and assassination of Ngo Dinh Diem, the South Vietnamese President.

1963.title: Martin Luther King Jr.'s "I Have a Dream" speech
1963.summary: Martin Luther King Jr. delivers his famous speech during the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom.

1963.title: Assassination of John F. Kennedy
1963.summary: In a motorcade in Dallas, Texas, U.S. President John F. Kennedy is fatally shot by Lee Harvey Oswald.

1963.title: Introduction of ZIP codes
1963.summary: ZIP codes are introduced by the United States Postal Service, improving mail delivery efficiency.

1963.title: Formation of Malaysia
1963.summary: Malaysia is formed through the merging of the Federation of Malaya and Singapore.

1963.title: Valentina Tereshkova in space
1963.summary: Vostok 6 carries Soviet cosmonaut Valentina Tereshkova, the first woman into space.

1964.title: Dissolution of Federation
1964.summary: The Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland is dissolved.

1964.title: First Meeting of Churches
1964.summary: Pope Paul VI and Patriarch Athenagoras I meet in Jerusalem, marking the first meeting between leaders of the Roman Catholic and Orthodox churches since the fifteenth century.

1964.title: Leyland Buses Sale
1964.summary: Leyland Motor Corp. announces the sale of 450 buses to the Cuban government, which challenges the United States blockade of Cuba.

1964.title: Martyrs' Day Clashes
1964.summary: Armed clashes occur between U.S. troops and Panamanian civilians in the Panama Canal Zone, leading to the deaths of 21 Panamanians and 4 U.S. soldiers.

1964.title: Surgeon General's Report
1964.summary: U.S. Surgeon General Luther Terry reports that smoking may be hazardous to health, marking a significant public health statement.

1964.title: Kenneth Kaunda Inauguration
1964.summary: Kenneth Kaunda is inaugurated as the first Prime Minister of Northern Rhodesia, a significant political change in the region.

1964.title: Diplomatic Relations Established
1964.summary: France and the People's Republic of China announce their decision to establish diplomatic relations, altering global diplomatic dynamics.

1964.title: U.S. Air Force Jet Incident
1964.summary: A U.S. Air Force jet training aircraft is shot down by Soviet fighters near Erfurt after straying into East Germany, killing all three crewmen.

1964.title: Winter Olympics
1964.summary: The 1964 Winter Olympics are held in Innsbruck, Austria, showcasing international winter sports competition.

1964.title: Bloodless Coup in South Vietnam
1964.summary: General Nguyễn Khánh leads a bloodless military coup d'état, replacing Dương Văn Minh as Prime Minister of South Vietnam.

1965.title: Meeting of Northern Ireland and Republic of Ireland Leaders
1965.summary: The Prime Minister of Northern Ireland and the Taoiseach of the Republic of Ireland meet for the first time in 43 years.

1965.title: Lyndon B. Johnson's Inauguration
1965.summary: Lyndon B. Johnson is sworn in for a full term as President of the United States.

1965.title: State Funeral of Winston Churchill
1965.summary: The state funeral of Sir Winston Churchill takes place in London with the largest assembly of dignitaries in the world until the 2005 funeral of Pope John Paul II.

1965.title: Independence of Gambia
1965.summary: The Gambia becomes independent from the United Kingdom.

1965.title: Ranger 8 Mission
1965.summary: Ranger 8 crashes into the Moon, after a successful mission of photographing possible landing sites for the Apollo program astronauts.

1965.title: Beginning of Vietnam War: Operation Rolling Thunder
1965.summary: The United States Air Force 2nd Air Division, United States Navy and South Vietnamese air force begin a 31⁄2-year aerial bombardment campaign against North Vietnam.

1965.title: First Mass in Local Languages
1965.summary: Mass in the Catholic Church worldwide is said in local languages (rather than Latin) for the first time.

1965.title: First Person Walks in Space
1965.summary: Cosmonaut Alexei Leonov leaves his Voskhod 2 spacecraft for 12 minutes, becoming the first person to walk in space.

1965.title: Pope Paul VI's Visit to the United States
1965.summary: Pope Paul VI visits the United States, appearing for a Mass in Yankee Stadium and making a speech at the United Nations.

1965.title: US Troops Occupy Dominican Republic
1965.summary: U.S. troops occupy the Dominican Republic in response to a political crisis.

1966.title: Coup in the Central African Republic
1966.summary: In a coup, Colonel Jean-Bédel Bokassa takes over as military ruler of the Central African Republic, ousting President David Dacko.

1966.title: Upper Voltan coup d'état
1966.summary: President Maurice Yaméogo is deposed by a military coup in the Republic of Upper Volta (modern-day Burkina Faso).

1966.title: Tashkent Declaration
1966.summary: Pakistani–Indian peace negotiations end successfully with the signing of the Tashkent Declaration, a day before the sudden death of Indian prime minister Lal Bahadur Shastri.

1966.title: Nigerian coup d'état
1966.summary: A bloody military coup is staged in Nigeria, deposing the civilian government and resulting in the death of Prime Minister Abubakar Tafawa Balewa.

1966.title: Air India Flight 101 Crash
1966.summary: Air India Flight 101 crashes into Mont Blanc, killing all 117 people on board, including Homi J. Bhabha, chairman of the Indian Atomic Energy Commission.

1966.title: Luna 9 spacecraft landing
1966.summary: The unmanned Soviet Luna 9 spacecraft makes the first controlled rocket-assisted landing on the Moon.

1966.title: Cultural Revolution begins
1966.summary: The Chinese Communist Party issues the 'May 16 Notice', marking the beginning of the Cultural Revolution.

1966.title: First U.S. spacewalk
1966.summary: Gene Cernan completes the second U.S. spacewalk during Gemini 9A.

1966.title: Gemini 8 docking
1966.summary: NASA spacecraft Gemini 8 conducts the first docking in space with an Agena target vehicle.

1966.title: Abduction of the Beaumont children
1966.summary: Three children disappear on their way to Glenelg, South Australia, never to be seen again. Their fate remains unknown.

1967.title: Expo 67 World's Fair
1967.summary: Canada begins a year-long celebration of the 100th anniversary of Confederation, featuring the Expo 67 World's Fair.

1967.title: Operation Deckhouse Five
1967.summary: USMC and ARVN troops launch Operation Deckhouse Five in the Mekong Delta during the Vietnam War.

1967.title: Outer Space Treaty
1967.summary: The United States, Soviet Union and United Kingdom sign the Outer Space Treaty, prohibiting weapons of mass destruction from space.

1967.title: Apollo 1
1967.summary: U.S. astronauts Gus Grissom, Ed White, and Roger Chaffee are killed when fire breaks out in their Apollo spacecraft during a launch pad test.

1967.title: The Velvet Underground & Nico
1967.summary: The Velvet Underground's first album, initially a commercial failure, is released in the United States, but later receives critical acclaim.

1967.title: Smithsonian American Art Museum Case
1967.summary: Major protests against the Vietnam War take place, organized by leading activists.

1967.title: Six-Day War
1967.summary: Israel defeats Arab countries, significantly impacting the geopolitical landscape of the Middle East.

1967.title: Nigerian Civil War Begins
1967.summary: Nigerian forces invade Biafra, marking the beginning of a devastating civil conflict.

1967.title: First Heart Transplant
1967.summary: Christiaan Barnard carries out the world's first heart transplant at Groote Schuur Hospital in Cape Town.

1967.title: The Beatles Release Magical Mystery Tour
1967.summary: The Beatles' film Magical Mystery Tour receives its world premiere on BBC Television in the UK.

1968.title: Tet Offensive Begins
1968.summary: The Tet Offensive begins as Viet Cong forces launch a series of surprise attacks across South Vietnam.

1968.title: North Korea Seizes USS Pueblo
1968.summary: North Korea seizes the USS Pueblo, claiming the ship violated its territorial waters while spying.

1968.title: Martin Luther King Jr. Assassinated
1968.summary: Martin Luther King Jr. is shot dead at the Lorraine Motel in Memphis, Tennessee. King-assassination riots erupt in major American cities.

1968.title: Prague Spring Ends
1968.summary: The Warsaw Pact invades Czechoslovakia, ending the Prague Spring of political liberalization.

1968.title: Assassination of Robert F. Kennedy
1968.summary: Senator Robert F. Kennedy, a leading Democratic presidential candidate, is shot at the Ambassador Hotel in Los Angeles.

1968.title: Apollo 7 Launch
1968.summary: NASA launches Apollo 7, the first crewed Apollo mission, enabling the first live television broadcast from orbit.

1968.title: Vietnam War: My Lai Massacre
1968.summary: American troops kill scores of civilians in My Lai, undermining U.S. support for the Vietnam War.

1968.title: Student Demonstrations in Paris
1968.summary: One million march through the streets of Paris amidst growing protests and riots.

1968.title: Columbia University Protests
1968.summary: Student protesters at Columbia University take over administration buildings and shut down the university.

1969.title: Explosion kills 27 on USS Enterprise
1969.summary: An explosion aboard the aircraft carrier USS Enterprise near Hawaii kills 28 and injures 314.

1969.title: Ariana Afghan Airlines Flight 701 crash
1969.summary: Ariana Afghan Airlines Flight 701 crashes into a house on its approach to London's Gatwick Airport, killing 50 of the 62 people on board and two of the home's occupants.

1969.title: Richard Nixon sworn in
1969.summary: Richard Nixon is sworn in as the 37th President of the United States.

1969.title: Assassination attempt on Leonid Brezhnev
1969.summary: An assassination attempt is carried out on Soviet leader Leonid Brezhnev by deserter Viktor Ilyin. One person is killed, several are injured. Brezhnev escaped unharmed.

1969.title: The 1969 Santa Barbara oil spill
1969.summary: A blowout on Union Oil's Platform A spills 80,000 to 100,000 barrels of crude oil into a channel and onto the beaches of Santa Barbara County in Southern California.

1969.title: Apollo 9 launched
1969.summary: NASA launches Apollo 9 to test the lunar module.

1969.title: First Concorde test flight
1969.summary: In Toulouse, France, the first Concorde test flight is conducted, marking a significant advancement in aviation.

1969.title: Apollo 11 Moon landing
1969.summary: Apollo 11's Lunar Module Eagle lands on the Moon's surface, and Neil Armstrong takes his first historic steps on the Moon.

1969.title: Woodstock Festival held
1969.summary: The Woodstock Festival is held near White Lake, New York, featuring some of the top rock musicians of the era.

1969.title: Apollo 12 launched
1969.summary: NASA launches Apollo 12, the second crewed mission to the Moon, furthering space exploration.

1970.title: Unix time epoch reached
1970.summary: Unix time epoch reached at 00:00:00 UTC, marking a significant milestone in computing.

1970.title: Tonghai earthquake
1970.summary: The 7.1 Mw Tonghai earthquake shakes Tonghai County, Yunnan, China, resulting in between 10,000 and 14,621 fatalities and 30,000 injuries.

1970.title: Biafra capitulates
1970.summary: Biafra capitulates, ending the Nigerian Civil War, after a prolonged conflict for independence.

1970.title: Benavidez rail disaster
1970.summary: The Benavidez rail disaster near Buenos Aires, Argentina, kills 236 people when a train derails.

1970.title: Avalanche in France
1970.summary: An avalanche at Val-d'Isère, France, kills 41 tourists, highlighting the dangers of winter sports.

1970.title: Ohsumi satellite launch
1970.summary: Ohsumi, Japan's first satellite, is launched successfully, marking a milestone in Japanese space exploration.
