1970.title: Rhodesia declares republic
1970.summary: Rhodesia severs its last ties with the United Kingdom, declaring itself a republic, sparking international controversy.

1970.title: Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty
1970.summary: The Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty goes into effect after ratification by 56 nations, a pivotal moment in global nuclear policy.

1970.title: Expo '70 World's Fair
1970.summary: The Expo '70 World's Fair opens in Suita, Osaka, Japan, showcasing international advancements and culture.

1970.title: Killing of Biafran forces
1970.summary: Following Biafra's defeat, a formal surrender ceremony takes place, ending the civil conflict.

1971.title: Glasgow Crush
1971.summary: 66 people are killed and over 200 injured during a crush in Glasgow, Scotland.

1971.title: First ODI Cricket Match
1971.summary: The first ever One Day International cricket match is played between Australia and England at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

1971.title: Geoffrey Jackson Kidnapped
1971.summary: Tupamaros kidnap Geoffrey Jackson, British ambassador to Uruguay, in Montevideo, keeping him captive until September.

1971.title: All in the Family Debut
1971.summary: The landmark United States television sitcom All in the Family debuts on CBS.

1971.title: Aswan High Dam Opens
1971.summary: The Aswan High Dam officially opens in Egypt.

1971.title: Apollo 14 Launch
1971.summary: Apollo program: Apollo 14 carrying astronauts Alan Shepard, Stuart Roosa, and Edgar Mitchell lifts off for the third lunar landing mission.

1971.title: Vietnam War: Invasion of Laos
1971.summary: Backed by American air and artillery support, South Vietnamese troops invade Laos during the Vietnam War.

1971.title: Decimal Day
1971.summary: Decimal Day: The United Kingdom and Ireland both switch to decimal currency.

1971.title: THX 1138 Premiere
1971.summary: THX 1138, George Lucas' first full-length film, premieres in theaters.

1971.title: Victory Day of Bangladesh
1971.summary: The Pakistan Army in East Pakistan surrenders to the joint forces of India and the Bengali nationalist, ending the Bangladesh Liberation War.

1972.title: Kurt Waldheim becomes Secretary-General of the United Nations
1972.summary: Kurt Waldheim is appointed as the Secretary-General of the United Nations, marking a significant political event in international relations.

1972.title: Introduction of the first scientific hand-held calculator
1972.summary: HP-35, the first scientific hand-held calculator, is introduced to the market, revolutionizing technology in education and engineering.

1972.title: Iberia Airlines Flight 602 crash
1972.summary: Iberia Airlines Flight 602 crashes into a peak on Ibiza, resulting in the deaths of 104 people, highlighting concerns over aviation safety.

1972.title: The sinking of RMS Queen Elizabeth
1972.summary: The RMS Queen Elizabeth catches fire and sinks in Victoria Harbor, Hong Kong, a notable loss in maritime history.

1972.title: Declaration of a new constitutional government in Bangladesh
1972.summary: Sheikh Mujibur Rahman declares a new constitutional government in Bangladesh, elevating the country's newfound independence.

1972.title: Independence of Bangladesh confirmed by Mukti Bahini
1972.summary: Members of the Mukti Bahini lay down their arms to the government of newly independent Bangladesh, marking the end of a significant conflict.

1972.title: Bloody Sunday in Derry, Northern Ireland
1972.summary: The British Army kills 14 unarmed nationalist civil rights marchers, escalating tensions in the Northern Irish conflict.

1972.title: The signing of the Biological Weapons Convention
1972.summary: The U.S. and the Soviet Union join other nations in signing the Biological Weapons Convention, a major step toward disarmament.

1972.title: The launch of Apollo 16
1972.summary: Apollo 16 is launched, continuing the United States' commitment to lunar exploration during the space race.

1972.title: The Munich massacre
1972.summary: Eleven Israeli athletes are murdered during the Munich Olympics, marking a tragic event that impacts global politics and security.

1973.title: United Kingdom, Republic of Ireland and Denmark join the EEC
1973.summary: The United Kingdom, the Republic of Ireland and Denmark enter the European Economic Community, which later becomes the European Union.

1973.title: Nixon announces Vietnam War offensive suspension
1973.summary: Citing progress in peace negotiations, U.S. President Richard Nixon announces the suspension of offensive action in North Vietnam.

1973.title: Ferdinand Marcos becomes President for Life
1973.summary: Ferdinand Marcos becomes President for Life of the Philippines.

1973.title: Nixon sworn in for second term
1973.summary: Richard Nixon is sworn in for a second term as President of the United States.

1973.title: Sunshine Showdown
1973.summary: George Foreman defeats Joe Frazier to win the heavyweight world boxing championship in Kingston, Jamaica.

1973.title: Paris Peace Accords signed
1973.summary: U.S. involvement in the Vietnam War ends with the signing of the Paris Peace Accords.

1973.title: Military insurrection in Uruguay
1973.summary: A military insurrection in Uruguay poses an institutional challenge to President Juan María Bordaberry.

1973.title: Shooting down of Libyan Arab Airlines Flight 114
1973.summary: Libyan Arab Airlines Flight 114 is shot down by Israeli fighter aircraft over the Sinai Desert, resulting in 108 deaths.

1973.title: The Troubles referendum in Northern Ireland
1973.summary: A referendum is held in Northern Ireland over whether to reunite with the Republic of Ireland or to stay a part of the UK, resulting in a 98% vote to remain.

1973.title: First handheld mobile phone call
1973.summary: The first handheld mobile phone call is made by Martin Cooper of Motorola in New York City.

1974.title: Bülent Ecevit forms new government
1974.summary: Bülent Ecevit of CHP forms the new government of Turkey (37th government, partner MSP).

1974.title: Joelma Building fire
1974.summary: Fire breaks out in the Joelma Building in São Paulo, Brazil; 177 die, 293 are injured, 11 die later of their injuries.

1974.title: Skylab 4 returns to Earth
1974.summary: After a record 84 days in orbit, the crew of Skylab 4 returns to Earth.

1974.title: Zamalek disaster
1974.summary: A soccer stampede occurs in Cairo, killing 49.

1974.title: Turkish Airlines Flight 981 crash
1974.summary: Turkish Airlines Flight 981, travelling from Paris to London, crashes in the woods near Paris, killing all 346 aboard, the deadliest single aircraft accident with no survivors.

1974.title: UK general election
1974.summary: A hung parliament in the United Kingdom general election leads to Conservative prime minister Edward Heath resigning and being succeeded by Labour's Harold Wilson.

1974.title: Chipko movement begins
1974.summary: A group of peasant women in Chamoli district, Uttarakhand, India, use their bodies to surround trees to prevent loggers from felling them, giving rise to the Chipko movement.

1974.title: First women summit Manaslu
1974.summary: An all-female Japanese team summits Manaslu in Nepal, becoming the first women to climb an 8,000 m peak.

1974.title: Waterloo wins Eurovision
1974.summary: Swedish pop group ABBA's song "Waterloo" wins the 1974 Eurovision Song Contest in Brighton, England, UK.

1974.title: Nixon resigns
1974.summary: U.S. President Richard Nixon announces his resignation, effective the next day, amid the Watergate scandal.

1975.title: Watergate Scandal Verdict
1975.summary: John N. Mitchell, H. R. Haldeman, and John Ehrlichman are found guilty of the Watergate cover-up.

1975.title: Tasman Bridge Disaster
1975.summary: The Tasman Bridge in Hobart is struck by the MV Lake Illawarra, causing a partial collapse resulting in 12 deaths.

1975.title: Alvor Agreement
1975.summary: Portugal announces that it will grant independence to Angola on November 11.

1975.title: Haicheng Earthquake
1975.summary: The Haicheng earthquake kills 2,041 and injures 27,538 in Liaoning, China, in a claimed example of earthquake prediction.

1975.title: The Köln Concert
1975.summary: Jazz pianist Keith Jarrett plays the solo improvisation at the Cologne Opera, becoming the best-selling piano recording in history.

1975.title: Vietnam War: Fall of Saigon
1975.summary: The Vietnam War concludes as North Vietnamese forces take over Saigon, leading to mass evacuation.

1975.title: Independence of Angola
1975.summary: Angola becomes independent from Portugal, leading to civil war.

1975.title: First Woman Leader of a Political Party in UK
1975.summary: Margaret Thatcher defeats Edward Heath for the leadership of the opposition UK Conservative Party, becoming Britain's first female political leader.

1975.title: Tragedy in Laos
1975.summary: The communist Pathet Lao takes over Vientiane, ending the Laotian Civil War and forming the Lao People's Democratic Republic.

1975.title: Helsinki Accords
1975.summary: The Helsinki Accords are signed in Finland, officially recognizing Europe’s national borders and outlining respect for human rights.

1976.title: The International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights enters into force
1976.summary: This is a significant step towards the recognition and protection of economic, social and cultural rights on an international level.

1976.title: The Pol Pot regime proclaims a new constitution for Democratic Kampuchea
1976.summary: This marks a key moment in the establishment of the Khmer Rouge's authoritarian regime in Cambodia.

1976.title: Full diplomatic relations established between Bangladesh and Pakistan
1976.summary: This formalizes relations five years after the Bangladesh Liberation War, marking a significant development in South Asia.

1976.title: The United States vetoes UN resolution on Palestinian state
1976.summary: This decision highlights ongoing tensions in the Middle East regarding Palestinian statehood.

1976.title: The 1976 Winter Olympics begin
1976.summary: This international sporting event takes place in Innsbruck, Austria, showcasing winter sports and athletes from around the world.

1976.title: The 7.5 Mw Guatemala earthquake
1976.summary: This devastating earthquake affects Guatemala and Honduras, causing massive loss of life and injuries.

1976.title: General Murtala Mohammed of Nigeria is assassinated
1976.summary: His assassination during a military coup marks a critical turning point in Nigeria's political history.

1976.title: The Cray-1 supercomputer is released
1976.summary: The introduction of the first commercially developed supercomputer represents a major milestone in computing technology.

1976.title: Apple Computer Company is formed by Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak
1976.summary: This establishment marks the beginning of one of the most influential technology companies in history.

1976.title: The Great Bookie Robbery in Melbourne
1976.summary: A significant heist leads to a loss of A$1.4 million, capturing public attention in Australia.

1977.title: Three bomb explosions
1977.summary: Three bombs explode in Moscow within 37 minutes, killing seven. The bombings are attributed to an Armenian separatist group.

1977.title: Mount Nyiragongo eruption
1977.summary: Mount Nyiragongo erupts in eastern Zaire, causing significant geological and environmental impact.

1977.title: Collision in Barcelona harbour
1977.summary: 49 marines from the USS Trenton and USS Guam are killed as a result of a collision in Barcelona harbour, Spain.

1977.title: Legionnaires' disease identified
1977.summary: Scientists identify a previously unknown bacterium as the cause of the mysterious Legionnaires' disease.

1977.title: Granville railway disaster
1977.summary: Australia's worst railway disaster at Granville leaves 83 people dead.

1977.title: Plane crash in Bosnia
1977.summary: SFR Yugoslavia Prime Minister Džemal Bijedić and others are killed in a plane crash in Bosnia and Herzegovina.

1977.title: Jimmy Carter's inauguration
1977.summary: Jimmy Carter is sworn in as the 39th President of the United States, marking a significant political event.

1977.title: Tennis championships - Wimbledon
1977.summary: Virginia Wade wins the women's singles title in the centenary year of Wimbledon, capturing national attention.

1977.title: Tenerife disaster
1977.summary: A collision between KLM and Pan Am Boeing 747s at Tenerife, Canary Islands, kills 583 people, becoming the deadliest accident in aviation history.

1977.title: Voyager 2 launch
1977.summary: The United States launches the Voyager 2 spacecraft, marking a significant achievement in space exploration.

1978.title: Air India Flight 855 Crash
1978.summary: A Boeing 747 passenger jet crashes off the coast of Bombay, killing 213.

1978.title: Return of the Holy Crown of Hungary
1978.summary: The Holy Crown of Hungary is returned to Hungary from the United States, where it was held since World War II.

1978.title: Assassination of Pedro Joaquín Chamorro Cardenal
1978.summary: Pedro Joaquín Chamorro Cardenal, a critic of the Nicaraguan government, is assassinated; riots erupt against Somoza's government.

1978.title: European Court of Human Rights Ruling
1978.summary: The European Court of Human Rights finds the British government guilty of mistreating prisoners in Northern Ireland, but not guilty of torture.

1978.title: Kosmos 954 Satellite Incident
1978.summary: Soviet satellite Kosmos 954 burns up in Earth's atmosphere, scattering radioactive debris over Canada's Northwest Territories.

1978.title: Great Blizzard of 1978
1978.summary: The Great Blizzard of 1978 strikes the Ohio Valley and Great Lakes, killing 70.

1978.title: Sydney Hilton Hotel Bombing
1978.summary: A bomb explodes outside the Hilton Hotel in Sydney, Australia, killing a policeman and two civilians.

1978.title: Rise of Multiracial Democracy in Rhodesia
1978.summary: Rhodesia announces that it will accept multiracial democracy within 2 years.

1978.title: Launch of Navstar 1
1978.summary: The first global positioning satellite, Navstar 1, is launched by the United States.

1978.title: California Jam II Festival
1978.summary: California Jam II is held, attracting more than 300,000 fans to Ontario Motor Speedway.

1979.title: International Year of the Child
1979.summary: United Nations Secretary-General Kurt Waldheim heralds the start of the International Year of the Child. Many musicians donate to the Music for UNICEF Concert fund, among them ABBA, who write the song Chiquitita to commemorate the event.

1979.title: U.S.-China Relations
1979.summary: In 1979, the United States officially severed diplomatic ties with the Republic of China (Taiwan). This decision marked a significant shift in U.S. foreign policy, turning to view the People's Republic of China as the sole legitimate representative of China.

1979.title: Whiddy Island Disaster
1979.summary: The French tanker Betelgeuse explodes at the Gulf Oil terminal at Bantry, Ireland; 50 are killed.

1979.title: Cambodian–Vietnamese War
1979.summary: The People's Army of Vietnam and Vietnamese-backed Cambodian insurgents announce the fall of Phnom Penh, Cambodia, and the collapse of the Pol Pot regime.

1979.title: Music for UNICEF Concert
1979.summary: The Music for UNICEF Concert is held at the United Nations General Assembly to raise money for UNICEF and promote the Year of the Child. It is broadcast the following day in the United States and around the world, featuring numerous famous performers.

1979.title: Shah flees Iran
1979.summary: Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi flees Iran with his family, relocating to Egypt after a year of turmoil.

1979.title: Deng Xiaoping's Visit to the U.S.
1979.summary: Deng Xiaoping arrives in Washington, D.C., for the first visit of a paramount leader of the People's Republic of China to the United States.

1979.title: Saint Lucia Independence
1979.summary: Saint Lucia becomes independent from the United Kingdom, marking a significant event in the Caribbean's post-colonial history.

1979.title: Iranian Revolution
1979.summary: Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini returns to Tehran, Iran after nearly 15 years of exile, leading to significant changes in Iranian governance.

1979.title: First Direct Elections to the European Parliament
1979.summary: The first direct elections to the European Parliament begin, allowing citizens from across the member states of the European Union to elect their representatives.

1980.title: Grain embargo against the USSR
1980.summary: U.S. President Jimmy Carter proclaims a grain embargo against the USSR with the support of the European Commission.

1980.title: Global Positioning System time epoch begins
1980.summary: Global Positioning System time epoch begins at 00:00 UTC.

1980.title: Beheading of Islamist insurgents
1980.summary: In Saudi Arabia, 63 Islamist insurgents are beheaded for their part in the siege of the Great Mosque in Mecca in November 1979.

1980.title: Indira Gandhi returns to power
1980.summary: Indira Gandhi returns to power as the Prime Minister of India.

1980.title: Bullring collapse in Colombia
1980.summary: At least 200 people are killed when the Corralejas Bullring collapses at Sincelejo, Colombia.

1980.title: London Gold Fixing price high
1980.summary: The London Gold Fixing hits its highest price ever of $843 per troy ounce.

1980.title: Arrest of Andrei Sakharov
1980.summary: Andrei Sakharov, Soviet scientist and human rights activist, is arrested in Moscow.

1980.title: Israel and Egypt establish diplomatic relations
1980.summary: Israel and Egypt establish diplomatic relations.

1980.title: Canadian Caper
1980.summary: Six United States diplomats escape from Tehran, Iran, posing as Canadians.

1980.title: Spanish Embassy burning
1980.summary: The Spanish Embassy in Guatemala is invaded and set on fire, killing 36 people.

1981.title: Greece enters the European Economic Community
1981.summary: Greece officially becomes a part of the European Economic Community, which later evolves into the European Union.

1981.title: Iran hostage crisis comes to an end
1981.summary: Iran releases 52 Americans held for 444 days, occurring minutes after Ronald Reagan is sworn in as the 40th President of the United States.

1981.title: The first DeLorean rolls off the production line
1981.summary: The first DeLorean automobile, a stainless steel sports car with gull-wing doors, begins production in Dunmurry, Northern Ireland.

1981.title: Major earthquake in Sichuan, China
1981.summary: A powerful earthquake with a magnitude of 6.8 strikes Sichuan, China, resulting in the death of 150 people.

1981.title: Stampede at Olympiacos F.C. game
1981.summary: A tragic stampede at a football match in Greece results in the deaths of 20 fans and injures 54 others.

1981.title: Stardust nightclub fire tragedy
1981.summary: A devastating fire at the Stardust nightclub in Dublin, Ireland, kills 48 young people and injures over 200.

1981.title: Pope John Paul II visits Philippines
1981.summary: Pope John Paul II embarks on a significant visit to the Philippines, enhancing his global influence.

1981.title: Assassination attempt on Pope John Paul II
1981.summary: Pope John Paul II is shot at St. Peter's Square in Vatican City but survives the assassination attempt.

1981.title: The launch of MTV
1981.summary: The first 24-hour video music channel, MTV, is launched in the United States, changing the music industry landscape.

1981.title: The assassination of Anwar Sadat
1981.summary: Egyptian President Anwar Sadat is assassinated during a military parade, leading to significant political changes in Egypt.

1982.title: Air Florida Flight 90 crash
1982.summary: Air Florida Flight 90 crashes shortly after takeoff into the 14th Street Bridge in Washington, killing 78 people.

1982.title: The first computer virus found
1982.summary: The first computer virus, the Elk Cloner, is found infecting Apple II computers via floppy disk.

1982.title: Hama massacre begins
1982.summary: The Hama massacre begins in Syria marked by severe violence against civilians.

1982.title: Laker Airways collapse
1982.summary: London-based Laker Airways collapses, leaving 6,000 stranded passengers and with huge debts.

1982.title: Ocean Ranger oil platform disaster
1982.summary: The oil platform Ocean Ranger sinks during a storm off the coast of Newfoundland, killing all 84 rig workers aboard.

1982.title: Falklands War begins
1982.summary: The 1982 invasion of the Falkland Islands begins when Argentine forces land near Stanley, leading to the Falklands War.

1982.title: Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
1982.summary: Canada patriates its constitution, gaining full political independence from the United Kingdom; included is the country's first entrenched bill of rights.

1982.title: First international peace day
1982.summary: The first International Day of Peace is proclaimed by the United Nations, promoting global peace efforts.

1982.title: E.T.: The Extra-Terrestrial released
1982.summary: E.T.: The Extra-Terrestrial is released in the United States; this becomes the biggest box-office hit for the next 11 years.

1982.title: The compact disc introduced
1982.summary: Sony launches the first consumer compact disc (CD) player, marking the start of the CD era in music.

1983.title: The migration of the ARPANET to TCP/IP
1983.summary: The migration of the ARPANET to TCP/IP is officially completed, marking the beginning of the true Internet.

1983.title: Launch of IRAS
1983.summary: IRAS is launched from Vandenberg AFB, conducting the world's first all-sky infrared survey from space.

1983.title: Seikan Tunnel pilot shaft breakthrough
1983.summary: The pilot shaft of the Seikan Tunnel, the world's longest sub-aqueous tunnel, breaks through.

1983.title: The Ash Wednesday bushfires
1983.summary: The Ash Wednesday bushfires in Victoria and South Australia claim the lives of 75 people, marking one of Australia's worst bushfire disasters.

1983.title: Invention of the 3D printer
1983.summary: The 3D printer is invented by Chuck Hull, revolutionizing manufacturing.

1983.title: Launch of the Disney Channel
1983.summary: The Disney Channel launches in the United States, becoming a major entertainment platform.

1983.title: Church Street bombing
1983.summary: A car bombing in Pretoria, South Africa, kills 19 people, planted by members of Umkhonto we Sizwe.

1983.title: The Second Sudanese Civil War
1983.summary: The Second Sudanese Civil War begins, leading to decades of conflict within the country.

1983.title: The introduction of the mobile telephone
1983.summary: The first worldwide mobile telephone, the Motorola DynaTAC, enters the market, changing communication.

1983.title: Beirut barracks bombing
1983.summary: Simultaneous suicide truck-bombings destroy both the French Army and U.S. Marine Corps barracks in Beirut, killing 241 U.S. servicemen.

1984.title: Indira Gandhi Assassination
1984.summary: Prime Minister of India Indira Gandhi is assassinated by her two Sikh security guards in New Delhi. Anti-Sikh riots break out, leaving 10,000 to 20,000 Sikhs dead in Delhi and surrounding areas with the majority populations of Hindus.

1984.title: Bhopal Disaster
1984.summary: A methyl isocyanate leak from a Union Carbide pesticide plant in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh, India, kills more than 8,000 people outright and injures over half a million in the worst industrial disaster in history.

1984.title: 1984 Summer Olympics
1984.summary: The 1984 Summer Olympics are held in Los Angeles, California, showcasing global athletic talent and allowing the United States to emerge as the central stage for international sports.

1984.title: South African National Anthem
1984.summary: Advance Australia Fair is proclaimed as Australia's national anthem and green and gold as the national colours, reflecting a national identity.

1984.title: Soviet Union Boycott of Olympics
1984.summary: The Soviet Union announces that it will boycott the 1984 Summer Olympics in Los Angeles, impacting international sports relations.

1984.title: Operation Blue Star
1984.summary: The Indian government begins Operation Blue Star, the planned attack on the Golden Temple in Amritsar, leading to significant turmoil and unrest.

1984.title: Salyut 7 Space Walk
1984.summary: Cosmonaut Svetlana Savitskaya becomes the first woman to perform a space walk, marking a significant achievement in space exploration.

1984.title: The Terminator Premiere
1984.summary: The science fiction action film The Terminator premieres, directed by James Cameron and starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, influencing popular culture significantly.

1984.title: Live Aid Concert
1984.summary: Band Aid records the charity single Do They Know It's Christmas? in London to raise money to combat the famine in Ethiopia, showcasing global music solidarity.

1984.title: Discovery of Crack Cocaine
1984.summary: Crack cocaine, a smokeable form of the drug, is first introduced into Los Angeles, leading to widespread social and health issues that will affect the U.S.

1985.title: The Internet's Domain Name System is created
1985.summary: Creation of a system that establishes the addressing system for websites, a significant technical advancement in internet infrastructure.

1985.title: Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency launches Sakigake
1985.summary: Launch of Japan's first interplanetary spacecraft, marking a milestone in space exploration for the country.

1985.title: Tancredo Neves elected President of Brazil
1985.summary: Neves's election ends a 21-year military rule in Brazil, signaling a return to democracy.

1985.title: Ronald Reagan is sworn in for a second term
1985.summary: Reagan's inauguration marks the continuation of his presidency in the United States amidst the Cold War.

1985.title: The Economic Cooperation Organization (ECO) is formed
1985.summary: Formation of an organization to promote economic collaboration among member nations, highlighting regional cooperation in Tehran.

1985.title: We Are the World charity single is recorded
1985.summary: A significant music event where top artists come together to raise funds for humanitarian aid in Africa.

1985.title: William J. Schroeder becomes first patient with an artificial heart to leave the hospital
1985.summary: This medical breakthrough demonstrates advancements in cardiac surgery and artificial organ technology.

1985.title: The Provisional Irish Republican Army carries out a mortar attack
1985.summary: A violent incident in Northern Ireland, marking a peak in the ongoing conflict in the region during the Troubles.

1985.title: Mikhail Gorbachev becomes General Secretary
1985.summary: Gorbachev's rise marks a significant leadership change in the Soviet Union, leading to reforms that will impact global politics.

1985.title: Live Aid concert raises funds for famine relief
1985.summary: A historic series of benefit concerts that raise substantial funds and awareness for famine in Ethiopia, showing the power of music for social causes.

1986.title: Aruba gains autonomy
1986.summary: Aruba gains increased autonomy from the Netherlands by separating from the Netherlands Antilles.

1986.title: Voyager 2 encounter with Uranus
1986.summary: The Voyager 2 space probe makes its first encounter with Uranus.

1986.title: Channel Tunnel plans announced
1986.summary: The United Kingdom and France announce plans to construct the Channel Tunnel.

1986.title: Challenger disaster
1986.summary: Space Shuttle Challenger disintegrates 73 seconds after launch from the United States, killing the crew of seven astronauts, including schoolteacher Christa McAuliffe.

1986.title: People Power Revolution begins
1986.summary: The People Power Revolution begins in the Philippines to remove President Ferdinand Marcos from office.

1986.title: Chernobyl disaster
1986.summary: A mishandled safety test at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant in Pripyat, Ukrainian SSR, Soviet Union killed at least 4,056 people and damaged almost $7 billion of property.

1986.title: Founding of Pixar
1986.summary: Pixar is founded by John Lasseter along with Steve Jobs.

1986.title: Hands Across America
1986.summary: At least 5,000,000 people form a human chain from New York City to Long Beach, California, to raise money to fight hunger and homelessness.

1986.title: Soviet Union launches Mir
1986.summary: The Soviet Union launches the Mir space station.

1986.title: Rutan Voyager completes flight
1986.summary: Rutan Voyager completes the first nonstop circumnavigation of the earth by air without refueling in 9 days, 3 minutes and 44 seconds.

1987.title: Battle of Fada
1987.summary: The Chadian army destroys a Libyan armoured brigade.

1987.title: 1987 Maryland train collision
1987.summary: An Amtrak train en route from Washington, D.C. to Boston collides with Conrail engines at Chase, Maryland, killing 16 people.

1987.title: Retirement of Hu Yaobang
1987.summary: Hu Yaobang, General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party, is forced into retirement by political conservatives.

1987.title: Kidnapping of Leon Febres Cordero
1987.summary: León Febres Cordero, president of Ecuador, is kidnapped for 11 hours by followers of imprisoned general Frank Vargas, who successfully demand the latter's release.

1987.title: Terry Waite kidnapped in Beirut
1987.summary: Terry Waite, the special envoy of the Archbishop of Canterbury in Lebanon, is kidnapped in Beirut.

1987.title: Forsyth County protests
1987.summary: About 20,000 protestors marched in a civil rights demonstration in Forsyth County, Georgia, United States.

1987.title: Opening of the first Starbucks outside the US
1987.summary: The first Starbucks outside of the US is opened in Vancouver, Canada.

1987.title: Zeebrugge disaster
1987.summary: Roll-on/roll-off cross-channel ferry MS Herald of Free Enterprise capsizes off Zeebrugge harbor in Belgium; 193 people die.

1987.title: Michael Jackson releases Bad
1987.summary: Michael Jackson releases Bad, his first studio album since Thriller, the best-selling album of all time.

1987.title: King's Cross fire
1987.summary: The King's Cross fire on the London Underground kills 31 people and injures a further 100.

1988.title: Khian Sea toxic waste dumping
1988.summary: The cargo ship Khian Sea deposits 4,000 tons of toxic waste in Haiti after wandering around the Atlantic for sixteen months.

1988.title: Soviet Union's Perestroika program
1988.summary: The Soviet Union begins its program of economic restructuring (perestroika) with legislation initiated by Premier Mikhail Gorbachev.

1988.title: Battle for Hill 3234
1988.summary: In the Afghan War, 39 men of the Soviet Airborne Troops fight off an attack by 200 to 250 Mujahideen in the Battle for Hill 3234.

1988.title: President Lee Teng-hui takes office
1988.summary: Vice-president Lee Teng-hui takes over as President of the Republic of China and Chairman of the Kuomintang.

1988.title: Nagorno-Karabakh votes for secession
1988.summary: The Nagorno-Karabakh Autonomous Oblast votes to secede from the Azerbaijan Soviet Socialist Republic and join the Armenian SSR, initiating conflict.

1988.title: Start of Anfal campaign
1988.summary: Launching of a genocidal counterinsurgency operation against Kurds in Iraq led by Iraqi forces under Saddam Hussein.

1988.title: Halabja chemical attack
1988.summary: The Halabja chemical attack is carried out by Iraqi government forces, resulting in significant civilian casualties.

1988.title: Soviet Union's withdrawal from Afghanistan
1988.summary: In the Geneva Accords, the Soviet Union commits itself to withdraw of its forces from Afghanistan.

1988.title: UST's Operation Praying Mantis
1988.summary: The United States Navy retaliates for the USS Samuel B. Roberts mining with Operation Praying Mantis, striking Iranian targets.

1988.title: Spitak earthquake
1988.summary: In Soviet Armenia, the Spitak earthquake kills nearly 25,000, injures 31,000 and leaves 400,000 homeless.

1989.title: The Fall of the Berlin Wall
1989.summary: Günter Schabowski accidentally announces that East Germany will open checkpoints in the Berlin Wall, allowing citizens to travel freely to West Germany, marking the end of division in Europe.

1989.title: Tiananmen Square Protests
1989.summary: A violent military crackdown occurs on pro-democracy protesters in Tiananmen Square, Beijing, resulting in numerous deaths and international condemnation.

1989.title: Solidarity's Victory in Poland
1989.summary: Solidarity movement's victory in the Polish legislative election marks the beginning of anti-communist revolutions in Central and Eastern Europe.

1989.title: Loma Prieta Earthquake
1989.summary: A 6.9 magnitude earthquake shakes the San Francisco Bay Area, killing 63 people and interrupting the 1989 World Series.

1989.title: Chernobyl disaster
1989.summary: The nuclear power plant accident in Chernobyl, Ukraine, releases large quantities of radioactive particles into the atmosphere, raising global health and safety concerns.

1989.title: The End of the Soviet-Afghan War
1989.summary: The last Soviet armored column leaves Kabul, ending nine years of military occupation and leading to significant political changes in Afghanistan.

1989.title: Exxon Valdez Oil Spill
1989.summary: In Alaska, the Exxon Valdez oil tanker spills 240,000 barrels of oil into Prince William Sound, causing one of the worst environmental disasters in U.S. history.

1989.title: Launch of the World Wide Web
1989.summary: Tim Berners-Lee produces a proposal that becomes the foundation for the World Wide Web, altering the way information is shared globally.

1989.title: Coup in Paraguay
1989.summary: A military coup in Paraguay overthrows Alfredo Stroessner, ending his 35-year dictatorship, and initiating a transition towards democracy.

1989.title: Formation of the Arab Maghreb Union
1989.summary: African nations, including Algeria, Libya, Mauritania, Morocco, and Tunisia, establish the Arab Maghreb Union to promote economic integration and cooperation.

1990.title: U.S. invasion of Panama
1990.summary: General Manuel Noriega is deposed as leader of Panama and surrenders to the American forces.

1990.title: Black January
1990.summary: Soviet troops occupy Baku, Azerbaijan SSR, killing over 130 protesters who were demonstrating for independence.

1990.title: Release of Nelson Mandela
1990.summary: Nelson Mandela is released from Victor Verster Prison, near Cape Town, South Africa, after 27 years behind bars.

1990.title: Singing Revolution
1990.summary: The Lithuanian SSR declares independence from the Soviet Union with the Act of the Re-Establishment of the State of Lithuania.

1990.title: German reunification
1990.summary: An agreement is reached for a two-stage plan to reunite Germany, leading to significant geopolitical changes in Europe.

1990.title: Exxon Valdez oil spill
1990.summary: Exxon and its shipping company are indicted on 5 criminal counts.

1990.title: Launch of the Hubble Space Telescope
1990.summary: The Hubble Space Telescope is launched aboard Space Shuttle Discovery, revolutionizing astronomy.

1990.title: First McDonald's in Moscow
1990.summary: The first McDonald's in Moscow opens, marking a significant moment in the spread of Western culture in post-Soviet Russia.

1990.title: Estonian independence
1990.summary: The Estonian SSR restores the formal name of the country, the Republic of Estonia, as well as national emblems.

1990.title: First multiparty elections in Slovenia
1990.summary: The Socialist Republic of Slovenia holds Yugoslavia's first multiparty election since 1938, marking a shift away from communist rule.

1991.title: Czechoslovakia Abandons Command Economy
1991.summary: Czechoslovakia becomes the second Eastern European country to abandon its command economy.

1991.title: South Ossetia War Begins
1991.summary: Georgian troops attack Tskhinvali, the capital of South Ossetia, starting the 1991-92 South Ossetia War.

1991.title: Haitian Coup Attempt
1991.summary: An attempted coup by the Tonton Macoute against the democratically elected government is thwarted in Haiti.

1991.title: Gulf War: Baker Meets Aziz
1991.summary: U.S. Secretary of State James Baker meets with Iraqi Foreign Minister Tariq Aziz but fails to produce a withdrawal plan from Kuwait.

1991.title: Singing Revolution: Soviet Forces Storm Vilnius
1991.summary: Soviet forces storm Vilnius to stop Lithuanian independence, killing civilians and injuring hundreds.

1991.title: Operation Desert Storm Begins
1991.summary: The Gulf War: Operation Desert Storm begins with air strikes against Iraq.

1991.title: Iraq Fires Scud Missiles
1991.summary: Iraq fires Scud missiles into Israel, injuring numerous people.

1991.title: Gulf War: British SAS Deploy
1991.summary: The British Army SAS patrol, Bravo Two Zero, is deployed in Iraq during the Gulf War.

1991.title: Peace Agreement in Papua New Guinea
1991.summary: The government of Papua New Guinea signs a peace agreement with Bougainville Island separatists, ending long-standing fighting.

1991.title: Gulf War: Cease-Fire Declaration
1991.summary: U.S. President Bush declares victory over Iraq and orders a cease-fire, marking an end to major combat operations in the Gulf War.

1992.title: Boutros Boutros-Ghali replaces Javier Pérez de Cuéllar
1992.summary: Boutros Boutros-Ghali of Egypt replaces Javier Pérez de Cuéllar of Peru as United Nations Secretary-General.

1992.title: Proclamation of Nagorno-Karabakh Republic
1992.summary: The Nagorno-Karabakh Republic is proclaimed by the Armenians of Nagorno-Karabakh.

1992.title: Georgian coup d'état
1992.summary: President of Georgia Zviad Gamsakhurdia flees the country as a result of the military coup.

1992.title: Helicopter downing by Yugoslav Air Force
1992.summary: A Yugoslav Air Force Mikoyan-Gurevich MiG-21 attacks two Italian Army helicopters carrying observers from the European Community Monitor Mission, resulting in one crash and five deaths.

1992.title: Bosnian Serbs declare their own republic
1992.summary: Bosnian Serbs declare their own republic within Bosnia and Herzegovina, protesting the Bosniaks and Bosnian Croats' decision to seek European recognition.

1992.title: Breakup of Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia
1992.summary: The Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia begins to break up; Slovenia and Croatia gain independence and international recognition in some Western countries.

1992.title: Chapultepec Peace Accords
1992.summary: El Salvador officials and rebel leaders sign the Chapultepec Peace Accords in Mexico City, ending the 12-year Salvadoran Civil War that claimed at least 75,000 lives.

1992.title: First confirmed detection of exoplanets
1992.summary: First confirmed detection of exoplanets announced by radio astronomers Aleksander Wolszczan and Dale Frail working in the United States.

1992.title: Maastricht Treaty signed
1992.summary: The Maastricht Treaty is signed, founding the European Union.

1992.title: Freddie Mercury Tribute Concert
1992.summary: The Freddie Mercury Tribute Concert is held at Wembley Stadium, televised live and raising millions for AIDS research.

1993.title: Dissolution of Czechoslovakia
1993.summary: Czechoslovakia ceases to exist, as the Czech Republic and Slovakia separate.

1993.title: Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty
1993.summary: Presidents George H. W. Bush and Boris Yeltsin sign the second Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty in Moscow.

1993.title: Brink's Armored Car Depot Robbery
1993.summary: US$7.4 million is stolen from the Brink's Armored Car Depot in Rochester, New York.

1993.title: MV Braer Oil Spill
1993.summary: MV Braer, a Liberian-registered oil tanker, runs aground off the Shetland Islands, causing a massive oil spill.

1993.title: Bombay Riots
1993.summary: The Bombay riots take place in Mumbai.

1993.title: Ghana's Fourth Republic Inaugurated
1993.summary: The Fourth Republic of Ghana is inaugurated, with Jerry Rawlings as president.

1993.title: The Chemical Weapons Convention
1993.summary: The Chemical Weapons Convention (CWC) is signed.

1993.title: MS Jan Heweliusz Sinking
1993.summary: The Polish ferry MS Jan Heweliusz sinks off the coast of Rügen in the Baltic Sea, killing 54 people.

1993.title: World Trade Center Bombing
1993.summary: In New York City, a van bomb explodes below the North Tower of the World Trade Center, killing six people and injuring over one thousand.

1993.title: 1993 Bombay Bombings
1993.summary: Several bombs explode in Bombay, India, killing 257 and injuring hundreds.

1994.title: North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) Established
1994.summary: The North American Free Trade Agreement is established, creating a trilateral trade bloc between Canada, Mexico, and the United States, impacting economies and music industries in the region.

1994.title: End of Broadcasting Ban on IRA
1994.summary: The Irish government announces the end of a 15-year broadcasting ban on the Provisional Irish Republican Army and its political arm Sinn Féin, reflecting significant political changes in media representation.

1994.title: Kremlin Accords Signed
1994.summary: U.S. President Bill Clinton and Russian President Boris Yeltsin sign the Kremlin accords, which halt preprogrammed nuclear targeting, marking a pivotal moment in U.S.-Russia relations.

1994.title: Northridge Earthquake
1994.summary: The 6.7 Mw Northridge earthquake strikes Greater Los Angeles, leaving 57 dead and over 8,700 injured, causing widespread devastation in California.

1994.title: Markale Massacres
1994.summary: A Bosnian Serb Army mortar shell kills 68 civilians in a Sarajevo marketplace, highlighting the intense violence during the Bosnian War.

1994.title: First Photo of Pluto and Charon
1994.summary: The first photo of Pluto and its moon Charon is revealed, expanding knowledge in astronomy and capturing public interest.

1994.title: Rwandan Genocide Begins
1994.summary: The Rwandan genocide begins in Kigali, resulting from the assassination of the Rwandan President, leading to significant humanitarian crises.

1994.title: Nelson Mandela Elected President
1994.summary: South Africa holds its first non-racial elections, and Nelson Mandela is elected as the first black president, marking a historic milestone in racial reconciliation.

1994.title: Channel Tunnel Opens
1994.summary: The Channel Tunnel officially opens between England and France, allowing for direct rail travel, enhancing cultural and economic ties between the nations.

1994.title: First Internet Radio Broadcast
1994.summary: WXYC at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill provides the world's first internet radio broadcast, marking a significant moment in media history.

1995.title: Establishment of WTO
1995.summary: The World Trade Organization is established to replace the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade.

1995.title: Far Side Comic Strip Ends
1995.summary: The final The Far Side comic strip is printed in newspapers, concluding a 15-year run by creator Gary Larson.

1995.title: EU Expansion
1995.summary: Austria, Finland, and Sweden join the European Union.

1995.title: Valeri Polyakov Space Record
1995.summary: Valeri Polyakov completes 366 days in space aboard the Mir space station, breaking a duration record.

1995.title: World Youth Day in Manila
1995.summary: The World Youth Day 1995 festival is held in Manila, Philippines, with 5 million people gathering for John Paul II's mass.

1995.title: Great Hanshin Earthquake
1995.summary: The 6.9 Great Hanshin earthquake hits southern Hyōgo Prefecture of Japan, resulting in over 5,500 deaths and many more displaced.

1995.title: Norwegian Rocket Incident
1995.summary: A rocket launched from Norway is misinterpreted by Russia as an incoming attack, creating international tension.

1995.title: Oklahoma City Bombing
1995.summary: A car bomb explodes outside a Federal building in Oklahoma City, resulting in 168 fatalities.

1995.title: Release of Saquinavir
1995.summary: The FDA approves Saquinavir, the first protease inhibitor to treat HIV/AIDS, marking a significant advancement in medical treatment.

1995.title: Srebrenica Massacre
1995.summary: In the Srebrenica massacre, thousands of Bosniak men and boys are killed by the Army of Republika Srpska during the Bosnian War.

1996.title: Zairean cargo plane crash
1996.summary: A Zairean cargo plane crashes into a crowded market in Kinshasa, killing around 300 people.

1996.title: Earthquake near Lijiang
1996.summary: A 6.6 Mw earthquake near Lijiang in South-west China kills up to 322 people, injures 17,000, and leaves 300,000 homeless.

1996.title: Birgenair Flight 301 crash
1996.summary: Birgenair Flight 301 crashes into the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of the Dominican Republic, killing all 189 passengers and crew.

1996.title: Dunblane Massacre
1996.summary: A former shopkeeper opens fire in Dunblane Primary School, killing sixteen pupils and one teacher before committing suicide.

1996.title: TAM Flight 402 crash
1996.summary: TAM Flight 402 crashes into a densely populated area of São Paulo, killing all 96 people on board.

1996.title: Colombo Central Bank bombing
1996.summary: An explosives-filled truck bombs the Central Bank in Colombo, killing at least 86 people and injuring 1,400.

1996.title: Operation Grapes of Wrath
1996.summary: The Israeli government launches massive attacks on Lebanon in retaliation for terrorist attacks, sparking a series of retaliations.

1996.title: Port Arthur massacre
1996.summary: Martin Bryant kills 35 people at the Port Arthur tourist site in Tasmania, Australia.

1996.title: Cyclone strikes Andhra Pradesh
1996.summary: A category 4 cyclone strikes Andhra Pradesh, India, killing at least 1,000 people.

1996.title: Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty
1996.summary: The Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty is signed, aiming to ban all nuclear tests worldwide.

1997.title: The Emergency Alert System Introduction
1997.summary: The Emergency Alert System is introduced in the United States.

1997.title: Cypriot Missile Crisis
1997.summary: Turkey threatens Cyprus on account of a deal to buy Russian S-300 missiles, prompting the Cypriot Missile Crisis.

1997.title: Delta II Rocket Explosion
1997.summary: A Delta II rocket carrying a military GPS payload explodes shortly after liftoff from Cape Canaveral.

1997.title: Hutu Militia Attack in Rwanda
1997.summary: Hutu militia members kill 6 Spanish aid workers and three soldiers, and seriously wound another in northwest Rwanda.

1997.title: Bill Clinton's Second Term
1997.summary: Bill Clinton is sworn in for a second term as President of the United States.

1997.title: Madeleine Albright Confirmation
1997.summary: Madeleine Albright becomes the first female Secretary of State of the United States, after confirmation by the United States Senate.

1997.title: Tragic Helicopter Collision
1997.summary: Two Israeli troop-transport helicopters collide, killing all 73 on board.

1997.title: Hubble Space Telescope Repairs Begin
1997.summary: Tune-up and repair work on the Hubble Space Telescope is started by astronauts from the Space Shuttle Discovery.

1997.title: North Hollywood Shootout
1997.summary: Two robbers injure 20 police officers and civilians in a gun battle, sparking debate on police armament.

1997.title: U.S. Cloning Research Ban
1997.summary: U.S. President Bill Clinton bans federal funding for any research on human cloning.

1998.title: Lunar Prospector Launched
1998.summary: The Lunar Prospector spacecraft is launched into orbit around the Moon, later finding evidence for frozen water in soil in permanently shadowed craters near the Moon's poles.

1998.title: Sidi-Hamed Massacre
1998.summary: Over 100 people are killed in the Sidi-Hamed massacre in Algeria.

1998.title: Human Cloning Ban
1998.summary: Nineteen European nations agree to forbid human cloning.

1998.title: Clinton-Lewinsky Scandal
1998.summary: The Drudge Report breaks the story about U.S. President Bill Clinton's alleged affair with Monica Lewinsky, leading to his impeachment by the House of Representatives.

1998.title: Cavalese Cable Car Disaster
1998.summary: A United States military pilot causes the deaths of 20 people near Trento, Italy, when his low-flying EA-6B Prowler severs the cable of a cable-car.

1998.title: Afghanistan Earthquake
1998.summary: The 5.9 Mw Afghanistan earthquake shakes the Takhar Province resulting in up to 4,000 killed and 818 injured; damage is considered extreme.

1998.title: 1998 Winter Olympics
1998.summary: The 1998 Winter Olympics are held in Nagano, Japan.

1998.title: Iraq Disarmament Negotiations
1998.summary: Iraqi President Saddam Hussein negotiates a deal with U.N. Secretary General Kofi Annan, allowing weapons inspectors to return to Baghdad, preventing military action by the United States and Britain.

1998.title: Oued Bouaicha Massacre
1998.summary: Fifty-two people are killed with axes and knives in Algeria, including 32 babies under the age of two.

1998.title: Good Friday Agreement
1998.summary: The Belfast Agreement is signed between the Irish and British governments and most Northern Ireland political parties, marking a significant peace process.

1999.title: The establishment of the euro currency
1999.summary: The euro currency is established and the European Central Bank assumes its full powers.

1999.title: The Mars Polar Lander launch
1999.summary: The Mars Polar Lander is launched by NASA.

1999.title: The Colombia earthquake
1999.summary: The 6.2 Mw Colombia earthquake hits western Colombia, killing at least 1,900.

1999.title: Abdullah II inherits the throne of Jordan
1999.summary: Abdullah II inherits the throne of Jordan, following the death of his father King Hussein.

1999.title: Bill Clinton acquitted
1999.summary: U.S. President Bill Clinton is acquitted in impeachment proceedings in the United States Senate.

1999.title: Kurdish protests across Europe
1999.summary: Across Europe, Kurdish protestors take over embassies and hold hostages after Turkey arrests one of their rebel leaders.

1999.title: First NATO airstrikes
1999.summary: NATO launches air strikes against the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia, marking the first time NATO has attacked a sovereign state.

1999.title: Columbine High School massacre
1999.summary: Two Littleton, Colorado teenagers open fire on their teachers and classmates, killing 12 students and 1 teacher, and then themselves.

1999.title: NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory launch
1999.summary: NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory is launched to observe X-rays from high-energy regions of the universe.

1999.title: Handover of Macau to China
1999.summary: Handover of Macau from the Portuguese Republic to the People's Republic of China after 442 years of Portuguese rule in the settlement.
